text: Grabbed a bite to eat before rushing off to a show and Joseph went above and beyond to provide amazing service. Food came quick and was delicious! Great restaurant if you're staying in or near the SLS!!

Friends and I are at the SLS for a business event. We chose the Northside Cafe for mealtime...We were so glad we did! Everyone at the table had complimentary things to say about their meals! I ordered a cheese sandwich (mmmm-mm yummy provolone) and a roasted tomato soup. The pesto garnish was delicious. I sampled my husbands Asian dish and it was tasty too. The Jasmine rice was moist, the chicken and sweet and sour sauce was good too. The service was really on point thank you Joseph. We noted suddenly that we had run out of time and Joseph helped to get the check handled. Another thing I enjoyed was having the staff ask about our experience as well...Louis the assistant general Mgr was there when I asked for a business card. He was interactive was wanting to make sure we were being helped. This staff seems to work well together.... And we were able to get out the door and on to business. Such a great example of being concerned for  the customers needs. We will definately be back

Server was sweet & our food was good. The price was too much for the food though. Our server gave us a $1 less change than she was supposed to but I have noticed that more than once in Vegas. We would have liked to see just a few items for children. There are zero.

Probably better than three stars in most key categories; location, selection and flavor but the service is not great, mostly because they are constantly understaffed. More importantly, the portions are really skimpy for the prices. A $13.00 Quesadilla is one small tortilla folded in half with a teaspoon of pico and guacamole. I couldn't believe they could serve it with a straight face, whatever, poor value is poor value. Cutting cost where it impacts quality is rarely a good business decision.
Atmosphere was very pleasant. Our waiter was friendly and courteous, and the food was well-prepared, and tasty.

The food is delicious!! For Vegas the prices are very reasonable. It's located inside of the SLS Hotel and Casino. The ambiance is laid back, come as you are. We ate there several times. I had the corn beef and hash, the corn beef was good quality and tasty but I was not crazy about the potatoes. I normally like them with a little golden crisp. I also had the chilies quiles and the salmon with lemon butter sauce and garlic mashed potatoes, on separate occasions, and it was absolutely delicious!! The servers were very friendly. I can't wait to dine there again when I visit Vegas.

Just had breakfast with my husband at NorthSide Cafe, it was busy at 10am. Christian was our server, he recommended us the philly cheese steak, and it blew us away like *ka pow* , their portion was crazy and I couldn't be more happier. ( we also had cobb salad and breakfast burritos and they were delicious as well) We love staying at SLS hotel and will definitely come back next year!

Went to the Northside Cafe for breakfast this morning. It was wonderful. I had the chilaquiles verdes which are basically like breakfast nachos with chorizo and pico. It was delicious and and very filling. Our servers name was Joseph T. and he was fantastic. Had great reccomendations and was very attentive. He never let our coffee cups go dry. If you go make sure to try the chile on your plate. It is spicy but has fantastic flavor. Sit in Joseph's section and he will hook you up with some whipped cream foe the heat.

This place was absolutely awful.  The service was the worst service I got my entire trip to Vegas, and that's not a nice thing to say because the service everywhere was slow and not attentive.  The amount of time it took to get anything - a drink order, the server to come back to take our food order, our actual food, I think the bill was the longest wait of all!  I would have rather spent time at the pool eating some snacks than at this restaurant for 2 hours... And the food was terrible.  I got an omelet and it tasted like garbage.  There were 10 of us in our group and nobody was impressed.  I was shocked to see such high ratings here.

This place got me sick with the raw pork...  And I saw it coming after discovering the wonton was undercooked
Now I'm racing back to LA before "it" happens.

Amazing staff, specially Tina. She went above and beyond to accommodate us. I would return here more often because of her. She is very friendly and attentive. Great food. For the best dessert, you got to try the croissant bread pudding.
Joseph T. Was great!  Really enjoyed a hearty breakfast. Chicken tenders and Huevos Rancheros were really good.

Umm, I think we had breakfast here every single day. The food was GREAT. The service was amazing one day, and lousy the next (but the lousy day wasn't bad, as there was someone to pick up the slack). The food was amazing and I'd go back to Vegas just to eat here every single day. I'll be sure to stay at the SLS just so access to the Northside Caf√© is an elevator ride away.

First off, I love the SLS hotel, and the fact that this restaurant is open 24 hours at this hotel is great! Perfect place to hit up after the club and go crash in your room after, or to grab breakfast in the morning without having to drive anywhere. Everything on the menu is good so unfortunately I can not name plates. The sweet potato fries are delicious and they have the best mashed potato I've ever had! The staff is a tad bit slow sometimes but ehh the food makes up for it.
The people that sat behind us came in 10 min after us and got there food before us. They ordered omelets and we had French toast and pancakes. Server sucked

I really wish I could give a higher rating overall, but there weren't many positive things about my experience. This review isn't meant to be negative but simply informative. 

Specific ratings

Decor-5
Waitress-3
Potatoes-1
Pancakes-0
Bacon-0

As an avid SLS fan (I often visit the Beverly Hills location as well as the South Beach property (I was looking forward to luxury in Las Vegas.

The decor is absolutely gorgeous. It's a great mixture of modern trendiness with sleek elegance. It's spacious and easy to navigate to the restaurant. Bonus points for being 24 hours. 

The waitress was friendly and attentive, although not very knowledgeable about the SPG/Starwood Rewards program. 

My husband and I ordered pancakes, bacon and potatoes. The pancakes field entire plate, but had some type of generic butter. The butter tasted more like oil and butter. Another disappointment was the syrup. Not a recognizable name brand but a type of liquid make sure that was horrific. The pancakes had a doughy consistency that was so unpleasant, both my husband and I refused to eat more than 3 bites each.  Why have pancakes if they aren't sweet? 

The bacon was thick but had over 50% fat, so that wasn't edible either. The potatoes would have been decent if they had served while still hot and had some type of seasoning. 

My overall experience was so disappointing that I felt compelled to write this review. The experience didn't not live up to the image and expectations I have for SLS properties.

The guests behind our booth had the same experience with their food and ate even less of the pancakes then we did.

I can't say that I would recommend this restaurant, even for those looking for a basic late night meal. 

I will be back this year in either July or September as I didn't get a chance to check out the gorgeous Fred Segal shoe boutique inside the SLS hotel.

Today is our 25th wedding anniversary minus 1 day. We have been to many restaurants over the years.  while ordering, we requested the food be served HOT. Our server Stephanie acknowledged our request and delivered. My husband acknowledged the meal was hot. He continued to comment throughout the meal that it was still hot.  THANK YOU STEPHANIE for making this doing experience amazing.

We were a party of 9 for brunch.  The restaurant were not busy but split into 2 booths. We ordered both breakfast and lunch items.  Everything was delicious and the service was great.  Definitely a hidden gem in Vegas!
Luciano GeSualdo and the whole staff at Northside Cafe were friendly and accommodating. Recommend ordering the Pineapple Margarita from Luciano and there food is great too!

Our waitress Maria was super sweet and nice.  But if it weren't for the two free meals I would have complained.  My friend got the surf and turf for 29.95 she said the flavor was on point but the portion size was ridiculous and the sweet potato fries were excellent.  I got the ribeye and it was full of fat and the garlic mashed potatoes were gummy.

Food here is reasonable priced and the food taste great. During my stay I had the grill cheese and tomato soup, chicken tenders, buffalo wings, carnitas hash, and nachos.

I like that they add a spicy pepper on some of the dishes for looks and provide enough kick to get your taste buds watering from the heat.

Service is good and they are open 24 hours.
My favorite is the French toast and omelet!  I came here one year ago and food was amazing!  Today food was okay and the portion were ALLOT smaller!!! Bit annoyed at all the sls restaurant changes!
Delicious. Excellent. The food was great. The waitress was even greater. There 24 hours. I'm definitely coming back.

Went here a few times with my boyfriend because we were staying in SLS. The nachos were delicious along with the chilachiles, dimsum, and burgers. The best service we had was by Nick the bartender. He kept my boyfriend happy with consistent orders of his Jack n Cokes, and he made me an AMF that was delicious and strong.

Worst service ever. Ordered my food - got the oatmeal. Never had milk brought out with it. When I finally got our the attention of our food runner, I asked him some milk for my oatmeal and he looked at me as if I was asking him to pour OJ in my bowl and rudely responded with a "yeah".  Waited another 10 minutes to finally flag our waiter but by then I just wanted to leave. My whole party had finished eating. Never again.

So, how would you define shithole ... Poor service and subpar food... Well, you got it there... Not many neighborhood dive bars can " rise" to that standard... Food was cold.. Like really cold and we asked for milk 3 times ( mind you, place was nearly empty) and got nada... Really, star minus

Went for a Sunday morning breakfast while on vacation. One of the best coffee we had all trip!  Our server CHRISTIAN, even went out of his way to top off the wife's cappuccino with the letters "SLS" in foam!  Top notch service!

Food was good, I had breakfast, but my host Mercedes was even better. Extremely accommodating since I had my two little monsters with me and helped me procure some essential daddy products. Nice to see real people in a party city! She's very cute with a nice smile too so that helps brighten up the day.

(Im writing for my grandmother)
It was a memorable experience for my friend and I. Our server, Christian Santos, was very attentive and cheerful. The food was good, but our waiter made it a pleasant time. He really knew how to deal with people! Excellent service.

Under staffed 
Tables not cleaned and restaurant manager had a attitude!! Not great way to start evening ..
However we got Sunny for our waitress..
Just great!! 
I will test food and write more..
I have to say we ordered Chinese .. it was pretty darn good!
Still very understaffed!!!
Our waitress was running her butt off and continued to give us great service.. but many other tables didn't have Sonny for a waitressz
Great food, had the filet with shrimp scampi. French pressed coffee and great service from Christian!

Service was top notch! Jim was engaging and offered great suggestions.  The food was generous and delicious! I am a local who doesn't care to eat on the Strip but this has to be a new go to breakfast spot for me!!

Sub-par at best. The Chinese food is so so but the service is even worse. Had to ask for a server after 10 minutes of sitting at the table watching people pass us. The server forgot our chips and guacamole and when I asked for recommendations on a meal he literally just pointed at some things on the menu-but didn't describe anything. Plus he was suuuuper slow with the ticket-as I watched him at the host stand talking and I was trying to pay and get out. Ugh.

This is my second time going to Northshore. While I love the breakfast burrito with Chorizo, the service is terrible. Both separate stays we waited for awhile after being seated for our server to come to our table. The food came out quickly, but there were several tables left with food on them. Management, servers and other staff walked by them several times and didn't clear them. Then after waiting forever for my husband to get a refill on his drink, the server brought the check. Then she came back right away and wanted it back, I found that funny. If you want better service go somewhere else, but food is good.
Cashew chicken was so good, also good  prices on drink special.   Thank you Juan, you were great.

I'm. A huge fan of all day breakfast, Chinese,  certain Mexican dishes and unique appetizers and Northside has it all. It's almost like they took the best selections of everything and then created a menu around it. I'm sure you'll find something everyone can enjoy, I certainly did. We had orange chicken, eggs Bennedict and banana pancakes and all 3 were absolutely delicious!

Came in for breakfast this morning with my husband. There was a little bit of a wait so we decided to dine at the bar. We were greeted by Eddie amd he started us off with two bloody marys. We needed some more time to look at the menu since it was our first visit. Eddie suggested the buttermilk pancakes and bacon, which we decided to try. They were amazingly delicious. We haven't had this type of hispitality in a long time. Eddie was very friendly and helped guide us through the menu. He made us feel at home. Whenever  we are in Vegas, we will stop by Northside Cafe for the hospitality and great food.

I loved my dinner.  I ordered the New York Steak with French Fries and a Mixed Green Salad.  The NY Steak was outstanding.  Not one of those huge steaks that overwhelms you, but just the right size.  It was perfectly cooked, tender and very flavorful. Simple but excellent. The fries were freshly cooked and served hot. Very tasty. The mixed green salad was also great. A generous portion of spring mixed lettuce served with carrots, tomatoes, goat cheese crumbles and just the right amount of dressing -- a nice red wine vinaigrette.  For dessert, I had a piece of warm apple pie with vanilla ice cream. It seemed homemade and tasted like Grandma had just finished baking it.  The bill for all this and a beer was surprisingly reasonable -- under $45 -- and the service was great.  This is an attractive restaurant with the feel of an upscale diner within the new SLS Las Vegas Hotel.  The overall environment is outstanding.  I can't wait to go back to the Northside Cafe.  The menu had plenty of other appealing choices and I want to sample them all.
First time here very good service excellent food. No chatty patty waiters all professional enjoyed it!!
Went for dinner. Had a great great experience. Nicole our waitress was amazing. looking forward to going back again. The food and drinks were really really good

We went in for a party of 6 at 5:30am there was no wait and the hostess sat us right after a 10 min wait. Lola was our server and she served us two eggs and some French toast. French toast wasn't on the menu but jessica the manger agreed to make us the French toast. Our service was quick and on point! Great for a fight weekend!!! Congrats Northside Cafe!!!! Thank you!
Place was well organized and neat, food was very flavorful plus Nick the bartender made me one of the best old fashioned, thumbs up!
food was on point. just like are server was with us. maria took care of us. will be back on my next trip . also here eyebrows where on fleek

Our group spent the week in Las Vegas for Con Expo and we had a standing reservation for our entire stay at the Northside Cafe for our morning meeting and breakfast.  The food was outstanding but the staff was superb.  Nakisha was amazing.  Our group of 11 to 14 (depending on the day) was astounded that on the second morning that we were there she could remember their orders and have it waiting as they walked in.  Personally, I enjoyed her infectious smile and fantastic attitude.  Hands down, this was one of the best dining experiences that I have had.  Considering that I travel almost on a weekly basis, that is a sincere complement.
Nice food and service! christian Santos, promptly greated us and was more then accommodating  that our drinks were served fast,. He's very polite and friendly!

We ordered the Chinese food and it was GREAT! It was so DELICIOUS that we took more food to go. Tina was our server and she was AWESOME, very inviting and gracious.  She went out of her way to make us feel special and important.   One of the best cafe experiences Ever!  THANK YOU TINA, NORTHSIDE AND STAFF!

Ismael was very attentive and efficient. I ordered carne Asada bowl. It was really good. The flavor of the meat took me back to a memory I had when I was a little girl and my dad use to make steak and eggs. My husband had the fish tacos and said they tasted fresh and flavorful. We highly recommend this place.

Great place for breakfast! Healthy and delicious food, good service: fast and courteous people like Ismael made for a nice environment. My husband and I went here for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed it. We would like service like this everywhere...that's not too much to ask for  :D

I had the pleasure of dining at the North side Cafe on Monday, August 19th. The food was delicious ~ I was very pleased with the Seared Pacific Salmon. Very gourmet! My friend really enjoyed the Chicken Milanese and there was plenty of it!  
     I also partook in a mean drink made by Peter, the bartender. These drinks are well worth your $$$ ~ my pineapple margarita was high quality at a very good price. I will be sure to return soon!!!

There are very few times in life when you can walk into a restaurant (starving) Let the server order what he thinks is best on the menu and NAIL IT!!!! Thank you Juan M for ordering a Reuben sandwich and sweet potato fries.
My friend and I were hungry for  Chinese, we were not disappointed - the stir-fried udon noodles with shrimp were wonderful!  Our server Juan was great!  Would definitely come back.

This is basically a diner that adds some Chinese options at dinner time. I was kind of shocked that the Chinese food doesn't come with rice. Really, I have to pay extra for rice? 

The best thing it has going for it is that it's open more frequently than the other eating options at SLS. It gets very crowded at breakfast and the staff just can't keep up.

Its hard to find anything vegan on the menu, so I had the roasted veggie wrap. The first time I had it, it was good, but the second time it was swimming in oil. 

It will do when you don't want to leave the hotel, but I certainly wouldn'd go out of my way to eat there.

The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the food is actually good. With that said the service is horrible, to start it took the server, in a mostly empty dinning room, 30 min to attend the table. When he did show up he brought us menus but never asked if we would like a drink. When he finally returned to take our order he still didn't take our drink order and almost left the table before we all gave our order only staying because we had to bring it to his attention. Once the food was delivered he never returned to see if we needed anything else. We had to flag him down to ask for drinks and he again walked away while we were still ordering. Lastly they charge an automatic 20% gratuity to the bill. Needless to say this was the entire meal experience; unimpressive and lacking. Never coming here again, which is sad because I like the SLS hotel.

We stayed at the W couple of weeks ago and dined there a number of times. 
This place works like a well greased machine for breakfast and lunch. Joseph is a real gem there, he should be cloned and spread all over the place. Quick, personable, good salesman but not too pushy. He hooked us on Mojitos there (kudos to the bartender, tasted the same every time. Fantastic) 
The food is solid. Chinese was good but a bit too salty. Looks like the kitchen also serves in room dining (same items) and the pool. You can tell by the quality of food there is a chef with a brain and skill behind this. 

The downside is dinner service. We came a couple of times around 5-7 pm and good luck trying to find a server that cares. I understand this is downtime but basic sequence of service should be followed. At some point there was literally noone on the floor we could ask for anything. Food was still good but service subpar.

"SAVE YOUR MONEY"
We would of been better off going to a run down casino in down town and ordering a $4.99 midnight steak and egg special. The food was horrible, we didn't eat it because it was so bad, the bill was $46. The service was just as bad no one seemed to show any knowledge of food or restaurant etiquette.

Loved it! We're from Hawaii and just loved the Chinese food. We stayed at the SLS Las Vegas for 5 nights. We only ate there 3 times and wished we went more. The last night we were there we had 9 in our party and everyone loved their choices. The dinner for $19.95 is so worth it. Choice of soup or salad (Caesar salad was huge), the chicken fettuccine was excellent and the dessert was wonderful. Burgers were good, Mongolian beef and dim sum yummy. The Yang Chow fried rice and the pan fried noodles was delicious. And our waiters and waitresses were very friendly and accommodating. 

The only thing I didn't like was the pancakes. And we could get Saimin late at night. Will go back there to eat next time we're in Vegas. The SLS employees were not very friendly at the front when we arrived nobody came to help us. And the people at the registration desk wasn't too helpful either. We won't stay there again.

Looking for a spot for a late night snack, I think this is one of the few good spots on the strip with few healthy options. They have a large selection including Chinese food. I usually order for pick up.

This IS the place to enjoy yummy food and great service 24/7! They serve healthy choices and really good "cheat day" food too. Ask to sit at the bar and then ask to be served by Luciano. Luciano knows good service and knows how to treat his guests. The Tuscan Burger was amazing! The atmosphere is casual but the service is top tier...definitely ask for Luciano and enjoy delicious food and good conversation!

I was fortunate to be comp'd breakfast here for the entirety of my most recent stay at SLS and have to say it was a great experience. The service I received was solid and I appreciated being able to select anything on the menu (it was $15 credit which covered most of the morning menu completely) and was able to try something new every day as a result. I had the carmelized banana pancakes, greek yogurt parfait, continental breakfast (fruits, toast and yogurt), protein frittata, breakfast tacos, and bacon spinach omlette and all were great. If I return to SLS, I'd definitely eat here again, even without the comps.
Food was great. Service was exceptional thanks to our server Joseph T. We are staying at SLS and will be sure to eat here for the remainder of our stay. Great place!!!!

No wonder the line to get in here for breakfast was so long, delicious coffee served in a French press and the best Huevos Rancheros I've had in a long time! Pancakes looked really good too. Next time I  want breakfast in Vegas, I won't hesitate to come here.

My husband and I make it a point to come dine at the Northside Caf√© at the SLS every other week. Best nachos in town, hands down! The beef soup and the seared salmon are delicious! Joseph, who's been our server on numerous occasions, is exceptional! He is very attentive to his guests and you feel that he is genuine and sincere and most importantly, consistent! Even if we don't get him as our server, we watch him interact with his guests and you can tell that he likes what he does! Marco is 1st runner-up, he, too is friendly, upbeat and makes sure you're enjoying your meal!

Horrendous service.   Had to seek the waiter out on multiple occasions.   Forgot orders and would come back after ten minutes for a reminder.   Then had the audacity to add in a TWENTY PERCENT gratuity. Just a terrible experience.

Three strikes and you're out. 
Opportunity #1: Eggs Benedict for Breakfast was very underwhelming. 
Opportunity #2: Take away Turkey Club Sandwich around the lunch hour...did not impress, bland. 
Opportunity #3: Late night group meal, combo of breakfast & dinner items. Brought out Buttermilk Pancakes when Blueberry Pancakes were ordered. Speaking of the Blueberry Pancakes, the menu noted inclusion of Blueberry Whipped Cream which ultimately ended up being a large dollop of whipped cream with a handful of blueberries sprinkled on top. Really? Standard eggs, bacon, toast order had the most issues which resulted in sending back the order completely and guest having to share food with others at the table. Eggs & bacon arrived first and 10 minutes later the toast finally arrived only to be warmed bread. The response for reason why toast didn't arrive with the rest of the meal was "it's made on a conveyor belt".  Take two with the toast attempt was the exact same result which by then the eggs and bacon are cold so entire meal was sent back. While the order was removed from the bill, we did receive mean eyes from the manager. 
If you like pickles, this is the place to go. However, if you like anything else including service you may want to pass. 
Considering the attention to detail in and around the SLS Las Vegas, Northside Cafe did not rise to the occasion to continue the high standard of excellence.

Prices about $5 more than chain restaurants selling the same food. Service was poor :(  I had to ask for a refill on my water which was refilled with warm water and no ice. Waiter didn't take the order correctly and gave a member of my party fries instead of fruit. Sandwiches didn't look to bad. Alfredo with chicken tasted fishy. And some of the pasta was undercooked. No Parmesan was offered and when asked sliced Parmesan was brought out. Lol! It was edible but I would not waste my money.

My husband and I decided to go to Northside for my birthday dinner.  Yes, a lot of pressure on Northside to give me that great meal.  KC, our server, suggested the surf and turf.  I could not have been happier.  The steak melted in my mouth, the shrimp was tasty and my side of asparagus was wonderful.  It was the perfect amount and very very good.  My husband wasn't as crazy about his pasta with chicken but I gave it 5 stars because of the great service and my excellent meal.  Give it a try!!

I had chance to dine at SLS Las Vegas popular restaurants such as KU Noodles and the 24hr Northside Cafe and I highly recommend for the top notch presentation to the detail of revised menu since the opening almost a year ago. The ambiance is casual and hip trendy approach with a great selection from comfort to Asian fusion delicious items. The wait staff were attentive and friendly which makes a big difference compared to other dining outlets in the strip. The cafe has one of the most helpful staff Cristian Santos in which made our dining experience daily a memorable one.

Great breakfast!  Worth the walk to the SLS!  My husband and I went on a busy Sunday morning.   Joseph T was our server,  he did an amazing job.  Our coffee was filled at least 4 times.  I had a breakfast meat substitution that he accommodated graciously.   Really awesome food.  Really great people!!  Totally hit the spot and we will be back next time in Vegas.
Yummy food! Exceptional burger. Great squid. N buffalo wings were delicious. Fries were good. Sweet n sour soup was great! Salmon with capers all good. Julian was waiter n was decent.

Quality of food:  5 stars.
                                Delicious. well balanced.
                                not so much fat or oil.
                                Quite enoughly served.

Cleaness:   4.5 stars
                         utensils are very clean. no finget print
                         but the floor and seats are a bit dirty
 
Service:     4 stars.
                       Busy. very busy.
                       You might expect to get your food after     20 or 30 from the moment you ordered.
                       representatives said it will take one hour and 30 min to get in room dining.
                       servers do not really look around guests.

         
          if you have plenty of time and love SLS,
            you must like this place. 
          But, there are many place which serves quite good quality of food in main street of LV
I love breakfast for lunch so when I came in and asked my server what breakfast  is best Maria suggested the burrito. Best thing that ever happened! Amazing food and service!!!

This was a really nice place and  a good break from the insanity of The Strip. 

I started with the roasted tomato soup, absolutely delicious! Basil and the garlic crouton really complemented my soup... 
It open up my appetite to have a philly steak, the steak was on the perfect seasoned, cooked on the perfect medium rare just how i asked for, and wasnt  too heavy like other places i have tried...
 Overall, thought the price for what we all got was good, and the ambiance was great!
My waiter was Juan M, he was very polite and attentive through out our whole experience in Northside Cafe, even though he was busy with other things we really felt his whole attention to our table, I will defiantly come back and try something new now that I know that what i had was great delicious food! I highly recommend this place

We were seated quickly and the food was great. We both got the 2 egg breakfast, and have no complaints about the food.  My only suggestion is for the staff to take on more of a team approach. We sat with empty water for quite some time and other servers walked by with water pitchers but never even glanced at us.

This place hit the spot! Perfect for late night drinks and grub. The food was delicious and the drinks were spot on. I will definitely be back. 3 mins from parking. Late night staff and manager are worth the trip. Definitely recommend.
The Nutella French Toast is amazing! Only thing I wish is that they still did the 20+ varieties of pancakes like when the place first opened as the Griddle Cafe.

We used to come here when it was The Griddle and loved the insane pancakes. Unfortunately great things don't last forever and we came to find it replaced with mediocre food and overall slow and unresponsive service. 

Wait in line was about 30 minutes on a Saturday morning. Ordered pancakes and an omelette and took about 15 minutes to come out before finding out the server got the wrong pancakes ordered for us. Got the replacement in a few minutes (would have been nice if our original order was that fast). Nothing memorable about the food, which was the exact opposite experience (and the reason we longed to go back) when it was The Griddle Cafe. 

Took us 10 minutes to track down the server to pay and even to come back to pick up our card for payment. Lots of empty tables around us by that point.

This place needs some lessons from old school Vegas in how to take care of customers.  High prices, poor service and so loud it was hard to hold a conversation.
$16.00 for 2 eggs, 2 bacon, potatoes!!!
Had to ask for coffee cream, and spread for the toast, asked for a pancake on side, "oh no we don't do that".  Maybe this is the new school way???

Oh no, we don't go back either!!!!

I came here because I was looking for breakfast places on Yelp for me and my boyfriend and this place seemed so good so we came, and I regretted it so much! The food is really good I'm not going to lie, I had the chocolate French toast and egg breakfast. But let me tell you why I'm NEVER going back!
First of all, the service was terrible!! When we first got here, we waited 20 MINUTES and no one acknowledged us, asked us for water, NOTHING! We just sat there trying to get servers attention looking stupid. And it was not busy AT ALL let me tell you, but all the servers were sitting around watching the basketball game not doing anything so we got up and walked out. We ended up going back though because my boyfriend had work in about 1 1/2 hour and we really wanted to have breakfast. So we go to the manager and he gets us a seat again, THEN FINALLY a server comes to us. First of all, there was never a drink menu given to us. I still don't even know what they have to drink there. I tried asking my server bout coffees bc I wanted one but he was just very short and gave me one coffee option. So I said sure I'll take two (trying to be positive and make the best of the situation). So anyways I'm still asking about drinks and he interrupts me and just says "Do you want to get your foo order in?" So I'm like fine and we order. MIND YOU I DONT EVEN KNOW WHAT THIS SERVERS NAME IS! My server never introduced himself, nothing. He did bring us water though. So he brings our food and that was it. We never saw our server again. Didn't ask how we were, he refilled our water once and that's it. So we ate and enjoyed each other's company, then he took another 20 minutes to get us our bill. Honestly $50 for bs. It was shitty service and I never got my damn coffee either! I give two stars bc the food was good but not worth the money nor the service. I would NEVER EVER go back to this place.

Tony handles his business like a BOSS!! The food was on point and came out quick. Getting us to our show on time. We will be back after we drink the concert dry to get some chicken and waffles!
Booyaa!!!
Nick gave the best customer service! Kept up with my drinks and made sure my girlfriend and I were completely taken care of. Keep up the great work.
Breakfast is a pleasure at this restaurant. Be sure to ask for Oliver as your server. Pleasant and remembers your preferences!

Yes! Eat here! It was reasonably priced for Vegas. I had Chicken Alfredo Fettuccine and it was delicious! My sister had a Philly Steak Sandwich that was to die for! We both had a mixed drink (Bloody Mary-Very good!) Not your average bitter low quality drink.  It was not real busy at 10pm and our server was very delightful! Give it a try!
Good for kids (chicken tenders are a big serving...really a starter). Fettuccine was also really good. Right in the SLS and reasonably priced.
The Dim Sum and Kung Pao Chicken are great and reasonable priced. The breakfast was so-so. Great place to go for Dim Sum cravings and avoid paying for parking at casino. I recommend this place.

I typically stay at the SLS Hotel when I'm in Vegas. Northside cafe is my spot for late night eats. I love the atmosphere, food, and the staff. The place is just managed and run very well..and on top of that, the food is pretty darn tasty. I typically get the breakfast tacos, but today I changed it up and got the pancakes and bacon. Still stuffed. Got to give some props to the staff there, since I feel like they went out of their way to make my experience better. Vicki, the hostess. Nick, the bartender, and Jessica, the night manager, all gave me wonderful service. I will visit northside again during my next visit to SLS.
Awesome food and service! Joseph was an amazing server, highly recommend! The turkey club sandwich was really really good!

Big fan!!!  

Love the SLS but this is a special review just for the chef's and staff of the Northside.  

My contingent only stayed at SLS because a year ago we were trying the previous restaurant that was banging heads in the local culinary landscape at the Hash House a Gogo. We were disappointed when half way through 2015 we found out they had folded up their tent and the SLS has put in some "version" of a breakfast place. 

YOU win! Ok, I'm not concerned that the cuttsie names and pancakes the size of a Donk wheel are gone, what we were all glad for, is that the food is delicious, unique "enough", fast and the staff is super friendly. Not one breakfast over our tradeshow was spent out of the hotel. 

Thanks for making it great. Already booked rooms for tradeshows into 2017. Hopefully, it will still be breakfast then too... and the French Press, winner!!!

Had the bacon and spinach omelette,
Husband had steak and eggs, good was very good service was fast, waitress was attentive, what more do you need?

I gave this place credit for being what I thought is wasn't.  I wrote it off as a simple hotel restaurant.  I was mistaken and I admit it. Solid menu and great coffee.  The coffee is served in your own French press.  Yum yum.
Some of the best Chinese food I have had.  Our server Juan M did a fantastic job.  I Will definitely go out of my way to stop in again.
Great food at the Northside. Their Asian noodle dishes are the best. Can't wait to go back. Charming low-key vibe with a plain dining room. Reasonably priced entrees.

Not too shabby! I went to eat here for the first time while also checking out SLS for the first time and I was DEFINITELY glad I stopped in. Juan Mayorga was my server and he was absolutely fantastic. He helped my girlfriend and I choose what to eat. I'm a big fan of French Toast so of course he suggested I try the French Toast dish the cafe provided and it was AMAZING. After seeing that Juan was a trustworthy person, Lol, I asked him what else I should check out inside the SLS and he quickly recommended a few things. He was patient and friendly and those are key qualities to have in a server!

(I also never tried Nutella and it's pretty damn good lol) 

Thank you Juan!
Great service from bald guy with piercings (sorry didn't get name). Good food, little pricey buy welcome to vegas!

Our lunch selections were the Roasted Turkey Club sandwich with fries on a multigrain roll for $15. I really enjoyed this and it was all I could eat once again $15 seems a little pricey for a sandwich but the protein size makes it seem alright. My wife picked the Cashew Chicken and rice, you actually have to pay extra to get rice. She was not impressed by her dinner as the cashew chicken lacked flavor in her opinion. Probably better places to eat but I did like my sandwich.

Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen is the 'diner' in the SLS Hotel located just off the casino floor.  Open 24 hours.  I've eaten here a number of times.  My favorite item is the Greek salad with grilled shrimp added. The salads are always fresh and crisp.  

I've tried the breakfast burrito and found it okay.  Felt like it was missing something but couldn't really say what would improve this dish.  Huge potato pieces in a big burrito were a bit overwhelming but not a bad choice if you are in the mood for a burrito.  Good quality coffee.

Service here is always good.  This restaurant is clean and the open kitchen is immaculate.  Northside Cafe is definitely a solid choice if you are seeking a diner type meal especially at odd hours. Alcohol is available.

Prices are moderate.  Didn't save my check but the Greek salad with shrimp is about $16.00.

Me and my girl went here for breakfast. I had the breakfast burrito which was really filling and tasteful. The only this is I wish that I had shredded potatoes instead of the whole quarter cuts. So in some bites I didn't just end up with a mouth full of potatoes and not being able to enjoy the egg, cheese, peppers,  or the chorizo. It came with a small side of Pico, which honestly I would've preferred salsa. The green chiles salsa added a hint of like flavor which was a great kick.  Over all I enjoyed the burrito and presentation.  Wifey had the Philly cheese steak which was tender and bread was so soft felt like it melted in your mouth. It was superb and I would recommend it. They sell both sides all day.  My server was average nothing was outstanding and there was a 20 min wait for a water refill. The noise level was enjoyable a mixture of music. The environment does gives off an 70's dinner fill.  The place wasnt jammed busy but this is a THURSDAY .

Dined here a few days ago and the experience was great. As a server myself I am pretty picky on service. Our server was Juan Mayorga and he did not disappoint!  Very friendly, knowledgeable and on point! Thanks for making the experience excellent Juan!

Christian was a great server. He made sure that our coffee was hot and fresh. Our food came out great and his service was excellent! If you get him as a server, he'll sure take care of your foodie needs!
Ordered the Mongolian beef. Surprisingly it was really good. But my gripe is that it came with no rice... what kind of Asian restaurant cafe or not would sell a main dish with no rice included?
I enjoyed this place because it was open 24hrs. Had the fried rice it was so good I had to get it twice. Wasn't too salty and the shrimp and chicken was delicious. Staff were friendly and prompt.

The positive: my wife ordered chow mein and it tasted great, lotus wrap was a little small but was also good

the negative: there was cake or desert on the table and floor and I had to ask two different people before they cleaned it. 

my tacos were lukewarm and meat tasted tough

service was slow.

Northside Cafe is pretty tasty.  I'm a fan of the sandwiches and sweet potato fries.  However, the service is a bit slow, even if the restaurant isn't very busy.  If you are staying at SLS, Northside Cafe is your room service option.  (They do stop serving to your room after a certain time on Mondays-Thursdays though, so don't order too late if you want food delivered to you.)    

I noticed that they very recently added Chinese food to the menu, but I haven't had a chance to try any of the dishes yet.

Have been back several times for breakfast & lunch. Still prefer lunch. Sit at the bar every time without a wait & never disappointed in service or food. If you don't see a type of omelet you want just tell them & they will be as accommodating as they can....as with other items too.

Service is ridiculous
They are not friendly, every guy that works here is on super slow mode
Ordered an egg white omelette, and apart from taking 30 min to have my order taken waiting 20 to get, my omelette was wrong. Wtf
They need some women in here!! Annoyed.

Four of us came here for a nice little dinner while we were staying at the SLS Hotel. There were several choices but ,this one was recommended. Glad we came here. As we all really enjoyed our meal.
2 of the girls got the grilled cheese with tomato soup. It also has bacon inside it. I wouldn't think it was something however, that I would like. But, they both raved about it so next time I go I'm going to try it as well.
This time I tried a divine hot pot! It was fantastic, see the photo!
I also tried the hot and sour soup. Just OK, not fabulous.
Our other friend got the orange chicken with rice. She said she liked it but she didn't eat it all and she didn't want to take it with her. So I don't think it was her favorite. 

Then all in all the food was good . The service was excellent. 
We had a wonderful time and enjoyed our food. 
Yes, I will eat there again. I love the way it was decorated...50s ,60s diner like . With American food and Chinese.

Fellow Yelpers are right!! Service is disappointing, but the food it good. A bunch of young men, who stand around looking lost. Our server was spaced out, and so inattentive. Only the good food saved this place.

Ok, an update to my review of the Northside caf√©. Because of my first I was contacted by the Manager Jessica Romo. Jessica convinced me to get the cafe a second chance, so I did. This time I had a party of 4 and we were allowed to order whatever we want. I order the club burger and I must say that was an incredible burger. The flavors were excellent. Then other members in my part have shrimp cob salad, avocado turkey could sandwich, the street tacos, torta and the blueberry pancakes. (My man Eric made sure they were cooked this time. ) All was delicious. We were pleased with our server Angela and the fact that they gave us the VIP treatment. Overall, awesome effort by the staff and the food was delicious.

Came here after looking at the menu outside, the carrot cake pancakes looked so good but once we got seated it wasn't an option on the menu, no biggie, I'll order the chilaquiles but when our order came to the table, I was served eggs Benedict, the coffee taste pretty bad too. The food was your average diner food.

I came here and went on a whim after a pool party at SLS's fox tail day party. It felt like being at an upscale Denny's though. Our group was about seven people and we were sad way in the back away from everyone. Back to school I wouldn't say that's odd but typically it seems like African-American people always sat in the world right now away from playing a general population site. Not saying anything about this place here it's just something to think about. If it was all right here. Nothing spectacular and it wasn't terrible that you never come back. It's just not a place you would recommend somebody go to if they were in the Vegas area. If your hungry and at the SLS then sure this is OK to try out. The menu has a great variety of food so there is definitely something there for everyone. All in all I will likely go back because it's close to the SLS pool, but if I'm not staying at the SLS I have no reason to be here. 

#EatHereOrNot
Best breakfast place we found in Las Vegas definitely on the strip and cool new hotel is located in the SLS

The food was good, I just didn't like our server. When we got there it just seemed he wasn't happy to be there at all and it showed. When my boyfriend would ask him a question it seemed that he was annoyed by it or us. We placed a drink order and it took about 15mins to get and he didn't bother to let's us know or even come take our order, he walked by our table numerous times and finally when the host came by to offer us coffee she ended up taking our order and pretty much took care of us. I wish I got her name because she stepped up and she was awesome. The food was good and my Bloody Mary was great! But the service we got from our server was AWFUL

Since the hotel I was staying at didn't have any eateries open at 4 in the morning, I walked across the street to the SLS. I looked at the menu posted outside the restaurant and found something I could eat (I'm on a restricted diet). I walked in, was seated and then handed an abbreviated menu. The selection I wanted wasn't served until 6 am. I ordered a salad after inquiring about another menu item. The salad was decent and I waited for my bill. My bill came out to $16.11 and I gave the waiter a $20. He comes back with $3 change. Because I needed a couple of nickles for something I needed to do later, I asked him about my missing $0.89. He went off to go find change and tossed $0.85 in the bill folder on the table. I grabbed a couple nickles and left him a $3.79 tip even though the service was average at best. All the waiters didn't seem overly friendly to any of the 6 or 7 groups of patrons in the restaurant. 
If I ever stay at the hotel I did, I will make sure I plan better for early morning food needs than go back to the Northside Cafe.

Note: 1 plus month post visit: emailed the manager after she sent me the form email reply. Never heard back from her but didn't expect it either.

Go to SLS on every Vegas visit but after a horrible experience at Umami i was hesitant to try another eatery here. The casino gave me some comp money for my bday so we gave it a try. First mistake, you seat yourself so of course it took FOREVER for someone to get to us. Once Brian took our order most of our dinner ran pretty smooth. The food was really good, no complaints there. The prices were pretty high for the simple dishes we got, the next time i have comp dollars i would definately eat there again. Now i can use them instead of them going to waste.
Soooo much better than The Griddle!! The menu is much easier to order from, and you're not constantly asking what is what.  I had the Reuben sandwich, which was amazing. So happy with the redo.

I was staying at SLS for my vacation and i had breakfast there everyday. Food was good, service was outstanding . Not only did our server juan m provided us with exceptional service but he is also a hottie.  SLS is a great place to stay at all the staff was friendly and their many dining options make it even better but you should try the cafe food after the club or for breakfast.

The service is horrible the only good thing about this place is a omelettes. Thank you excludes delicious but today's not so good I will give them one star for t pancakes. And by the way I still don't understand who was always server five with six different people were coming in giving me a bill and bringing her food all the different people. I would not come back here again.

If I could eat their Verde Chilaquiles everyday I would! They're so good. And i loved that their bloody mary came with candied bacon. Delicious and great service! I will be back on my next Vegas trip.
Do not order the corn beef. Th portion is too small.  The French press coffee is quite good, and omelette better than expected.

Came here cause our uber driver recommended it. He ended up coming with us and drinking cause it's vegas so why not! Had an amazing waitress named Stephanie and we started talking about what SLS stands for and I said SUCK LICK SLURP! I hope they use it for something like a signature drink !
The food here is amazing!! You can't go wrong with this for breakfast or lunch. The wait was only 15 minutes so don't let the line cool you. Just be patient.

Our server with the glasses took over 10 mins to take our drink and food order as he walked passed our table in his assigned section with NO acknowledgement. I watched another table get greeted by their sections server promptly once seated. Customer service is very important in the industry, lazy servers aren't needed.
Very good American restaurant that is fair prices. I had the nachos which were very good. It is a pretty busy restaurant so I would call before trying to just show up if you don't stay in the hotel.

I stayed in the W connected to the SLS where Northside is and I'm glad this restaurant option is so close. I had a healthy protein frittata each morning and the asparagus was cut really well and added a unique touch to an otherwise simple dish. The staff was kind and even let me switch my table to a booth without a fuss. Overall, a good option for a sizable meal.

Good breakfast location at SLS hotel. Surprisingly crowded given how empty the hotel and casino were, a wait at times and service was a little slow though friendly. Had a Denver Omelette one day and Corned Beef Hash the other, both tasty. Vegas Prices.

Didn't even get to the food... Hostess, Alexis, RUDE - have a little respect!!! I'm with my elderly mother and some other older women. I never leave a bad review, ever, but they were not very accommodating. So instead of reporting them to the SLS hotel I decided to leave a yelp review. We left without eating. Bunch of amateurs running the place.

Why is the service here always so bad ? I live across the street and would come more often except the service is always so bad. 

It's almost always the same servers when I go, an Asian girl and a bald guy and they are just slow and forgetful. 

The food is pretty good which is why I didn't give them one star

Had a great breakfast here sharing the caramelized banana pancakes and chilaquiles. An excellent combo between sweet and salty. Get the streusel filling on the pancakes! Service was quick and Joseph, our waiter, was fabulous and funny! Prices are on par for Vegas. Definitely will be back if I stay at SLS again!

The food here was absolutely delectable!!! I had a Greek salad with the Seared Salmon and she had chicken Alfredo.  The atmosphere is upbeat and friendly. I give 3 stars due to the lack of service form our waiter Juan M. We seen him when we ordered dinner with desert and then the again for the bill. We had to ask 2 random employees that may have been hostesses and third who was waitressing the table next to us. Juan M was polite, and pleasant, I'm sure he is good at his job but The performance today with us was poor, we were left waiting and reaching out to other employees for service. Lastly when I ordered my Salmon meal it came with a Caesar salad, I asked for a Greek salad, he replied "it will be an extra charge" I agreed to it. When we got the check I noticed they not only was I charged extra but I was charged for a " 1/2 salad . So since I was charged full price for a 1/2 Greek salad $7.95 what happened to the Caesar salad that came with the meal? So their just gonna keep my Cesar salad and charge me full price for the 1/2 Greek??? Not good business!!!  Sorry Juan M. But you still got your 15%.
Ate here twice during my stay.....both times the food was good and the service was excellent. I'll be back

We are locals and took our parents here tonight got the prime rib special on a Friday so good! Some of the best ever! Our waiter Juan was very very kind and accommodating! Definitely recommend him and this place!!

Omg this place is delicious! My boyfriend and I stayed at the SLS for about 6 days in June and once we tried it, we had to eat there every morning! Everything is so good! My personal favorite were the hazelnut (Nutella) French toast! Their French pressed coffee was great. We tried so many different things and were extremely happy! The chorizo burrito is great as well! The yogurt parfait was amazing too! The only thing that wasn't the best were the beans they used on the nachos. They called them "charro beans" and being Mexican you expect real charro beans. Instead they were literally chilly beans. But other than that great service as well. I just went back to Vegas mid July, I didn't stay at the SLS but we sure came here to eat! 
Oh and if you're staying at the SLS the room service is the exact same menu with about $2 added to every item so just go down stairs and eat :)
Great job Juan M service was great. The food and drinks were awesome! My burger was made just the way I requested. The drinks were also good. My husband never had to ask for a refill. Thanks Juan

we went to northsaide cafe at 2am
kassey (our waiter ) was very nice and great personality 
we ate steak and eggs ill say its the best steak and egg in town :):):):)

My boyfriend and I have been here on multiple occasions on various vegas trips the past two years and found it initially due to the strong ratings here on Yelp.  We are also staying at the SLS this weekend and he stays there for work on occasion.  It is convenient when you are staying there, however it ALWAYS takes forever to get your food and the service is subpar. It seems like the server to customer ratio is good,  so there isn't a shortage of staff however they all seem to be standing around doing nothing even when you have asked for something like another set of silverware or some more water.  There is no sense of urgency.  In addition the food is nothing special and isn't cheap (although I guess that is to be expected on the strip). I don't mind paying 14.00 for am omelette but I do expect it to taste good and have good service!
Our server Christian provided excellent service.  He was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  The Buffalo chicken wrap was delicious!

The food was absolutely amazing!  We stayed at sls for 3 days & two nights. Our breakfasts and lunches we had here! Prices were good for Vegas, cheaper than a buffet. The food was really filling! Tip of advice : breakfast burritos are to so good! Ask for ranch !

This what I posted about,  customer service is lacking.. 1 month after my review I get a response. . This why I said "they have a long road ahead".. This is NOT how a major strip property in Las Vegas with a department dedicated to customer service should take after a month to field a response. . #JustSaying

This review is for brunch.  

This place is OK, as far as the food and service are concern. The decor and servers had me feeling some type of way...

However the coffee here is AMAZING! You get a great big carafe for the whole table.

Typically this place is legit.  Just ok tonight.  
I expected more and better service. 
Manager wasn't any help either.
Poor service and bad food.  There is absolutely nothing good about this place... neither of us finished our meals.  Flavorless, bland, boring and definitely NOT authentic chinese food.
Super delicious bloody Mary's!!!! The breakfast is yummy too! The service could be better though our waiter disappeared a lot

I gave it two stars because the food was really good, a bit pricey but really good.
The service, well let's just say we complained to the manager about it and he comped us the dinner. We never saw or server from the time out dinner was delivered until he asked about a coupon before running of to get the check. Never came back to check if the food was good or to check our drinks.
Really shouldn't be so bad because there are a lot of people running around waiting on tables and its not that big a place.

This is a nice cafe in the SLS with a variety of breakfast food, sandwiches and entrees as well as a special Chinese menu. The service is very attentive and friendly. The ambiance is relaxed and the food and drinks are excellent.
Had the Nutella French toast and oh man... It truly was orgasmic. The fianc√©e liked the breakfast burrito as well, but I really didn't. Still, I can't say enough, GET THE FRENCH TOAST.

So here's the deal,  I like the wide variety of things on the menu. They're open 24/7 and have a causal vibe with a decent ambiance.  You can get anything from traditional diner breakfast to Italian,  Mexican,  and Chinese.  So if it's late night and you don't know what you want, it's a nice spot.  However,  I'm thinking that with this wide variety,  the quality may suffer. 

I ordered the parpadelle with short rib ragu.  Sounds delicious doesn't it? Well I'd say it was an issue with quality of ingredients, and partially preparation.  The short ribs were tough and chewy and not trimmed properly,  and the parpadelle was slightly undercooked. My friend ordered a cheese steak sandwich and her said it was... Ok. 

All in all not too bad,  but not that good.  And we were also waiting to be helped for about 20 minutes before anyone came to the table.  I think it was a miscommunication on who's section the table was in,  so I understand,  but still...

Has potential,  could use some work.

Tried this nice diner looking cafe in SLS. I can say the food is delicious and a 5 but the server was a 3. We ordered their breakfast and I will shout from the roof about how delicious the hazelnut French toast was. It came cooked well and full of flavor. Also, the Hog omelet was delic and the ham made that omelet scream. I ordered the pork and eggs w potatoes dish. I believe the menu says it has jalepanos but I didn't really taste any spice but I did enjoy their table hot sauce. Try them out!  I had one little problem w a hair on my plate but I sent it back and didn't have anymore surprises.
Really good late night Chinese food to grab on the way back to your hotel after a night out! Fried pork and shrimp wontons were delicious.

I have to take the time and write a review about this place because it was delicious and we had a tremendous experience, our server Juan M was absolutely amazing, he was very attentive! Will definitely be going back.

Came around 9pm on the weekend, and was told there were a lot of things on the menu that weren't available already.  They do have a lot of hearty comfort food options, and have large portions.  However, the food didn't really stand out.  Wouldn't necessarily come again unless I was super hungry and 800 degrees was closed.

I just had the most delicious lunch at Northside!  I had a coupon for 2 free entrees (it pays to join The Code!) for this newly renovated restaurant at the SLS Hotel & Casino, and it expired today, so I came in. I got a Club Burger - ham, tomato, lettuce, bacon and Swiss and a Chicken Caesar Wrap and ate half of each. I'd ABSOLUTELY be back!  I sat at the counter and had a great chat with my server/bartender, too. Clean, delicious food, friendly staff.  What more could you ask for?!

Wife and I had breakfast here and enjoyed it. I had the two egg breakfast which is offered with bacon or choice of chicken or pork sausage and breakfast potatoes. The wheat toast was excellent. My wife had the protein frittatta made with egg whites, asparagus, turkey, onion and feta. She loved it. I thought the price was 10% or so to high but we will be back.

OK. The absolute best service ever! Our server, Joseph, was incredibly helpful. I have an extremely strict diet and have a lot of restrictions and he was able to accommodate all of it with the Best and sweetest service ever! I'll definitely make this my go to when I'm in town

Good american food here. Perfect for breakfast + lunch. Wait isnt long. Blueberry pancakes are heaven here.  Portions are nice and big and entrees themselves are not expensive for a vegas strip hotel.

We arrived from our long flight and decided to have dinner at one of the restaurants at our hotel instead of looking around the strip. They had a Chinese barbecue served only on Saturdays so we ordered it.
We were so disapointed. Food was not fresh. It took time to get to the table but it tasted like it was reheated. Rice was old. Service was OK...would never come back.

I have to say very disappointed with "service".  took us while to get our coffee. Ordered my eggs benedict the English muffin was hard as a rock and the hollandaise sauce tasted like it was spoiled.  I don't like writing these kind of reviews but seriously your paying money for the food whom some reviewer says it's good food.... If your a Server you need to leave the attitude at the door and pick it up on the way home because paying customers doesn't need to see it. just sayin...Maybe someday I'll come back hopefully to rewrite this review.
Solid philly cheese steak. Didn't get to try the Chinese menu by any restaurant that offers a cheesesteak is aces in my book

We stopped in Vegas for one night coming from the Grand Canyon and Antelope Canyon trip.  We have literally been eating fast food for the last few hours.  Our first sit down meal is here at N. Side Cafe.  My kiddos have severe food allergies so I was worried about ordering the food here.  The chef came out (his name was Alex), and graciously agreed to personally make an allergy free meal for them! He then  delivered it too! It was amazing! To top it off our server Juan was impeccable. His attention to detail and his desire to be accommodating went above and beyond. We were very pleased with our experience and would highly recommend.

Went for dinner, 2 of us, what a miserable atmosphere, bad service, drive-thru restaurant type of food. Asked for an iced tea, got the tea, no ice. Dr pepper soda sat there waiting for a refill, had to call the manager to get it. Hamburger bun, cheapest type you can get. Server never showed up at anytime, dirty plates sat there till we left.  Table next to us had ordered many food but had no plates,they went to the bar to get"em. When exiting server came running saying he forgot to include  the iced tea on the check, we replied what iced tea, it was just tea. Manager then waived charges. Biggest joke "We love locals".

This place is awesome ! The food was delicious! I had the chilaquiles verdes and a bloody mary to go along with ! My boyfriend and I also shared the french toast which was delicious !!! Our server Juan M was friendly and attentive! Definitely returning here !

BF was a fan of the pancakes when this spot was previously the Griddle Cafe- despite the name change and menu expansion, they kept some indulgent pancake options (though not the originals offered previously), downsized for normal human consumption. He really enjoyed the blueberry version; the blueberry whipped cream on top was a nice touch. I'm not into sugar for breakfast and couldn't stomach more than a few bites.

But nachos for breakfast? Now you're speaking my language! The Chilaquiles Verdes dish is basically nachos, but they throw on a couple of fried eggs so you can pretend to fit in with your breakfast-loving pals (they're all heathens). Saucy, spicy, and crunchy, it's a party in your mouth- and one I'd get again.

Service was pretty solid and I'm glad to see they still have the french press coffee. We'll keep coming back when they're featured in the Social Sundays program.
A nice surprise! Walking through SLSlooking for a burger place, we found this one. I ended up getting the beef noodle soup that was tasty. Food is presented well and pretty good! Prices reasonable.
Had a great dinner after a long day at work great food try the Nacho's and the North side Burger out of this world Joe the manager was so friendly and our server  Dominic was amazing

Super slow and somewhat chaotic service.  People who sat before me received their food way before me. I had to wait 35 plus minutes for my dinner. Other patrons had the same experience and were disappointed. Yes  - it's one of those restaurants.
rancheros was delicious, service was fast. LOVE the layout of the place. I'd definitely come back!

Let me tell ya! I would rather drive through a blizzard than eat here again. First off the menu that was handed to me had blood smeared on it....... Blood. The waitress acted as if it was ketchup....... disgusting. Being 2:30 am I decided to brush that off and order food anyhow. We got popcorn shrimp and the club. My fiance decided on a Cucumber Margarita which sounded delicious. The waitress returned 5 minutes later to tell us they ran out of cucumber....... I mean really? She then settled for a Strawberry Margarita. Ten minutes later our food arrived. The popcorn shrimp where falling apart on a bed of stale popcorn. Worth the price....... I don't think so. The club was ok to say the least. Twenty minutes later the Margarita arrived looking more like a Bloody Mary. One taste out of this beverage turned stomachs. Being a Bartender myself, I take pride in my drinks but this was something else. The over pour of spirit was terrible. The strawberry syrup that was used was very sad. Half down one side of the glass was a sugary substance that our waitresses hands where all over. Presentation was a zero and taste was in the negatives! Tasted like it came out of a warm slurpy machine in a Third World 7-11. Terrible! It was a sad example of why some Hotels aren't what they are cracked up to be. I would've like to talk to my waitress but she dropped the check and disappeared. I will never eat here again. The lack of respect for your customers especially the ones that live here is ridiculous.
Super service by Mr. Joseph T..!  Friendly, witty and just all around kind service... promote him..!!

Had dinner here on Monday 8/16/2015. We arrived around 6pm and were seated immediately. Our server (Lola) was prompt and friendly. She kept our glasses filled throughout the meal. 
Our food was excellent. I had the surf n turf. Shrimp were large and the filet was cooked properly. My guest had the ribeye. She loved it. I will definitely be returning next week.

This place is so expensive for what they give you tbh. But dude HAZELNUT CHOCOLATE FRENCH TOAST. OMG that was magical. I would give this a 4 star because of that. Buffalo chicken flatbread had a kick to it but I didn't like it that much for some reason. Maybe too spicy or it had a lot of sauce on it for my tastebuds. The nachos were pretty basic too. I guess it's not a bad place for a cafe but it is expensive. We had 6 people and they charged us an extra $7... Idk because we split the check into 3 or gratuity but it didn't make any sense to me. We didn't really care but still. I thought that was weird. They also might need to work on their service or getting the food out at the same time. Some of us finished their food because the others got theirs.

This place is located inside the hotel near the casino area so little noisy. The food was good. The tomato soup was exceptional. I ordered some dim sum and was surprised there was not accompanying sauce/dip. The quesadilla is small and does not offer much but others at my table were happy with their choices. The green tea is loose leaf and good and so was the espresso coffee.. These were pleasant surprises.

Honestly, i feel so bad leaving this review just because i feel like the food would have tasted so much better had it not taken so long. We ordered a pretty large order, and it was to go (to our room of course) since there was a huge line outside. The service was extremely slow, as we stood there to pay at the bartender for almost 20 minutes before we were acknowledged.

When we finally got our food, we took it upstairs, and turns out they had a bunch of items wrong. They gave us a chicken wrap instead of a club sandwich (the wrap was extremely salty). They forgot the frosting for our pancakes so we had extremely dry pancakes. The salad was super soggy and droopy, and the burger was falling apart. The tacos were decent. I am sure if we had dined in most of these issues had not occurred, but after waiting to even be acknowledged for so long, I did not even want to bother with going back at that moment. 

However, we did call in to let them know, and they did offer to switch out our wrap for the turkey club and give us the frosting & some syrup for the pancakes. 

We grabbed the food in a hurry left, and upon checking later in the car... Turns out we had gotten  the turkey club sandwich, and yet again no frosting or syrup for the pancakes. At this point we threw out the pancakes, and the turkey club had old tomatoes, so that ended up in the trash too, and we went elsewhere. 

Like I said, it may have been a different experience if we had dined in, but after everything we went through, the quality of the food and service was just awful.

Food was delicious. Their Mongolian beef is the best I have ever had! Also I really like how they have different options for you to chose from. Like East meet West, Chinese to American and our waiter was really nice.

We had an amazing experience here. Joe was our server. 11:00pm on a Friday night. He was super friendly, attentive, helpful with our special order. We would absolutely sit in his section again. The manager (working despite a torn achilles tendon!) was super helpful and friendly. 

We had the Chinese Shiitake Mushrooms and Snow Peas with Tofu and the Breakfast Burrito. Both delicious! We would order both again. The Ice Tea was FRESH at 11pm! Delicious!

Great first experience! We WILL be back!

I liked the quality of food here. We had nachos and burgers and a warm chocolate chunk cookie at the end . Christian, who served us, suggested all the good stuff in their menu and he was right . Quality of service from Christian was great and thanks to him, we had great lunch experience in this restaurant

Great breakfast, nicely timed with quick kitchen times and an attentive wait staff.  The Whole Hog Omelette was great and I will have it again in the morning!   Nice surprise to find in a place with limited restaurant options.

We were sat very quickly, came down for lunch around 9 am. Server was friendly, and had our French press out to us in no time. The coffee was great, both of us ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it was tasty. The chorizo was perfectly seasoned and the sunny side up eggs were cooked to perfection. Also saw some French toast come out on the table next to us,will have to try it next because it looked very good! If your at the SLS I'd highly recommend checking this place out for breakfast.
Great food and service! Oliver was awesome, so warm and attentive. Cheese steak was delicious!!!!

Date & Time:  Saturday December 5, 2015 @ 2am
Location :  SLS
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Decor:  Diner w/ Red Leather Booths
Service:  Fast, Friendly, Efficient
Imbibe:  Tea
Mediocre:  New Dim Sum Menu Available 5pm-6am
Total:  $25

We just arrived in Las Vegas on Monday and weren't sure where to go for food. Our concierge recommended the Northside Cafe at the SLS. Prices are higher from where we are from but just about any place you get food from in Las Vegas is going to be pretty expensive. Our omelettes were phenomenal and we did get a lot of bang for our buck. Lots of options to choose from on the menu and they gave me so much food that I had to take my omelette back to the hotel to eat for breakfast the next day. They seemed to be really busy and forgot a number of things and took awhile. My mom's omelette which was supposed to have chunks of ham in it, didn't so our cook redid hers really fast and it came out just perfect! Servers and the cooks are very friendly and funny here. Customer service here is fantastic. I would say this is a good place to get breakfast and that I would come in again.

Everything did not make sense. From the hostess counter where..idk if it was soap in mason jar decoration or items being sold? Idk. Didn't make any sense with the whole "northShore" name. As soon as I walked in, the feel of the place didn't match the hostess stand or the name of the place. Then our food came & it was nothing interesting. Very bland. Even dry at times. The drinks tasted like cocktails that a preschooler could of made. Yuck. Too sweet in one drink & the other bitter. My husband & I ate Maybe 3 bites each then requested a box to go. I just Did Not like anything about this place...idk

I really liked the energy and vibe of this place from the moment we walked in. It's in a boutique hotel so it shouldn't be surprising to find more a chic restaurant located there. The server immediately seated us where we were immediately greeted. The highlight is probably the French press coffee. Outstanding!

I normally don't get ham & eggs but something was pulling me towards that choice this morning and it was money. The ham wasn't too salty, it was juicy and just really good quality. The eggs, potatoes, English muffin were all good. It's a really good option for breakfast whether you are in a hurry or just looking to hang out.

Its my first time at the Sls, so i tried to have dinner with friends. So we ate at the Northside Cafe. I ordered some. Chinese dishes, pork ribs was amazing. We also added american dish, and the pasta was so good. The sauce it flawless and mouthwatering. I was impressed by the ambiance and the server,  Christian was amazing. He made sure that all our drinks was ok, he has a delightful manner and very friendly. Making our needs met was absolutely thumbs up. Thanks Christian! We will keep coming back to Northside to try some other menus and for the great customer service we has experienced. Recommendable!

The food here is delicious!!! The blueberry pancakes are packed full of blueberries and the strawberry waffle was crispy but light and smothered with a ton of strawberries. Wisler was our server and was polite, friendly and responsive. I would definitely come here again and I hope you do too.
Not gonna lie... But after a night of partying, the late night breakfast was pretty dang good.
Stopped by for breakfast on vacation and this cute restaurant lived up to its reviews , super cute, great service and delicious breakfast food ... I'll def be back the next time I'm in Vegas !

Oliver is absolutely amazing! He's personable, attentive, and has an infectious spirit. Normally when I order here, I get it "Togo", but this time I stayed and he gave me a reason to come back. He recommended the Philly Cheesesteak and it did not disappoint. Thank u for excellent service!!!!

Let's start with the great- the food and the bartenders were it.  Joe and Joe V. are absolutely fantastic; they deserve raises. I had the nutella french toast with whipped cream; it was perfectly done and not soggy at all ( I stopped eating french toast as a child because everyone who made it for me, made it soggy- I actually thought that it was supposed to be that way- yuck).  I added a side a bacon and shared that with the boyfriend; four thick slices come with it.  The boyfriend had buttermilk pancakes which he was as equally satisfied with- they were light and fluffy and a nice big serving.
The good- All patrons seemed to be satisfied with their food.
The bad and it's bad- I'm not sure if the hostess was nervous or what.  There seemed to be an abundance of kitchen staff and waiters but she wasn't seating people. AND there were plenty of booths and table tops. We just stood in the line and she would come to the line and ask how many people every now and then-she didn't write any of this down. After 15 minutes in line she came and asked the couple in front of me if there were only two in their party-she left and didn't return although there were 3 2-tops available. My boyfriend spotted two people leaving the bar so he left the line and claimed the seats-I followed shortly and the family behind me left.  The couple in front of me finally got sick of waiting for one of the empty tables and  joined us at the bar twenty minutes later.  At least 6 tables stayed empty for half of our meal although there was a line and plenty of staff to handle them. 

Note to Management: Your food is great- I would hate to see you lose great customers.  Please assist the hostess and come up with a better way of seating and serving customers when you have a full staff available.

I'm giving it 3 stars because my friend ordered eggs and there was a curly Q in them. Eewww. 
On the other hand I had the carnitas hash and it was very acceptable for my very Mexican self. I tried the buttermilk pancakes with syrup and those were very good too

Excellent food. I especially recommend the French toast with Nutella on it! The atmosphere is a little noisy and you may have to wait a few minutes in line to get in depending on when you go, but the food is sublime!
Good food! I love the French press coffee. Our waiter was very nice and helpful with any questions.

Awful. We were hoping to grab a quick bite to eat before the concert we are attending as we wouldn't be eating dinner until 1030. Ordered a flatbread and salad to bring to the room. The flatbread tasted like cardboard with canned green chiles and a pathetic excuse for tomato sauce. The salad was passable for salad. Waste of money. Get it together, Northside.
Oliver was so amazing!!!! The flight attendants love you  great service and wonderful experience for our "first drink" in Vegas after a long flight!!

We came by on a Saturday at noon. There were a lot of available tables but the kitchen took 50min to get our entrees ready. The waitress did apologize and gave us a new round of drinks on the house. The food was good though, we hope they will improve.

We ate breakfast today and it costs more than I expected.  Too pricey for an order of blueberry pancake $14.95 it came with three in regular size but it's good but not excellent.  The regular bfast food is okay but not an awesome place.  I guess when your in Vegas everything pricey.
