Luciano Gesauldo gave us excellent service and made me the most delicious drink! We loved the guacamole and tacos! We will definitely be dining here again.

The food was delicious here. I just got the night time breakfast eggs platter but it was perfect. Sourdough toast!  (Yum!) I wish I could have tried some of the morning breakfast dishes as they look fantastic. The best was our waiter Joseph. He pretty much is what all waiters should be. Great little place with a cozy atmosphere.

4 days in a row and this place has been great! Eat at the bar and see Oriel. He is very attentive and gets what you need fast. Day one I had the steak and eggs which were magnificent. The steak is a little small but very flavorful. The eggs were over easy and just right and I love there breakfast potatoes. Day 2 I had the egg breakfast and again it was made perfectly. The chicken sausage was delicious. I also got a frittata to go which tasted amazing. It has all of the right fillings. The coffee here is very smooth and the ok tastes fresh. Job well done north side. On top of good food the staff is amazing. Day 3 was the breakfast burrito. This burrito should rank number one for burritos in Vegas. I cannot believe I ate all of it. I came back on my 4th day for the steak again and it was better than before. You cannot go wrong with so many items on the menu. I am still scared of the pancakes but so far everything else has been scrumptious.

This place was awesome I had the huevos rancheros and the most awesome bloody mary I definitely recommend you try it. Although I am biased I needed the drink. Service was great juan m recommend the dish I was feeling like Mexican and so I ended up with huevos rancheros but they were better than traditional. If you are staying in SLS totally recommend it. Thanks for the hospitality.

When you're out late on the north side of the Strip (and conveniently staying in the SLS) and you have the munchies after a night out, the Northside Cafe is there to save the day!  Generally speaking, I was concerned about two things - quality of food (it was the only place open in SLS at that time) and quality of service (it was about 2AM and not very many people were there).  The Northside Cafe delivered on both counts.  The staff was friendly and attentive; there was not one moment where I was waiting for my drink to be refilled.  The food took a little bit longer than I expected (maybe 15 minutes for a burger and fries); however, it was well worth the wait.  The food was not only generously portioned; it was also delicious!  For bacon lovers, the Northside burger had great big pieces of thicker-than-normal bacon on it.  The burger was cooked to perfection.  If you like pickles, you get a whole dill pickle with the plate.  And for you fans of sweet potatoes - these sweet potato fries do not disappoint!  They had the perfect level of sweetness to them, and they were crispy.

Surprisingly delicious food and great service! 

Visited for breakfast and had it for in room dining, amazing.

Their Chilaquiles were bomb! 

My all meat omelet was even better! 

The toast was thick and on point like the ladies sitting next to us lol.

The best part of the meal was out cappuccino. Just enough foam... Nothing fancy, no hearts but tongue tingly.

I'll visit again for sure when in Vegas and at the SLS.

This place was great spot for breakfast. I don't really try the lunch menu there. Breakfast was great I was watching my diet and had egg white omelette almost every day but I sampled my husbands and my brothers food. We loved the eggs Benedict, and breakfast burrito. The Nutella French toast was the best thing I've ever had. That was my treat the last day and I'm glad I didn't get it on the first day because for sure I would have gained a few pounds eating that every day .

The restaurants are the highlight in the SLS, and Northside Cafe is no exception. Good, hearty hangover breakfast and/or lunch options at less than Vegas tourist-gouging prices. They make a mean Bloody Mary and french press coffee too.

Northside seems solid for breakfast/lunch, but not so much for late night. We returned to the SLS so again had a decent brunch there. I actually ordered off the Chinese side this time - beef noodle soup, and I was surprisingly satisfied. The brisket plentiful and pretty tasty. However, for a place that promoted dim sum until 6am, we returned after clubbing, only to be told by our server that he wouldn't recommend that right now because their Chinese chef is not in. While I guess it was nice that he was upfront about that, it was kinda odd, since people usually train others to make stuff and also not like they would be churning out fresh dough or anything (dimsum often already premade)... I ended up getting the burger, which was fine, but service definitely was lacking. Quite a different experience during the day vs. night.
Trying a new place. Delicious blueberry pancakes! Get the Bloody Mary. Has candied bacon in it! Fun place for a quick bite to eat.

Definitely order the 3-course dinner.  Great value for your money.  Really enjoyed the meal and my server Juan was exceptional.  Very attentive and anticipated my needs before I did.

I thought the wine was expensive though and the price for it was not listed in the menu.  Nice but not worth $11.oo a glass.

Will definitely come back.

Just had eggs Benedict. Was a solid 4/5 for you traditional Benedict fans. Also tried their dim sum. Another solid 4/5 for you true dim sum foodies. I've eaten here only one other time and we had a few things like breakfast and lunch. Their traditional breakfast is really good. Not quite Bellagio cafe good but look, your at SLS down on Sahara and the strip and for that reason alone it's the best you will get down this far and it's very good. Plus if you add the service which was 5/5 all day long, our waiter was Joseph and he could be working any 5 star restaurant to be honest. I did pay attention to other staff and they were also very in tune with customers and I didn't see anyone that wasn't getting great service. Highly recommend!

This is the only good thing about the entire SLS Hotel/Casino. 
The service is great & the employees are friendly. The food is yummy, and they have delicious French-press coffee.

Although it's no longer the Griddle Cafe, some of the items remain on the menu.   We were there for the weekend switch around, when it was Griddle on Friday but Northside on Monday.

We ordered the banana pancakes with add ons of walnut, caramel and streusel -- basically the Golden Ticket.  The flavor was the same but the pancakes were significantly smaller -- they no longer overflowed the plate.  This is a good thing as it was too large otherwise.   The price point was $2 less.

Our server was a bit brusque and confused.  Menu was much smaller -- now it just seems like a coffee shop.
Go for the breakfast burrito. I am giving 5 star quality for the burrito and the girl who remembered exactly how I ordered it yesterday - having only met me once. Excellent burrito and huge portion.
When Christian offered to add salsa Verde and sour cream to my order, I knew we were in good place. Had a great time here.

As we became helpers, down the years, we have found out that giving a "5"  is hard find these days
This resturant/ cafe, I would like to give a 3.5 stars. Normally I would give a 4 Star, but they are losing that extra half star due to service... when you arrive, you wait online out side the cafe, until a table is available, when we were finally seated around 10 minutes, not bad at all.  It took another 13 minutes to be greeted by our sever John.  ( other tables around us where seated after us and greeted and received drinks before we were even greeted)
John was a good server. 
Food was fabulous- 
We ordered two coffees
One order of Eggs Benedict- 2 poached eggs, Canadian bacon, served on an English muffin topped with lemon hollandaise sauce, with breakfast potatoes.
One order of Caramelized banana (3) buttermilk pancakes filled with chopped and caramelized bananas (mine had no filling) add an extra $1 and receive caramel, candid walnuts & strudel on top. Also served with warm maple syrup, tops off the pancakes.
I like this is place.  I'm order Strawberry Waffle. They was are very yummy!!! My friend order eggs and coffee.  I will be coming to visit still with my friend !

Second time around !! Perfect way of starting Sunday morning!! Their blueberry pancake is to die for! Very fresh not too sweet and enough to share with somebody.. same goes with omelette 
.. I like the fact that you see the kitchen and you can check how clean they keep it!! I drove from Las Vegas strip to taste this for second time and I am happy I did..

The experience through waiting, watching empty tables and then finally getting seated, only to be ignored by the server was too much. After 10 minutes of waiting for just acknowledgement, we left and went next door to Ku.

We went here twice for breakfast as part of a SPG reward. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. We enjoyed the breakfast burrito, grilled cheese with tomato soup, and the Denver omelette. The service was good and they even provided a cup to take some coffee to go at the end.

Update: After my first visit/review, I decided to come back to Northside another few times. In 10 days, I've eaten at the place at least 7 times now. I have updated the rating from 4 stars to 5. 

I am in love with the Buffalo chicken wings. I just can't seem to get enough of them. They are perfectly sauce and cooked. I always get two orders now, even if I can't finish it as I know I'll eat it later.

The service has always been good. I've also tried other good such as the Buffalo chicken wrap, cashew chicken, the burger, and their chicken tenders. The wrap was good, the burger was okay, the cashew chicken sucked, and the chicken tenders were amazing. Since they ran out of chicken wings, we asked to get the tenders covered I'm buffalo sauce... And omg they were delicious with their ranch sauce.

I'm in love with this place now :). Especially since it's open till 4 or 5 am! it's perfect for lunch, dinner, or for late night drunk food.



Previous review:

After arriving to the hotel at midnight, not many places were open. The hotel receptionist recommended me and my friend to come here as it  was open late.

Leta say I wasn't disappointed. We ordered wings, dumplings, King pao chicken, noodles, and Margarita.

All of it tasted really good, especially the wings, the King pao chicken and the Margarita. I was pleasently surprised and woild definitely come here again. The wings had delicious buffalo sauce on it with a side of ranch. Both the sauces were made in house and I could easily tell by the viscosity, they weren't as thick as the usual ranch and as thin as the usual buffalo sauce. The kung pao chicken was perfectly cooked with perfect amount of sauce.

Would definitely come back here!

First time here. I came here for Lunch on Valentine's Day. Service was exceptional. Let Christian take care of you. His service is what I expect from a 5 star restaurant. His timing and knowledge of the menu was on point. He has such charisma.
The food was good. Better than I expected. The nachos were loaded with meat, cheese, sour cream and guacamole!! Enough to share with 3-4 ppl.
I'll definitely be back.

I ate here for dinner and breakfast the next morning while staying at the SLS. I enjoyed the Chinese menu - it was a nice surprise to see all my favorite dim sum dishes on the menu. 

It seems like they are still ironing out some new restaurant kinks. The inside of one of my pork buns was still cold, but I didn't really care because I was drunk and starving and at least the pork was already cooked. 

The breakfast was yummy. They had all the usual breakfast favorites. There wasn't anything too surprising or original, but I REALLY appreciated the homemade whipped cream on the waffles. The waffle was really crispy which I liked, but there wasn't too much waffle "meat" in the center because it was so crispy and airy.
Very dusty. Staff is slow. Menu needs work. This property is already struggling. Management is non existent.

Service 5/5
Food 5/5

I came here with my baby while his Dad was at the Las Vegas Convention. I was immediately greeted and seated. They got me a high chair and put it out of the main traffic. Jim was my server and was very attentive to all his guests. I asked for his opinion between the ham and eggs and steak and eggs, he suggested the ham and eggs, but I ended up getting the steak and eggs. Loved the steak and eggs! Steak was perfectly seasoned! I normally have to get A1 at restaurants, but this time no sauce needed. It was juicy and flavorful. A little charred. It also came with eggs, potatoes, and wheat toast. Eggs and potatoes were average. I like my potatoes a little crispier. But the toast was really good. Great overall!

I loved it here!  We stayed at SLS and came here at least once a day, sometimes multiple times a day.  We got all kinds of items off the menu, breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night room service (yes this will do room service :))  We always had good service and loved the feel of it.  Would come here again and again.  Consistently good food.

This place could be fabulous with some minor tweaks. First of all there was a line to be seated when we could clearly see empty tables for at least 15 minutes. The staff was young and in my opinion not well trained this is a management issue! The food was decent not as good as my friends raved about I asked for a side of pico de gallo and I was told it was extra ok ok it came it was beautiful to look at diced perfect but without a drop of lime or salt! ! It was just ok! You can do better Northside Cafe

Came with a family group for breakfast.. First thing arriving here is that they only seat people by the waiting line. If you're the third group in line and there is a table for 6 people  available to fit they will seat the people who are first in line even if they are only a party of 2. Second the servers are polite and helpful & took the orders with ease.... But when our food arrived it was 45% wrong and some plates were missing, so that was disappointing. Third, on your receipts they charge you a tip automatically! Which is random. So don't tip them extra.

Staying at the W stumbled upon this place at 1am and it was awesome!!! I had the steak and eggs. Yummmy! My husband said the breakfast burrito was probably one of if not the best breakfast burrito he has ever had! Service is fast and the food was great! Loved it!!!!

I came to SLS just to meet up with an old college friend for dinner, while we were both in town. We both had prix fixe dinners. The service was good and the prix fixe prices were very reasonable for the amount of food, but the food was not particularly memorable for me - except for the dessert.

Things are a little subdued here at the Northside Cafe this Wednesday night before the Mayweather fight. This coming weekend I'm sure the crowds will be starting to form and this place will be packed (not to mention the Rock In Rio crowds later in the month)!
The last time I was here, I had an order of nachos which was really yummy and the gf had the infamous pastrami sandwich. Our server on the graveyard shift was Nicole and she provided great service and was the reason we ordered the nachos. She was very knowledgable about the menu and was very friendly and pleasant. 
Tonight we're here on the graveyard shift an the restaurant is about 1/3 full. Still a decent sized crowd for a Wednesday with not too much going on in town. 
Tonight's server is Henry. He did a good job, was attentive and on top of things. I like the fact that the tables here are cleaned and reset quickly and that the food I had here is consistent. 
I just had a taste of the gf's turkey wrap and it's pretty tasty. Her fries were good too... Still thinking about those nachos... Lol. Thanks Nicole. :) we'll be back.

Had lunch and 3 breakfasts here and found the service and food to be very good.  My lunch consisted of the kung pao chicken, which was full of flavor and veggies and spiced just right.  The only negative was that rice was not included so ordered it on the side.  Not surprised -- another way to force you to pay more for your meal.  Eggs Benedict was awesome, and the sauce was perfect, served with a side of roasted potatoes.  French toast was overpriced, $10 for 2 average bread slices of French toast, nothing else on the plate. However it did taste good.  They serve both American and Chinese food here and do it pretty well.  Prices on the high side, but yes, it is Vegas.  It is just inside the entrance to the SLS hotel and casino.
My wife and I had the huevos rancheros and the chilaquiles. Excellent flavors and huge portions! Our server Joseph was very attentive, friendly and even helped us with some local shopping  info.

I had a great experience here at the Northside Cafe in the SLS resorts and Casino. We visited several times over our stay and Mr. Oliver Mitchell was our server. I am more than grateful to this young man, my fiance left her wallet behind at the table on the first visit and he was nice enough to return it to security and nothing was touched or bothered. He also gave great service and reccomendations on both occasions. The food was great and service was timely and excellent despite the restaurant being busy! Thanks again Oliver!!

my review today is about Mike! he is one of a kind! he is adorable, handsome, professional! the service overall was very low in the hotel but Mike made it perfect! such a nice guy! he was doing everything and more for the customer! can't find enough words of appreciation about todays pleasant situation happened with me! I am telling you guys U can go to this place for very nice meeting with MIKE!!! Thank you Mike if you are reading for you very nice and professional approach! such a pleasure meeting you! Thanks!

Came here twice. Once for a quick to go bite at night, the other for breakfast and we sat in.

Dinner: Ordered the orange chicken-- you have to pay $2 separate for regular WHITE rice. I get that it's Vegas but talk about nickel and diming. Also ordered some dumplings and chicken tenders. The orange chicken was pretty legit, hot, flavorful and tasted good. 4/5 stars. The tenders were also good, no messing those up. The dumplings however, were absolutely terrible and inedible. They were pork and shrimp dumpling and smelled like rotten seafood. The smell penetrated the container and smelled horrendous, -2/5. 

The service was questionable. I needed an extra silverware set, and asked for one. The guy at the counter let me know what he didn't have any more sets to give. I told him I was staying at the hotel and needed one. He says again, "I really don't have any more" mind you, I'm STARING at a cup filled with regular non-disposable silverware. I finally ask for the in house flatware and he grudgingly gives it to me. Next time, try to problem solve instead of telling a customer you don't have a necessary item to eat the food they just ordered. 

Breakfast: this was a more change. We were promptly seated with a kind waitress and ordered. Got the whole hog omelette and  the breakfast burrito. Both came out hot and fresh, and tasted absolutely delicious. The serving sizes were plentiful, and the service was great. 5/5.

We had breakfast and dinner here. Both were outstanding. The avocado toast was delicious - especially with the freshly grated lemon, a nice and unexpected touch. I went in with low expectations for the Chinese food but have to say, we were very surprised. It was authentic and flavorful. Our server Oliver was friendly, informative and made dining at Northside memorable. He made fantastic recommendations and all of them came up aces. Next time we will definitely be back for the hazelnut French toast!

While staying at the Sls my Fianc√© and I decided to dine here, which wasn't a great experience at all. We walked in and sat down, looked at the menu etc. 20 minutes passed and no waiter attended to us, another couple walked in and sat down and a waiter walked right over to them giving them a glass of water. The managers excuse was he didn't see us sit down. Which was a lie because when we walked in he greeted us along with two other servers, and we sat in the booth right in front of his station. Maybe you should change your "Seat Yourself" policy because apparently the servers and managers are in that much of a deep convo, with nothing to do lounging around that they "Did not see us sit down" while it was pretty much empty. We should of just ordered from our room, we probably would of gotten great service that way, like we did this morning for breakfast. We decided to go to Umami Burger which was a great experience with more professional and attentive servers.

I've only eaten breakfast here, but the food is above average. The strawberry waffles are great, but their pancakes are way to dry and cake-y for my taste. Service is pretty good and the staff are very friendly.

Great place for breakfast definitely a must try when youre at SLS i tried their turkey club and sweep potatos and they were amazing. The service was outstanding too my server juan m took great care of us

If you are staying at SLS and don't want to walk 10-15 minutes to Peppermill for breakfast, it is good. The eggs benedict were solid. Get it with avocado instead of bacon, thank me later. 

Just stopped by for breakfast although they are open for lunch and dinner.

Delicious food and cocktails, we went hear for brunch the food and service was so good we came back the next day for breakfast!

Try the cucumber margarita - it is very refreshing!

Place was dirty. Floor filthy. Server was so quiet had to keep asking what?? Coffee had no taste prices are high and the hostess was mean. We asked for a booth and she said 10 min and 3 were available and gave one to someone before us. Not a good experience.

After a long day (and night) on the Vegas Strip and after seeing Britney, we decided to eat here because McDonald's was closed and we didn't have a car for drive thru. I ordered the chicken fried rice. It was good, but costly. I only ate half because I was full and there's no fridge in my room to have leftovers (only a mini bar). This place is also 24/7, but only serves Chinese until 2am.

Ambience was vegas. Server was polite and efficient.  Three mediocre plain pancakes with an cream scoop of margarine was 15 dollars.  Menu is an abbreviated dennys menu but with  less effort put into it.

Great food and an interesting variety to choose from. At the table we had nachos, chilaquiles, waffle with strawberries, chicken sausage, and fried potatoes. 

I switched out the chorizo on the chilaquiles for Barbados beef instead. There was a tangy salsa verde which was pretty good.

They serve the Chinese menu after 11 am and the items looked good. They even had chow fun which was a surprise. I love that stuff.

Our server was Tina and she was great! Friendly, attentive, and got everything right. Definitely a good spot to try when nursing a hangover, not that I am hungover, but the menu is setup to cover all the hangover food groups in the hangover food pyramid of Booze, sweets, greasy, carbs, breakfast, and tacos. Enjoy!

The ambiance of this place is a 4 or a 5- it's very nice-looking and the staff is nice. Wendy was our waitress. 
However, I would give the the food and coffee a 2.5. We came here for breakfast - we ordered coffee, a breakfast burrito and eggs Benedict. When I added milk to my coffee, it curdled up and floated in chunks to the top. Gross. I told the waitress and she got me a new coffee and milk. The new one had one small curdle but I drank it anyway because I am a coffee fiend and was coffee-deprived. The coffee was also very weak...you could see right through it (see my picture). We didn't want to complain and wait again so we just drank it. The second refill was better. The cups were tiny though (I'd say 4 ounces) and they cost $4 each with free refills. We only got two cups each and were not offered additional refills before getting the check. We saw other people walking out with to-go cups so we asked for the same. I kind of expected the coffee to be taken off the bill (since the milk was spoiled)  but it wasn't. 
My breakfast burrito tasted good but it was 80% potatoes, which I would not expect at a price of $15. The eggs benedict was okay also. 
If you are a coffee enthusiast staying at SLS Vegas, I'd definitely recommend Perq, their coffee was delicious.

I've eaten here several times. Since the second time I couldn't wait to get back here. The waffles had me hooked!  They are on the light and crispy side so I put them away fast. I ordered another right away to have my fill.  Can't wait to go back...again and again...

Btw, cocktails are good quality here and start at 8 bucks which is what you would pay for well drinks on the main strip. Enjoy!

The Northside burger inside the SLS was AMAZING!!!  The service was great. My friend and I went our first night in Vegas I ordered the Northside burger then we went back the second day with our husbands and I ordered the same burger actually we all ordered it!!! Very tasty!

Not crazy about this place.  The service was slow starting and just not very welcoming.  The menu is just weird.  Does this want to be a Chinese, Mexican, Italian, American?  Almost random selections of food.  I opted for the Chinese ... The eggplant vegetable dish had a decent sauce.  You would think they'd include rice and chopsticks but nope.  

It's on the strip and in the hotel so it's priced higher than anyone should pay.  If this was off strip and lower price ... And had a more streamlined selection and included rice with its Chinese dishes and chopsticks and well ... I'm sure I can think of lots of other things.  It would be much better.  With so many special places on the strip, you are better off going somewhere else (or even a chain if you want to be more price conscious)

Great Chinese food for a hotel cafe'. We ate here after checking into the W Hotel at midnight. Bartender and server were both WONDERFUL. Definitely recommend the fresh squeezed margaritas and spring rolls, it may sound like an odd combination but so so good.

Our waiter who I believe was French was a very nice guy very professional very friendly. The atmosphere in this place is somewhat different than other places. Don't get me wrong, they dropped $415 million renovation this hotel, so it's nice, but different. 

Wife and I only had the chicken noodle soup, which I m sorry, was no bueno. Too much carrots and celery and not enough chicken. The noodles were too tough, but when you hungry, you ll eat it. Besides hamburgers and breakfast menus salad so on so forth this restaurant also serves it's Chinese menu. Sorry, I would not go back to this place- 

Just put a Denny's in there and you ll do better-

This place is called "Northside Caf√© and Chinese Kitchen" well guess what - they don't even serve Chinese or any pan-asian food until after 12:00noon. Lame. Severs were next to impossible to find - good luck getting a refill of your water here. 

I think the most pleasant aspect of my meal here was the the cigarette smoke wafting in from the open wall to the casino.

Greater by a warm friendly hostess and seated right away. Servers were super efficient, welcoming and friendly. I would give the service 5 stars. The food came out very quickly which was awesome and while the food was good, it wasn't anything amazing or special. It suited our needs and filled our bellies. The price was fair and if the food was a little better, I would have given them 5 stars. Kudos to the staff though... They are awesome and totally impressed us.

I stopped by for dinner.  The guacamole was good; but, since they put the pico de gallo in the same dish without draining off the liquid, it was watery.  I had the ravioli and they were so-so...not sure how to explain except that they tasted warmed up... The sauce was either watery, like they didn't drain the water, or oily...  I'm thinking watery..  not a great experience.  I had an Arnold Palmer and this drink can be very different from restaurant to restaurant; but, I enjoyed it,  I would order the guacamole again, but ask to separate the Pico de Gallo and I would order the drink again.

If you're staying in SLS, definitely the best spot for a variety of foods is Northside. From burgers to Chinese food either way you can't go wrong. OLIVER MADE OUR EXPERIENCE HERE THE BEST. We've been here a few times and he was hands down the most exceptional server we had. SHOUT OUT to you man! Thanks for your hard work and keeping on top of everything- especially at busy times.
I really liked the decor with its exposed brick walls. The chicken Parmesan was pretty tasty but it was our server Tony that was excellent !!

SLS sent us a voucher for 2 complimentary entrees, dine in only. It's completely free? Sure, why not? We got nothing to lose. So my boyfriend and I had dinner here on a Monday night.

My boyfriend ordered the Chicken Milanese-lightly breaded & pan friend chicken breast with garlic toasted kale. He said the chicken was way too thick....and dried. He enjoyed his kale so much better.

I was in the mood for pasta so I ordered the Whole Wheat Penne Primavera-zucchini, onions, roasted tomatoes, broccolini and roasted garlic. I requested to add grill chicken to it but they forgot. -__- oh well. This pasta had absolutely NO TASTE. Without sprinkling a bunch of black peppers and red pepper flakes, I probably wouldn't eat more than 5 bites. Heck, the roasted tomatoes and my garlic bread tasted better than the entire entr√©e!!!!!!! 
When you enjoy your sides more than your main entr√©e, there's a problem here.

Also, my boyfriend wanted to order house wines and they didn't even have the main ones available....like chardonnays, merlot, pinot, etc. He wasn't too pleased with that.

Disappointing restaurant. Never tried The Griddle Caf√© when it was still here but I'm sure their food tasted better than THIS.

I came to northside for breakfast on Tuesday morning with my co workers before our meeting the place was really busy but even though they were so busy the   food came out quick our server juan m was quick to come to take our order and bring the drinks.i would recommend this place for a quick bite before work   or simply having breakfast

Stopped in here at about 10:30pm which in Vegas time, I get it - it's super early. In eastern time it's okay everyone-chug-your-drink-and-order-another-before-it's-last-call time. So their menu says "breakfast 24 hours" which my confused time zone of a body thinking it was probably post-bar, drunk food time decided that pancakes sound the best. When we tried to order pancakes the waitress said "pancakes take too much prep time so they're not available". These must be some serious pancakes because I've never heard of such elaborate preparation for a plop of runny cake batter like dough on a skillet...

They also have a secret menu if you ask but it's like a mini version of the regular menu all printed out. The whole point of the secret menu is for it to be secret and should never be written out for the average common folk meandering through Vegas to stumble upon.

Anyways, I got the Al Pastor tacos and they were good.

Even in the Gomorrah that is Vegas, sometimes you just want some comfort food.  Northside Cafe is the casual dining option at the SLS hotel designed to satisfy that craving.

Pretty broad menu - burgers to steaks to a Chinese DimSum menu that kicks-in in the late afternoon.  Serving sizes were hearty and the food was well prepared.  But it leans toward the expeinve side for what you get.  $15-$20 for a burger and fries, as an example, is hard to swallow just after you split aces at the nearby blackjack table and ended up losing both hands.

I would give this a zero if that were possible. This may be the most horrid meal, and dining environment I have had in two years, and I have eaten in third world countries!
I was looking for good Chinese dim sum, like the picture outside the building. What we got was a highly confused menu- part Mexican, part Chinese; at least that's what the names of the food implied. What we actually got was oily yuck. If one has dry skin, then one visit here and that person will be sweating oil for days upon days. The Baja taco, the won tons, and the tortilla chips had all been fried together and equally, had no flavor. The cook forgot to drain the oil, but certainly remembered the salt. Hint: a little salt is good, a container makes the food inedible.
Yet I paid. I paid the inefficient server because we hadn't sent it back. I tipped 10% for never having been asked anything about the meal, but being continuously provided copious amounts of weak ice tea.
Don't eat here. Unless you wish to spend quality Vegas time in the nearest Restroom.

Awesome nutella french toast and french pressed coffee! I've had some of their lunch/dinner items as well and they were tasty as well. They have American, Mexican and Chinese menu items - random combination but I guess catering all tastes. 

We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Stay on Las Vegas Blvd., this was a decent restaurant within a 5 minute walking distance. 

Wait was about 15-20 minutes for a Friday morning, not too bad. Our waitress was super busy, we didn't see her until 30 minutes after we sat down (the hostess had to take our drink and food orders). There was no wait when we came for dinner.

Food was good....a little on the pricey side. My 2 Nutella French Toast were $15. I think the staff were a little short handed. I finished my water and was dying of thirst after eating Nutella, but didn't get a refill until I we were done.

We had the best time and food! Kassey our waiter was fantastic.  We have been here all week and have had nothing but great food from here. Thank you northside cafe and sls for a great time... money in the wallet is always the way to leave!

I got a free breakfast here when SLS messed up my stay (another long story).  Anyhow, I had very adequate lunch.  This is a small little diner right off the casino floor.  I ordered the vegetable wrap with avocado instead of asparagus and country potatoes instead of fries.  The  potatoes were bland and greasy.  The wrap was bland too.  I asked for buffalo sauce to liven the party and it worked.

The staff was super friendly and accommodating.  All of my requests were granted without a fuss.  As for a quick meal, this place is fine--if a little overpriced.  However, the other food choices are so much better here that I can only see myself choosing this spot  for convenience.

Went here on Social Sunday which something that SLS features every sunday. Different restaurants take turns giving locals 50 percent off pretty much the entire menu. This alone is what attracted me to this establishment.

Yes, I know they used to be Griddle Cafe (which I am sorry for not doing a review even though I have visited twice already), so I had mixed expectations. Well, im here to tell you that the generous portions are no more. :(

My wifey ordered the Red Velvet Pancakes ($12.95) with a Latte ($3.75) and I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak ($14.95).

Like before, I have ordered the Golden Ticket when it was GC. It was 3 huge pancakes about 12 inches in diameter. (That's what SHE said). For these guys, it was more like 6 inches. Basically, same price but half the size. The Red Velvet pancakes themselves were pretty good. Fluffy with some sweetness to it. Topped off with a cream cheese frosting and chocolate shavings. The latte was decent.

The Philly Cheesesteak was a pretty good size. Has thinly sliced strips of grilled sirloin mixed with grilled onions and melted provolone cheese. It came with a side so I chose sweet potato fries which were very good. Puts regular fries to shame.

Service was good. Kailena was our server and did not disappoint. Took our orders and brought our food out in a timely manner. Even refills on our waters were done without asking for it.

In closing, everything was on point. I only spent $17.10 because of the 50 percent discount plus 5 bucks tip. When I say on point I mean the price I paid was worth it. Under normal circumstances I would not come back to pay the marked up prices for what you get. The locals discount is what will bring me back because what you can get here is what you can probably get for half that at some other restaurants. It's good to be a local. Oh and they are open 24 hours.

Yelp 2015 review #20
518 overall

I went to this place twice during my stay at the SLS hotel, once for lunch and once for breakfast.  

For lunch, I had the chicken taco and tomato soup.  I wasn't too impressed by either, they weren't bad, but not the best either. It felt very "machine" made.  I would give lunch two stars.

However, for breakfast, I had the protein fritatta, which came with egg whites, spinach, ham and some other stuff. This was filling and wonderful. In addition, they serve French press coffee, which was strong and flavorful.  So 4 stars for that.

So balance the two out, and you get 3 stars - in other words, it's okay.

Tony was great. 

Needed a quick meal before a concert. He got us in and out ....

I was even able to fill out this post 

Popcorn shrimp and Nachos are awesome

This morning we ate at the North Side Cafe at the SLS Hotel and Casino and it was fabulous. I ordered a strawberry waffle,  breakfast potatoes,  and scrambled eggs.  The waffle was fluffy yet crispy and was not soggy. My friends ordered chilaqiles Verde and they said it was delicious.  The servers were very friendly but I have to say we had to wait about 10 minutes before being seated. This is a restaurant we would definitely come back to.
Subpar service. Baja fish tacos were awful.  Mostly breading with a terrible sauce. The two egg breakfast was typical but good.

We stood at SLS Hotel & Casino on 3/24/18 and decided to choose a restaurant downstairs for dinner.  After doing the "rounds", we decided to come to Northside as they had a variety of food options.  I ordered the braised tofu with brown sauce with a side of brown rice, and it was excellent!  The side of rice was less than $2 and it was a good portion.  My boyfriend ordered a hamburger with fries, and my friend ordered chicken wings with fries.  All around, the food portions were big, and everything is reasonably priced for what you get.  It's cozy in there, but hip, and they do have televisions all around.  I would definitely eat here again.

The food here is amazing! Really really good! Big portions But service kinda sucks. Ordered banana pancakes and they brought me the wrong pancakes to start with then I had to wait 10 mins for the correct order to come out. Then our waiter didn't really pay any attention to us. Was too busy with other tables we waited a while for the check finally. And waited awhile for the food to come to the table
Great selection, energy, music, convenience... DONT ORDER TOO MUCH FOOD she got an omelette & I got French toast- split it and save money and avoid wasting food.

Their portion sizes are great!! My first time in Vegas and this was the place we went to for breakfast. I had the omelette platter and it was delicious !! It came with toast and a side of potatoes. The only thing that I didn't like was that the coffee tasted old.

Located inside the SLS, Northside Cafe is the only restaurant open 24/7 with a wide selection of American and Chinese foods. It's located right across from the pool entrance and also next to the other Chinese restaurant. Entrees are on the expensive side and the taste quality doesn't match the $$$ tag. The room service food you order come from the kitchens inside Northside Cafe. 

Ambience (4/5): Restaurant is very sleek looking. Cafe was never empty the two times I was there, tons of occupied tables. There are both large booths and small tables for any party size. Great place for people watching too, as you get get all sorts of people walking into grab a bite.

Food (2.5/5): I ordered the beef chow fun and the Char Su buns. Beef chow fun had a great taste despite there being way more vegetables than actual noodles and protein. The char su buns was a disappointment though. Despite its high price point for two small buns ($6), the buns were not  made in-house. Most likely ordered from a frozen food purveyor. the bun texture was very doughy and didn't have much meat inside. 

Service (4/5): Table was not very clean when I was seated. I had to ask one of the staff members to wipe it again. Otherwise, service was excellent. 

I would definitely try Northside Cafe again if I find myself on the North side of the strip late at night. I would just stay away from the Asian menu/selection.

Terrible service because the cashier , servers are just standing there when there are people waiting to be seated , get their orders in and pay and leave. 
Some of the employees look like they are half asleep.

Awesome food but a little pricey. Some of the best eggs benedict and chocolate pancakes I ever had. Yum. Definitely a great spot for breakfast and I also heard their sandwiches are delicious. I would give this place a try if you're in the area. Nice selection of food and everything on the menu sounded good.

Ehh.

Quite the disappointment. I had been looking forward to trying Northside Cafe for quite a while. 

Tonight, while doing some gambling at the SLS, we decided to grab a bite to eat here.

Ordered-

- Combination Fried Rice ($11.95) with pork, shrimp, and chicken
- Orde of Chicken Wings (plain) ($9.95) with ranch sauce on the side
- 1 side order of Garlic Mashed Potatoes ($6.95)
- 1 Diet Pepsi, 1 Water

(+) Service was probably the best thing about this experience, as the young lady who waited on us was friendly and attentive, certainly no complaints regarding the service
(+) chicken wings were actually pretty good! Only 6 to an order, but at least they were tasty.

(-) garlic mashed potatoes were a huge disappointment. First, the portion size was pathetic. This was roughly about 6-7 bites. This should have run $3 at the most. $6.95 is downright criminal. Plus their definition of garlic was ready mix mashed potatoes with a few garlic dices on top. Very disappointing.
(-) Combo Fried Rice was plentiful in portion, but extremely bland. At least I know they don't use any MSG in their Chinese foods. That dish was way too bland to have included any measurable amount of MSG!

Maybe one day we will return to try some of the breakfast menu items, but this was a bit of a letdown and I don't see myself going out of my way to go back..

Maybe I will try Ku Noodle next...after all I am one of those rare locals that actually likes playing at the SLS...

for Northside Cafe though, it will have to be..

2 stars.

Meh. I've experienced better.

The banana pancakes are amazing I suggest getting those. I tried something else wasn't a big fan but it was decent. The waiter was kind enough to offer something else and take it off my ticket. I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in Vegas, if not for the pancakes then for the excellent service.

This place hit the spot right on!! The server was amazing, knowledgeable and prompt at 4:00 am.... what more can you ask for NADA  stop & eat here!! The food was good, not fast food... I had rice & chicken and a beer. Lol.. loved it. Such a nice change from your late nite diner eating after the club. We need places like this in NJ

Since we received a 2 for 1 entree postcard, we decided to try the Northside Cafe on a Sunday night. Super busy--had to wait in a fairly efficient/organized line. Nice atmosphere/cool booths/retro chairs/nicely done interior.

The service was extremely slow--cordial enough, but oh so slow! Perhaps it was all the hungry tourists, or maybe all the locals came in for the 2 for one deal?

The food: Mixed reaction here: Husband said it was "good"--even though they brought him a different entree than what he ordered (he was too hungry to send it back)...I found the Chinese cuisine to be simply meh--not horrible, but not Wow! or anything.

Will we go back again? Yes, probably for a 2 for 1 deal--but will most likely do a salad or a sandwich--since the Chinese cuisine didn't cut the mustard for me.

Nice that it's open 24/7 and has a wide variety of menu items.

Street shrimp tacos were good but I think there could have been more/bigger shrimp - it's Vegas right?  My colleague  orders eggplant Chinese dish at looked spicy but he said it was also tasty spicy.  Service was slow at first but later attentive.  Perhaps distracted or busy at the beginning.   Not bad lunch ... think a cafe or diner.
Our server Richard was awesome.  He helped us the two times we ate here, and we'll be back!  Very helpful and great recommendations on and off the menu.
Best bloody Mary I've had in Vegas ... the carnitas hash needed more carnitas but a great meal none the less

I came with some of my friends for a late lunch and it wasn't as great as I hoped it would be. Our server was not very attentive, and was chatting it up with people at the bar and even told us to hold on. On the up side I ordered the GRANOLA PANCAKES and they were delicious. I hope the restaurant finds better staff to attend to the customers.

The food is super average bit the service is aweful.  I know it is hard to find good employees but these guys are  unresponsive  and rude.  Go to McDonald's at least you get a smile with  your bad food.

Great food that was a big surprise. One item I see on a lot of reviews is the service, but I thought the service was just fine.

I had the omelette and a side of flap jacks (don't judge me). All came out really good and again service was great.

Will be returning.

I was at the SEMA show at the convention center and the SLS hotel was within walking distance so I thought lets find some food there.

The options at the SLS aren't that great but Northside Cafe looked promising (for a Cafe in a casino).

Me and wife but got breakfast options,  the ham steak and eggs and corned beef hash.   The ham steak and eggs was good and a the portion size was decent...the corned beef hash was also pretty good (massive amounts of butter!) but the portion size was comically small.

The bloody mary was decent and oddly enough the standout item from this meal was the piece of Rye toast I got with my ham steak and egg.  For some reason it was just really delicious.

The price is typical for this type of place,  ~15 dollars an entree.   

I was considering giving this place 4 stars because in terms of the food it's actually in the upper half of casino cafes but the hostess was really rude (or just clueless?).   When we were leaving, I asked the hostess if there was a place in the hotel that served coffee.  She was like well we serve coffee here...and gave me attitude while pointing to the sign above her saying "well this is a CAFE."    I was like uh...ok.      Technically what she said isn't wrong but it's how she said it that's the problem.

Wow although amazing restaurants everywhere my gf and I ended up stopping my Northside Cafe and not only great food but customer service was great! Luciano was our bartender and made us custom drinks and was on top of his game. Def recommend!
there burger are so good and taste like a nice summer day at little league base baseball game when your a kid with a cold soda there really good.

This place was great for morning hangovers! Some of the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had were made by Luciano Gesualdo behind the bar! And the portions of the entrees was neither too small nor too large. The service was fast too, no waiting. Would definitely go there again.
Pastrami sandwich with sweet potato fries were pretty fantastic. I was unsure of this place, but very happy I came. Great late night meal. Would come back and order the same thing

Loved this diner being in our hotel!  Service and food are really good and affordable (especially for Vegas).  Joseph is the bomb waiter...took good care of us!  Caramelized banana pancakes for the win!

Incredibly bad food. Surprising that a Starwood would put up with this low quality food. 

I had a simple breakfast, eggs over easy, bacon and potatoes. 

The eggs couldn't come out any harder and more well done. They took them back, but left the rest of the food in front of me for over 10 minutes to get cold.

Went back for another Kate night treat. Had the pork buns. They were like rocks. These should be soft and delicious. I know being from NY. When I complained, they looked at me like I was insane. 

Starwood needs to manage the quality better in their hotels.

This is a perfect restaurant to go to if you're out late . My service was perfect and quick , Brian was very informative and professional. The manager on duty was amazing as well. Thank you so much and we will return can to the cafe when we are in Vegas again.

I love this place. Whenever we stay at the W we eat here. The food is great with a large variety, we have always received exceptional service. The longest we have ever had to wait is 5 minutes. Great for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Great food! Ask for Joseph T..He is very nice, answered all our questions and gave us suggestions...Try the dim sum...Also, the caesar salad and grilled cheese with tomato soup. Thank you Joseph for making our experience so enjoyable!  (.:

The garden salad was good, the farmer salad was excellent, as was the house margarita. Food, drink, ambiance, and price point was enough to give it a 4 stars alone, but the service, especially the bartender Mike, was as good as it gets. I came in twice during my stay at SLS because it was open late and there were vegan/gluten free options. On my second visit Mike welcomed me back by name, with a big smile. I dined alone both times and left with a feeling like I had just dined with old friends. You just can't beat that. Love this town, love these people, just a great experience. Cheers y'all!

Arrived around 7pm for a little mother's day dinner. If it's your birthday SLS invites code members for $30 off an order of at least $60 so my mom decided to invite my sister and I for a belated coupon redemption lol. The sign out front read "seat yourself", so we did at a nice big booth where literally 8 people can sit altogether. You know your a family when we all order different entrees just to switch plates to share with each other, at least thats what we always do. Nachos for appetizers, mom had the salmon, sister ordered the grilled cheese with tomato soup and I had the fettuccini alfredo with added shrimp. All the dishes were very filling especially since we couldn't finish the pasta and had to take it to go. We ended with coffee and a slice of cheesecake which fit perfect with a bittersweetness after all the heavy meals. This cafe comes with a bar in the back and has a very open space about it. If you do check in through yelp there's a $5 off promo to use in any specialty cocktail.

Great fun and smiles at Northside Cafe! James, my server was great, attentive without being overbearing and friendly. Love going into a place where everyone is happy and smiling.
Ordered the Greek Salad, you would think there is no risk with such an item, but it can be. The portion was perfect, dressing not over the top and super fresh! Thanks Northside Cafe!

We ate there two mornings in a row as the food was delicious and ample portion sizes... and our server was fantastic! Joseph managed to recommend two very good cocktails to accompany our final breakfast which was a very appreciated recommendation. Joseph was not only really helpful without being intrusive, but a great personality and felt like a friend. Great job!

Update since the restaurant responded on Yelp: I want you to know that the service and quality of food only went downhill since my first post. After literally begging someone to take our order, we received out meals with incorrect items. In addition, the hot and sour soup was like tar. I had ordered a pork bun - knowing it would take 20-25 minutes. After being told 2x that it would be on our way, the waiter showed up 30 minutes after the order to say my meal was never placed. So no food for me... 

Sure they discounted our tables' meals, but since I ordered the soup and bun, l left with no meal. This was a horrible experience! Go elsewhere. This reassurance is not staffed to service customers and the food was awful!

Surprising Little Spot at SLS. (See what I did there?) 

It's not so little but I was surprised by how much I like the food here. Yes it's perhaps pricey but it is inside a Vegas casino. You can't compare these prices to a diner or going directly to chinatown. But then you can use comps here if you gamble so it's a wash. They have a nice variety of food; and it's interesting that they also have Chinese food. I'm pretty sure that it's to cater to Asian clientele who only eat Asian food (like my mother). 

I'm sorry that I didn't photograph everything that I've tried here, but I did share all the dishes we have tried between the last two visits. We have had the wings, fried rice, salt and pepper pork chops, wonton noodle soup, huevos rancheros, steak and eggs, and waffles. I wish the quality of the steak was a little better, and the waffles I got had way too much whipped cream. Like I scraped all of it off and it filled up another plate. 

If you're already staying at SLS/W, this is definitely a great dining option.
OMG this place is yummy.  I had the carnival torta, the meat was so juicy and tender.  Prices are very reasonable and portions generous

My girlfriend and I go here for breakfast on our weekends. You can never go wrong with the hazelnut chocolate French toast! She will either get the breakfast tacos or eggs Benedict... sometimes both!! We love this place. Great cheat day restaurant!! If you're fitness addicts like us!

24hr spot in the SLS hotel.. Food pretty good. I ordered the shrimp cocktail and buffalo chicken flatbread. Shrimps was really good.. The pizza wasn't bad just had too much garish and onions on JT.. Chicken was crispy and diced up which was good. Overall pretty nice place to come

Many of the reviews listed long wait times. I am pleased I did not experience that. However, as many have noted the service is not good. 
Once seated it was exactly 13 min before someone came to take an order, I ordered coffee. My meal arrived long before my coffee did. My wife ordered a side order pancake. As of this review breakfast is almost done and no pancake. And no one has checked on us in over 20 min. 
Upside coffee is good.

Follow up: just before bill came out pancake showed up. Eye rolling. No explanation, nothing just here you go. 

There is a family style restaurant not in hotel about 3/4 mile away. Go there.

Came by for a quick breakfast and this did the trick. 

And yet, I felt kind of underwhelmed. A little smaller portion. Potatoes that were just ok.

A few days afterwards, I just can't remember anything too memorable about the meal.

Good big coffee. That I remember, but the rest, it's fine. Just like Vegas.

I'm local and enjoy the great service this fine city thrives on. After asking for the locals menu the server seemed pissed. Locals who literally live next door and potentially come over a lot more than the once a year clientele = more tips. I'll have to say the worst & nastiest service I've had in LV. 4 of us had drinks & food   Would have had 2 drinks if asked. Finally showed up with check before clearing table or asking if we wanted anything else. Horrible.  BTW the foods good. What a shame.

This place isn't as good as before under different name. We went there this Saturday and we thought it would be same as before but food serving got smaller and we were still hungry after. So we went and ate at the pizza place in sls.

Love this cafe!  We were staying in the W Hotel during our stay in Vegas.  The Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen was located in the lobby are of the SLS.  So, it was a stone's throw from our hotel lobby.  We enjoyed 2 breakfasts and 1 lunch during our stay.  Everything was delicious.  I personally enjoyed the pancakes and LOX for breakfast.  We enjoyed fried rice one day for lunch that was equally delicious.  Food service was prompt.  My only complaint was the promptness of receiving the final bill.  The wait staff was so busy that we did have to wait awhile to check-out.  Otherwise, it was a great experience.

It's in Vegas!  What can you say?  The food portions are generous.  The drinks are bottomless.  They serve a few ethnic types of food.  American, Spanish and Chinese.

I had the breakfast and it was hearty.

I have tried their Chinese menu.  The Kung Pao Chicken and Eggplant dish they were Asian but something was missing.  Can't think of it but I will update later.

Because it was right next to the slot machines the ambiance was loud and bright.  Sometimes there is a line to get in.  The food is a bit pricey.

They are open 24/7 that's a huge plus.

I've been here 4 times in the last 3 years. One of my favorite breakfast places. The food is really good! Prices are decent for the amount of food you get! The only complaint I have is the service is slow... Don't be in a hurry and you'll really enjoy it.

Everything from dinner to breakfast was awesome!!!!!!! Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!
Highly recommended day or night if your hungry this is the place to eat while staying at SLS

Second pot of French Press coffee was really good, first was nothing special. Still, very nice to have a personal fresh pot for a 'diner'-ish style place. Early breakfast of steak & eggs, eggs done as an omelette with avocado, asparagus, and salsa (nice options, although I crafted it myself from ingredients I saw they had on other menu items). Steak was good as well. 

Above my expectations for a "breakfast joint", would happily come back if convenient.  I appreciate the server and kitchen's flexibility on my order modifications.

I really hope SLS cleans up its acts before its too late.

Northside Cafe is a great example of whats wrong with all the recent dining shake ups at SLS. I dined as a few friends and identified ourselves as locals with ID in hands. Despite being confirmed by our server, we charged full price for everything we ordered. Upon bringing it up to our server she informed us that our card was missing a sticker identifying us as locals despite having our IDs showing our addresses in hand. It would have been nice to know that when we told you that we we locals before we ordered. Whatever.

I probably wouldn't have been that annoyed if the food had actually been worth the price. It wasn't. Northside is mostly traditional cafe fare you can find pretty much anywhere. The fries from my burger were cold and had clearly been sitting there for a while. The street tacos were tiny. Fortunately the banana pancakes were good, a hold over on the menu from the previous Griddle Cafe. 

Service was a disaster from start to finish. 30 minute wait time and food took forever to come out. We had to flag down our server for refills and to get our order in. I understand  that all new restaurants have issues starting off but this was just a catastrophe. 1 star! Smh all day.

I'm staying here at the SLS Hotel and this place is very convenient. That being said the service has been great. The staff is friendly and go out of heir way to accommodate you if there are any requests. The food has been very good as well. I'm on the road around 250 nights each year and I'm very happy to have this place in my hotel right now.

This is my first yelp review.
The Chinese food is awful here for Chinese 
You had better no try this restaurant if you want to taste Chinese food.

Don't eat here. There are better breakfast places in Vegas. The potatoes were undercooked and the bacon was soggy. The chilaquiles were made on top of chips, not tortillas which made the dish like nachos. 

I'm only giving this place a 2 because our server was super nice.

Came here while staying in the SLS and it was delicious food! They have a huge selection and wide variety of different sorts of food from Chinese to Mexican to salads to breakfast! I had them for breakfast lunch and dinner! And I could honestly say that all of the different styles of food at different times of the day are delicious!! And to my surprise the staff was amazing and attentive all the times I went! I'll definitely be coming back here not only for the food but for the amazing service I received! LOVE!
Had a great time!!! The food was great and prepared very fast!!!!Amazing service by Joseph!!!! Will definitely come back another time
Service was HORRIBLE! Even the manager offered us desert on the house and they failed to bring that out! The food... When we got it....was really good.
No one talks about the noodle soup with dumpling. It has egg noodle and bokchoy. It hit the spot. I was missing this.

How is it that a notoriously cheap curmudgeon such as myself can give four stars to typically over-priced hotel coffee shop? Because it's pretty frickin' good, that's why! 

I will state my objections and get them out of the way first: It is small, crowded, and noisy. Booths would fit four normal-sized adults (which describes no one in my family), and other than that, they have only tables for 2, so don't go with a crowd. A great deal of the noise is due to the fact that is seems to be perpetually busy in here, which I guess is a good sign, although it also means there's a line, which one normally only encounters at a buffet.

I also wasn't crazy about the decor - the ubiquitous brick and dark industrial gray that seems to be the signature color of hipsters everywhere, and the too-loud background music did nothing for me, but maybe this was the ambience they were going for. 

But now that I have finished complaining that it's not Denny's, let me tell you the good part: it's not Denny's! The wait staff is very prompt, friendly, and noticeably young. I pointed this out to the Anaconda, and we agreed that it's a definite contrast to your usual Las Vegas coffee shop wait staff where at least a couple of the employees have been there since sage brush was growing in the parking lot.

But the best thing is, as it should be, the food. What a surpise! The Eggs Benedict  ($14) were great- perfectly cooked, runny yolks, smokey bacon (or ham, who cares?), nice tender potatoes, and a really great Hollandaise; rich and lemony and not from a mix. The Whole Hog omelette  ($14) was so good, the Anaconda wanted to get one again the next day, but I wouldn't let him because I wanted to try the caramelized banana pancakes, so he ordered those and I had steak and eggs. For $18, I was prepared to be picky since you can get a decent special for $4 around town, but this steak was tender and juicy and the bread was thick sliced and tasted homemade. It was even good when it got a little cold because I was busy battling the Anaconda over those pancakes.

Normally, I am not a fan, because I find them heavy and akin to trying to eat a blanket. These were more like pillows. Light and tender and airy and topped with caramelized bananas and optional crunchy streusel topping. Yum. And in case that's not sweet enough for you (it wasn't), the accompanying bottle of maple syrup will put it over the top. Wash it down with a shared pot of French pressed coffee, and the noisy crowd will disappear around in a euphoric haze.

You know what's surprisingly good and conveniently located in the hotel you happen to be staying at? Northside! I would definitely check it out if you're at the SLS or W Las Vegas. The name sounds ridiculous, and how/why would you have a Mexican/American/Chinese restaurant at the same time and possibly have decent food, right?

Well. It's decent. The Huevos Rancheros had a hard shell, which was odd, but the asada bowl was good to my taste. Furthermore, the portions were ridiculously huge, which is great because hey, you need more energy to power through the day.

GOOD: no wait, happy servers, decent food, big portions
OKAY: location (depending on where you are and staying, as it's off the strip)
BAD: odd combo of recipes that sometimes might not work

legit the best french toast I've ever had in my life. 

definitely would go back, service was good! price was a little high for portion size though but that's okay.
Love Lola, she was the best. We will be going back especially when she is on duty.

as for 24 hour cafes in Vegas, this one does well at 2am.  Ordered the steak and eggs of course - (VEGAS MUST) and the meat was tender and a better grade of meat as for what NY Sirloin is.  Service can be a bit lacking - thus the one star deduction, so I think it would help if they hired one more waitress.   They also have an espresso machine, and the latte was made well.  Overall the food is good.

If you're a local, keep in mind you have to ask to see the special locals menu. Asking for the discount afterward, even with ID, doesn't work here.

The ambiance is nice, the employees are friendly, and the food is good. I really liked the Orange Chicken and would order it again.

The drawbacks here are in other areas, like the previously mentioned locals issue. Also, the menu posted outside with tons of delicious breakfast items isn't the menu offered in the evening - so if you're ready for pancakes, think again.

During my last visit a guest came in with no shoes on to get alcohol from the bar; no staff said anything about this, which was pretty unsettling. We informed the waiter but he didn't seem very interested.

Northside was the best! We stayed at the SLS this week and went to each of the restaurants onsite. Even though Bazaar Meats and Katsuya are more fine dining Northside has hands down the best service. The guys at the counter and the servers were so kind, knowledgeable and fast. We LOVED the burger and could not speak higher of staff there.

I've been here several times. Sometimes I've paid full price, while others they've been comped because of casino play. I haven't had anything I didn't like yet. I've had their wings, their nachos, their sea bass, and their steak. Everything was delicious. Just don't order the steak expecting steakhouse quality steak. 

Oh, and their cucumber margarita is spot on. Refreshing and literally intoxicating!

I just hope Tom Y. reads this: why complain publicly about a place when management already did everything they could (comped your meal) to make up for what you believed to be lack of service?  You sir don't deserve anymore free meals, but I'm sure you'll weasel your way into them in the future.

The food is average, but the service is the worst. I ate here 3 times in two days cus its the easiest and i like the simple good options, i think that i had the worst service of my life all 3 times, i should gave taken a can to subway or something, that's how bad it was.
Joseph was the best for my friends and I. He's so fun and personal. Exquisitely gentleman like. Genuine and puts us at ease. Thanks joe!

My friend took me to this cute little cafe while visiting the SLS hotel. The hostess seated us promptly and the menu had a lot of special breakfast and lunch choices. I ordered the L.E.O scramble which was an onion scramble layered with thick cuts of smoked salmon with a side of bagel and a dollop of sour cream. I really wanted to try their pancakes since it consisted of interesting combinations such as a carrrot cake style, red velvet pancake style, and the caaramelized banana pancake. I hadd to try it, but didn't want to order a whole order of it since it was a 3 stack.. Our waitress gave me the option of getting it as a side, so I ended up ordering a caramelized banana pancake. Our orders came all at once, and the portion size was huge! The pricing is a little higher than any other cafe's, but the portion size makes up for it. The food was delicious, and the pancake was REALLY, Melt in your mouth good!! the dynamic of all all the tastes just mesh together. We enjoyed our meals and had leftovers to take with us. Service was great, the food was great. I will be back :) 

PS- it's open 24 hours, but will get really packed after midnight since the Foxtail nightclub is RIGHt next store.

The food is GOOD without a doubt but that's about it. We waited outside after talking to the hostess for about 15 minutes. We were seated only because we saw the restaurant was empty and went in to ask about seating again. After being seated, we waited for our server for another 10 minutes. Then our party of 6 was given 5 waters, coffee with no spoons, and overall inattentive service. If my party and I weren't so hungry, we would have left for sure. Again, the food was really good but the service was ridiculous. After everything was said and done, the bill came with an included 20% gratuity... So we were forced to tip for crappy service.
Have been going to this cafe for awhile.  Great service.  Ate there last night with my family, had a great server, Christian, who made some wonderful recommendations.  Keep up the great service y'all

I would consider myself a cheerleader for the SLS.... I have been there several times, enjoy the facility and the staff... so i really wanted to like this place. 

Experience yesterday did not enable me to unfortunately. 

I came to redeem a food offer id received and went for what i had hoped to be a quick and smooth business lunch, which did not turn out to be the case. 

First: fries came out cold - but i kept eating them because thats what i do... and i was mad at myself for it. 

Second: I understand that not every place can cook a burger to order, but just don't ask how i want it if you're clearly not going to attempt to do it that way. I ordered mine medium rare and it came out put-it-on-the-grill-and-go-take-your-dog-for-a-walk-and-call-your-grandma well done.  Again, not a huge deal if that's what i'm expecting... but i can get something like that at mcy-ds.

Third: service was slow. Took about 10 minutes from getting the bill to leaving, and the place wasn't even crowded. This was particularly annoying because we were in a bit of a hurry. 

I know this restaurant just got started (at least in its current branding).... so i'm really leaving this review in hopes they can turn it around. The first few months are crucial so it's not the time to be blowing it. Maybe it's time for a locker room pep talk and get the team back in the game.

I've eaten here three times this week because I'm in the hotel. I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Overall, the food has been a huge disappointment every meal. The pork tacos were bland and tasteless. How do you mess up tacos? The steamed buns came out cut open on top and the spongey dough began to harden before I could even finish. Service wasn't great either. The value of what you are getting is poor when you consider the price. But it's the only thing available 24/7 in the SLS.
I had an amazing time here. Lola was our server. I had dim sum, grilled cheese and tomato soup. Our service was delightful. We will be returning soon.

This place reminded me of coffee shop with an update. Open 24/7 which good considering that the other restaurants in the hotel are closed Tues & Weds. Had the Barbacoa Tacos with Charro beans and they were the bomb. The rest in my party had a mix of different dish that you said were tasty.

Decent diner type food inside the SLS. 

Very nice attentive service. We came in on a late flight and it was our only dining option in the hotel.

They had a very limited late night menu, but had all the usual suspects covered for that time of night, nachos, burgers, basic  breakfast etc. The nice thing was they had a pretty decent Chinese/Dim Sum menu available beginning at Midnight. I didn't grab one, but the table next to me did,  when you order coffee, you get French press. That's so nice, I wish more places offered that in place of drip coffee. 

I had the Chow Fun some sticky rice and a fat slice of chocolate cake. Just the thing a fat kid needs after a long flight and day on the road. 

The place was nearly empty when we were there. I would even eat here if I wasn't staying in the hotel. 

I'm sure the SLS has some swankier dining experiences,  but if you're just looking for a casual place to grab some grub, this place will fit the bill.

I would come back here strictly for the COFFEE! If based soley on the food, It would probably only get 2 stars. 

THE FOOD: I will start with the coffee. Freshly ground beans in a french press. When I started working full time, I started drinking coffee to get through the day. I didn't like it much but it kept me up... Then I started having REAL coffee... not folgers, and actually really enjoy the flavor. The coffee they make here is GREAT. They only serve french press and they offer 2 sizes. The regular is enough for 2 people (about 3 cups). I did not order the large but it seems like a pretty hefty amount. So, to eat i ordered a breakfast burrito, which i was somewhat disappointed with. It was large and filling but not very flavorful, and the guacomole, sourcream, and pico de gallo was on top of the burrito... I don't know about most people but I like my ingredients on the inside. The potatoes, which at least were inside, were too big. They might has well have wrapped a baked potato in a tortilla. Call me spoiled from Southern California, but It should not take multiple bites to finish one cube of potato in a breakfast burrito. I don't ask for a burger with the ketchup on top of the bun. My girlfriend ordered a Reuben which was definitely better. Go with that.

THE PRICE: A moderate price for Vegas. $14 for the breakfast burrito and $14 for the Reuben. The coffee was $5 which is pricey, but remember you get about 3 cups worth, so it isn't too bad. 

THE VIBE: The Northside Cafe is located in the SLS hotel near the pool, with a pretty casual setting, tables, and bar seating. The staff i encountered was pretty friendly. It is open 24 hours and perfect for a hungover morning, a meal after a dip in the pool, or a late night snack coming back from the clubs. 

OVERALL: The food isn't bad, but if you are a coffee person staying at the SLS Hotel and Casino or even at a nearby hotel trying to get a morning "pick me up", swing by the bar in the back of the Northside cafe and take a french press to go. You're day will go a lot smoother.

Located in the casino area of the SLS hotel this 24 hour cafe is actually very convenient because they serve all types of food ranging from an all day breakfast menu to dim sum, tacos, salads, burgers, and sandwiches. Their dimsum only opens from late night to 6 am so plan accordingly.

We stayed at the W hotel which is located "inside" the SLS hotel so it was really easy to walk downstairs and grab food whenever.

I ordered a Huevos Rancheros for $15 ish and thought it was super odd that mine would come on a hard shell taco instead of the usual soft tortillas which was really my fault bc it did state "hard shelled taco" on the menu :(. The meat also tasted like canned minced meat which I really wasn't a fan of...sorry I've been spoiled with the super cheesy, soft, melty ones you find in the mom & pop Mexican restaurants in Cali...

Anyway, its a good place to go for late night/early morning grubs if you have a group of people who crave different types of food.

Was staying at the Casino and stopped at the cafe for breakfast. We were seated immediately, the cafe was clean and well maintained. Our server was Juan M. He did a marvelous job. He was very helpful and attentive. Checked on us regular and had a great attitude. Our food arrived in a timely manner. I ordered the French toast which was quite delectable. Overall my experience at the cafe was very welcoming. I left the restaurant very satisfied.

Had a late night snack here after going to a show. Our server was great and though we originally received tacos (ordered cheesesteak) it didn't take long for them to correct the dish and I had it right away. 
Sandwich was great, even coming from a Philly guy. Service was great and we were in and out in no time and off to bed.

One of the best brunch breakfast thus far on now the start of my 6th day in VEGAS. Service by Ishmal our server was fast friendly. The blue berry pancakes and huge side of sauce did not disappoint nor did the dark elixir brought to
Table in a French press. While the corned beef was homemade as promised the dish was mostly diced potatoes. Hence the 4 star rating. Bloody Mary was great with maple bacon. Also lose the industry brown napkins.
Awesome food and the staff were fantastic. Very efficient and courteous! Definitely will be back again!

I ate here twice while staying at the SLS hotel and the food is 1 Star ok. The service sucks.  The people were always hanging out huddled around the bar talking while you look at them as you walk in self seating yourself.  The only reason why I ate here for the second time is because I didn't want to walk anywhere to eat at that moment.

For such a nice hotel, I hope the new owner will gut this restaurant and get something better in there.  I mean really? A Chinese food place AND a cafe all in one? That can't ever be good.  And it proves it self to be unworthy.
Don't order the Southwest Salad. That's the only comment I can think of for my experience.

Don't come if you're hungry, slow or no service. The other issue when we first got there the person on the front while I was trying to get her attention, held up her finger while she was on her personal cell phone as if to tell to wait till she was done. Once seated we waited for 10 minutes and finally we got some water, another 10 minutes went by and nobody came to get our order even though two guys were just standing there and talking. Bad customer service, and not recommended for hotel guests. We finally walked out after 20 minutes. This was May 25th around 6 pm. They need CS training or get people that know what CS is.  So sad.

Stopped by here for breakfast again while staying at the SLS. Again, they still take long to do everything. Takes them an hour to bring the food, another hour to bring your check. They only have plain bagels, which is a bummer. BUt their strawberry and nutella waffle was TO DIE FOR!!! I wish i would have had it again before leaving. Im not even a big fan of waffles but this was heavenly...

only main breakfast option.  caramelized banana pancake and breakfast burrito fairly standard but at vegas prices.  pancake a bit more mushy from the banana.  burrito with chunky potato pieces, egg, and some meat.
Great breakfast and our server Juan M was very attentive. The Americano was $2.95--vegas steal!

A pleasant surprise with a simple menu. Stopped for a quick bite and enjoyed the couple of items we tried.

The tomato soup was very tasty with perfect consistency. The grilled cheese on sourdough bread blended three cheeses perfectly and had just enough butter to make it tasty. The fish tacos were great and thumbs up to the beans served with them.

Give this place a shot for a simple bite.

From what I can see it was one of the few Chinese restaurants that was not too overpriced! An open dining room and bar section. It was seat yourself. We ordered one dish which was the noodles and it really had an authentic smell and tasted really good and not too much with oil. Our server was super friendly and talkative.

Food: Philly cheesesteak with sweet potato fries. The food was not bad. The meat was nice and thin and the cheese was a nice velvety texture.
