Guest services: Joseph was our server. He was very attentive to us and got our food and drinks out right away. He had eagle eyes and constantly refilled our cups and checked in on us. He was not over bearing or giving us pressure. Great service!!!

Ambiance: i like the whole diner feel to it. Just confusing how there is a Chinese menu with American food.

Been to Northside Caf√© multiple times and I've been satisfied every single time! It is located inside of the SLS hotel in Las Vegas and since we stay at this hotel a few times a year, this restaurant has been our go to place for quality food. Besides the food, service is the best I've seen in a long time. The place feels really warm and cozy so after a long night this is the perfect place to wrap things up. The Chinese kitchen can use some work but the regular menu is great, especially the breakfast.

Waited about 10 mins before anyone approached our table. Service was mostly detached once they arrived. Waitress just asked us what we wanted, seemed distracted. We had to ask very specific questions to get any answers. She would not help us with questions about drinks - instead, she referred us to the small drink menu at the back of the table which listed 6-7 specialty drinks only. We ordered water. Food was mostly cold (and it came out pretty fast, which was weird) and mostly bland. Jalepenos were possibly the hottest i've ever tasted, not in a good way. A second wait person took over saying our waitress was "overwhelmed."  Overall not a nightmare experience but well below what we would expect from a Strip hotel restaurant.  Getting the tab took 15 mins.

Nick was very friendly and made an excellent recommendation for the beef chow fun. Additionally we got the braised tofu and this is one of the best things I've had. Would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a not-so-noisy yet still busy restaurant with excellent food, great service at a decent price.

Convenient if you're staying at the SLS. Came here for lunch one day and got the buffalo wings and a flat bread pizza. Pizza was not good, but the wings were tasty! They had the perfect amount of Frank's hot sauce and were still crispy.

They're open 24 hours so that's a bonus! We stopped by on the way back to the room after clubbing, and got a burger and a sandwich. Both were good, a little on the pricier side, but still good!

Great ambiance. Great service. Always open! Had a very late dinner here last night - a very fresh farmers salad. This morning I ordered the breakfast tacos and they were even better than I had expected! We sat at the counter and our waiter was Luciano. He was great, and definitely made our dining experience even better

Stayed at the SLS and went here twice bc this is basically the only lunchtime option and the SLS is so far from the strip. 

It has a very broad menu that covers basic fare like sandwiches and salads and also a pretty fulsome Chinese food menu. I was in the mood for Chinese food both times so I tried the pork/shrimp shu mai, cashew chicken, kung pao chicken, mongolian beef, and moo shu pork.  

Everything was pretty good.  I wouldn't mind coming back here again.

mixed feelings...on one hand, the food is good and the cocktails tasty and strong, but the service is TOO slow and aloof...step it up girls and boys, this KEY restaurant at SLS could make or break the hotel.  where is the management?  maybe put a couple on the floor and teach your servers to help each other out and give your tough clientele stellar service.  i saw several folks walking out in disgust and the hotel begs for better!
This place is amazing. I ordered the caramelized banana pancakes and they were to die for. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Christian Santos is one of the best servers!!! Look for him highly recommended... Best place to eat breakfast nice waffle....

Infuriatingly bad service. Long story short, it took over an hour for a take out order that was quoted as being ready in 5-10 minutes over the phone. I eventually got so fed up of waiting at the restaurant with the apathetic staff, I went back up to my room and arranged for the room service staff to deliver my food for me.

The Chinese menu is solid, I will be going again for more when I get the bad taste of their (lack of) service out of my mouth.

+ Hot and Sour Soup: Bold vinegar flavor with lots of tofu, bamboo, and wood-ear mushroom floating about. Came to me boiling hot, even with the 5 minute commute to my hotel room. 
+ Yang Chow Fried Rice: Interestingly included shredded iceberg lettuce in the mix. Shrimp were few but larger sized than other places.

+/- Pan Fried Dumplings: Three to an order, very juicy and well seasoned without being overly salty. Some pieces of pork in the filling were too grisly to chew so I wouldn't order this again.

- Staff will not offer you any updates or apologies while you are waiting at the counter for 20+ minutes after the promised time. They will not offer you something to eat while you wait, they will not apologize, they will not make eye contact with you, they will not acknowledge your presence at all. The one thing they will do, is give you your check as soon as you arrive, without telling you that your food is not ready. I will never make the mistake of tipping BEFORE getting my food from this place again.

Ordered the strawberry waffle which was pretty good, ordered panfried shrimp & pork dumpling was not good at all too much chives, my boyfriend ordered the chilaquiles one word HORRIBLE they were not chilaquiles more like nachos with just some pico and some nasty chorizo. The food is no where near authentic.
Customer service was whatever never got our drinks refilled or ask if we needed anything.
Disappointed :/

Food was excellent and blew away all other 24 hour late night places imo. Especially with the locals menu/pricing the place is a steal and we will for sure be coming back. Our server was awesome but i could kinda see why there's a lot of complaints about the service of this place. Luckily we got a good fast server and the food easily surpassed our expectations... we'll be back

average food for above average pricing....

had the breakfast.  it says you can have it all day but i would skip it everyday.  i cannot describe as anything other then standard food.  the omelet did not make me want to come back.  the potatoes were the red kind, seemed more boiled than anything else.

the service was okay but clearly understaffed, or at least felt that way.

Been here twice in the last 24 hours. Not sure why we went back again after the service was bad and food is average. Probably because we are staying at the hotel and it was convenient. 

No thanks, we have vowed as a group to not return.  It is very confusing because it seems like there is plenty of staff in their red shirts, they just aren't doing their jobs.

I have had dinner several times at Northside and the food is always good. This time we had Juan M as our waiter and he was very impressive. His professionalism, courtesy, efficiency and overall has a  great personality. Being LOCALS we eat there quite often so in the future we will request Juan M whenever he is working.

Without a doubt, the worst Chinese food EVER
Even worse than pfchang which until today I thought was bad. Save your time and money

Love the fact this place is open 24/7! The food was great! I had the breakfast burrito it was huge and delicious! We also ordered the breakfast tacos which were great as well. Can't wait to come back the next time we are visiting!

We had a great experience dining at Northside Cafe while staying at SLS.  Stephanie was a wonderful hostess who helped us understand why the cafe was definitely worth at stop.  Jim was our server both times we stopped in and he could not have been more friendly and hospitable.  The food was very good and creative considering the casual cafe atmosphere.  I especially enjoyed the French Press coffee served table side.  I'll be sure to come back next time I'm at the SLS!

This is a very solid eating place, and it is open 24 hours/7 days a week, which is good because many of the other restaurants in the casino/hotel are not open Mondays-Wednesdays.  We came here mainly for breakfast 3 days in a row - everything we had from the corned beef hash, ham and eggs, banana pancakes, Belgian waffle and French-press coffee were all really tasty and filling, and I would think lunch and dinner would also be pretty solid as well based on their breakfast.  Service was friendly and attentive.  I kind of miss this place!
Food is okay but the really expensive. I guess that what it is for hotel restaurants. Pancakes are really good!

Stayed at SLS and upon a late arrival and check in, the Northside Cafe was recommended to us by the front desk.  We sat at the bar which was very nice and the overnight bartender was great. (sorry that I don't remember his name) My husband and I ordered breakfast for dinner and really really enjoyed it.  We went back the next afternoon (we ate there 3x during our vaca) this time the service was very sketchy, meaning we sat for quite awhile after being seated with no acknowledgement at all, mind you we were seated in the booth directly in front of the "servers" station. But again the breakfast food was great; as it was each time that we did have a meal there.  Who ever makes the eggs......I swear they were cooked perfect each time I ordered them. (over medium) Drinks and Food are great. Service just okay, unless you sit at the bar with the overnight bartender ;)
I stay here on layovers and always eat at this place. They have good food and great service. I tried the udan noodles off their Chinese menu today. To die for! Definitely recommend it.

I have extensive food allergies and so eating out can be challenging. Ismael was our server and he asked the kitchen to combine 2 different meals to make it safe for me. They complied without issues. And the food was fantastic!

Came in for breakfast one day after doing a bit of table games. Was greeted pleasantly by the hostess Stephanie and noticed they were super busy. Luckily she got me in within no time! 

As I sat and looked at the menu, I noticed the breakfast burrito. Who doesn't like all your breakfast foods tied into a warm and delicious tortilla! It took a while for my server to come so Stephanie came back and put in my order, talk about going the extra mile! My food came out promptly and just as I assumed the breakfast burrito did not disappoint. 

I will definitely be back to enjoy this great service!

The sign is misleading because you think they only serve Chinese food but they have a full menu. We had breakfast one day and a late night snack on another day. The breakfast burrito was perfect and not complicated or excessive. We requested all toppings on the side and everything was served as we requested. The chicken quesadilla was the perfect portion size and the pico and guacamole served with it  were delicious. The staff is pleasant and fast. The establishment is clean and the kitchen, exposed in the back, was run well and looked very clean. The beef noodles with gravy was light, had a nice appearance and tasty. The two eggs with potatoes was done exactly like a home cooked meal. The pricing is very fair and I would definitely go back to this restaurant.

Just finished having dinner and we are stuffed!

If you are a guest at the SLS you can check out the menu on the smart tv in the comfort of your room. 

I ordered the baja taco while my wife had the club sandwich. Both orders came out fairly fast (about 10 min) and both dishes were very tasty. 

Service: 4/5
Food: 5/5
Ambience: 3/5

Wow, the food was amazing! Huge portions and delicious. I had the breakfast burrito and my husband had the huevos rancheros. Definitely didn't expect such a great meal. Super convenient as we stayed at the SLS hotel. Located close to the elevator. And very reasonably priced.

We just had a terrific breakfast.  They gave us a huge booth and a fantastic server - Oliver Mitchell.  Oliver was really competent and friendly.  He shared some excellent tea insights (I love artisanal teas.) and brought us some hearty breakfasts starting with a full pot of coffee.  Standouts included the huevos rancheros and avocado toast.  Steel cut oatmeal with mixed berries was a  generous, tasty meal as well. We will gladly return for our next breakfast.  Big thumbs up to Northside and Oliver. They do hospitality expertly.

I stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner and I asked to be seated at the counter.  The person at reception told me to take any seat.  And so I did--right in the center of the U looking straight into the kitchen.

I ordered the pork carnitas torta.  This is a large sandwich and plan to cut it and eat it in pieces.  If you attempt to pick it up and eat it like a hamburger, you'd better have big hands and a big mouth to match.  It is filled with goodness.  With the carnitas are cotija cheese, jalape√±o crema, charro beans, onion, lettuce, tomato, and avocado.  With the sandwich I got fries.  You have a choice of regular fries, sweet potato fries, or fresh fruit.

The sandwich was on a large hamburger style bun, not the oval shaped torta I had expected but that's a minor critique.  It was tasty and messy eating and good eating.

Service was very good.  As soon as I sat down, a server was there to take a drink order and someone arrived with a menu and asked for a drink order.  Eddie was my main server and he was efficient and friendly.

Northside Caf√©'s a good place to stop for lunch and I'll have to stop by for dinner some evening.

I really should blame myself. What was i thinking eating Chinese food at a place that serves burgers, and pancakes all on the same menu, but with prices that are higher than some Vegas buffets? But my feet were tired, and it takes forever to get out of the casino mazes. These sort of restaurants are the perfect trick for casinos to keep you within their fortress, because they got a lil bit of everything. The menu is really all over the place, and you know it was put together to try and satisfy the diverse clientele they have. Which is probably what you can say about a 7-11 as well. 

I ordered the Yang Chow fried rice. And it was an epiphany. It was the 1st time I ever thought, wow, it IS possible to screw up fried rice. As if the shrimp was left over from a buffet, the rice came in an orange box with the words "Uncle Ben" on it, and the flavor was sprinkled with cardboard. 

The Dr. Pepper was good. The soda machine mixed in some root beer flavor. And that's cool with me because I love mad mixing soda.
Had great experience eating here. Our server, Christian, was spectacular and catered to our every needs. Overall great experience and would come again.
We went for breakfast.  Ordered the breakfast burrito.  Was by far the best I had ever had. Presentation,  mix of flavors and a generous proportion.  Very courteous waiter. Highly recommend.

The three stars are for the food. The food is great. Y'know what's not so great? The service. My partner and I are (new) locals. We live across the street, so we've eaten here twice out of sheer convenience. The first time we came it was late at night and this place has a "seat yourself" setup. The servers here are just not very attentive. Do not eat here if you are ever in a hurry. Tonight we went in, and it's a Saturday night. There were about 10 tables. Took a bit of time for some waters, then a lady took our order. After that, she left for her shift so my partner and I entered the land of, "Who the f*ck does this table belong to?" Eventually, the food runner saw all our food hanging out under the heat lamps and brought it to us. My three course dinner became two courses at the same time, and I was so angry that I left without bothering to eat the third (not that it was ever delivered). My partner's appetizer and entr√©e also came out all at once, despite our previously departed server initially asking if we wanted the app first. No one checked on us after that. We sat there so long we essentially became a part of the d√©cor. I work in the service industry and I used to be a server myself -- I am REALLY bad at being rude but I am also really sensitive to poor service. This experience made me so angry. There were two other servers on duty and two bussers. It took two attempts, but my partner flagged down a busser for a water refill, after that I began a social experiment where I set a timer to see how long we went being straight up ignored by the rest of the staff, who repeatedly checked on the other tables around us. I guess my partner got tired of waiting because he flagged down a different busser for our check, explained we had been ignored for about an hour, and he went to get the manager on duty. Three employees looked super confused when he pulled up our check on their screen. The manager came to our table, his attitude seemed less than apologetic face to face, but he said he would comp us 25% of our check and gave me a ticket for a free dessert. The price ended up at an amount WAY less than what we actually ate, so I don't think they actually had a record of our meal? I'm not an entitled princess, so I left a 20% tip anyway. I don't want to go back, but my partner is into the idea of a free dessert at a later date so I guess we'll see who wins the next argument...
LUCIANO was an amazing server!! Amazing food and customer service.. Highly recommend this place and this server!!

I understand Vegas is a busy place, this is about our specific server. We waited over 10-12 minutes for everything.  Drinks, place order, to go box, check. He was very attentive to every other table but ours. Our food was delivered by someone else and can tell it had been sitting in the back for at least 10 minutes under the lights.  As far as food goes, can't really be honest, it was cold.  I won't be back here and I will not recommend it either.

The absolute best coffee on the strip! I crave their coffee! I've eaten here a few times and never been disappointed. The Huevos Rancheros were amazing. The service is impeccable. I can't wait to get back!

The food is AMAZING! But it's by FAR THE WORST SERVICE ever!  It takes about 8 minutes before the time you sit down to the time you get your water, that's regardless of whether they sit you in the AM with a hostess or you seat yourself at night. Then about 10-15 mins for someone to come and take your order.  They'll get the one star for the good food. But the services definitely takes away 4 stars.... I've tried this place 3 times now trying to give it another chance, but obviously this is systemic. If you're in a hurry or have things to do, DO NOT even think about this place.
Great food and great service. The manager came and greeted us. Great location too. The orange is to die for. Will definitely go again once I come back to Vegas.

I had friends in town that were staying at the W, and I joined them for an early dinner at Northside Cafe on a Thursday night. There was no wait to be seated in a rather comfortable booth.

Northside has a diverse menu; with breakfast offered all day and dinner options ranging from burgers and salads to pasta or steak as well as options from the chinese kitchen. My chicken fried rice was fine, nothing exceptional, but decent flavor and a good sized portion. My friend had the pan fried noodles and really enjoyed them. Pricing for the items we got were fair for the portion size and on strip location. 

Service left a bit to be desired. The one time our waters were refilled my glass was completely overfilled and water spilled all over the table and my lap. The server didn't even notice, I had to take napkins from the empty tables nearby to clean up the mess he made. We were not checked on after receiving our food. 

As a local I have very little reason to go to the W, and I would not return to dine at Northside Cafe based on the subpar service and average food. 

Yelp Reviews 2018 28/100

Food wasn't all that great. We had the Chinese menu. The food was fast and service was ok. The fried rice was pretty plain. The dim sum was nothing special. I guess it's good for late night drunk food. 

Buzz eating should be okay here.

Great breakfast and price point! Whole Hog omelette is very tasty! They offer a few gluten-free items. It's better to get here before 10:00AM or you might be waiting for a table. They also have a bar with 16 seats as a option but the hostess will need to seat you. We will be back

If I was measuring just the food, I would have put 3 stars.  This outing had the worst service I ever experienced.  

Waiter forgot our table's app completely. We told him that we were getting separate checks. Waiter messed up which orders were on the proper ticket 3 times.  After that, he improperly added gratuity to the tickets, charging some of our party 2x, and leaving it off others. 

The manager eventually comes out, and takes another 10-15 min to figure things out. Doesn't even offer to comp a dessert or a coffee. Restaurant wasn't full, so being distracted wasn't an excuse.

My fianc√©e and I ordered a few Dim Sum plates in addition to our entree and were disappointed to find half our order was over cooked and cold. It was evident the kitchen was behind this particular evening but our server Oliver made it easy to give a 5-star review.  There's something to be said for great customer service in the midsts of a Saturday evening rush.  The dumplings are great too

We were staying at the SLS and wanted a late night dinner.  Northside provides the room service for the hotel but we decided to run downstairs and eat at the actual restaurant.  It's open 24/7 and has a extensive menu but not too extensive where you question the quality of the food.  

The decor is very cool and modern and the service was great.   We ordered off of the Chinese menu and enjoyed everything we tried.  We also ordered the banana pie dessert and it was tasty.  Although the SLS hotel is spotty their restaurants do not disappoint.  I would recommend this cafe if you are staying at the hotel or just visiting.

After a 7hr flight from NYC -this place was the perfect choice! 

The Streak and Eggs #onpoint !!! Possibly the best steak ever! 

Great for groups settings and full bar!
Luciano made an awesome margarita and gave great service!!! I'm coming back before I leave town.
24 hour restaurant in the casino.  Many options to choose from.  Large portions and friendly staff.

Come back, Griddle Cafe, come back!

This place used to be a Griddle Cafe, which started in LA, and is one of the best places anywhere for breakfast. They lasted five months before they packed up and returned to LA for unstated reasons.

The only things this place kept from the GC were the French press coffee makers (good call) and the prices (bad call). I don't mind paying $14 for a great breakfast, but not a lousy one.  The coffee was $5.

We got the hash and eggs. It was very small and the corned beef hash was tough and fatty. We mentioned it to our waiter and he just agreed and seemed as if he heard that sort of complaint all day.

The meal was comped, so we didn't complain too much. We assumed everything would taste lousy at that point, so we didn't ask for anything else.

Stayed at W hotel for about a week and the only restaurant opened 24 hours was north side cafe and since I came to Vegas to party and got to the hotel super late of course i had to eat there . Ordered the steak and eggs and that steak was the worst steak of my life. It tasted like it was frozen for years. I could
Not be more disappointed ....... and super overpriced... forget about it ......

The food was good, I never eat all my food this time round I almost ate it all it was that good. It was jot over crowded, we were there on a Sunday round 8am so it was not to bad even when we finished and left it was not bad. All the food on the menu was pretty fairly priced I did not see anything to crazy. 
One thing I was a little upset about was the fact that my husband wanted a small glass on just tomato juice and they could not give it to him BC they did not have it, but they had bloody Mary's weird OK. But all in all everyone was really nice and very professional. Try the food at least once u will want to come back.

My gf and I ate here for breakfast and dinner. All I can say is our dinner server JOSEPH is amazeball! He was courteous, friendly, and attentive! Thank you for amazing food (prime rib with house Cabernet), and an amazing night celebrating my birthday! Woo hoo!

Just want to let everybody know this whole place is amazing, food is great and the cocktails are even better, we went over there after swimming for a little while, this cafe is located right off the pool, which is fantastic ..I definitely recommend it and will go back again...
Ps..thank you Wendy for your great service!!

Checking out the SLS Hotel Resort for the first time, we picked the Northside Cafe because of the simple but expansive menu. The service was impeccable,  the food was tasty and perfectly prepared. A bit noisy but with a cool and casual vibe.  they have a small dinner menu and a three-course dinner offered as well, but we were in at about 1:30pm, and breakfast is offered until 5 pm. the coffee was rich and hot!  Well worth a try.

horrible drinks...need to get rid of the bar staff right now. chilaquiles verdes came out cold their excuse was they out cold Pico de Gallo on top.  and if the staff want to talk shit about their customers at least go in the back where they can't hear you. one of the worst experience ever. being locals I'll be sure to spread the word about how terrible this place is. DO NOT GO HERE. YOU HAVE SO MANY OTHER OPTIONS!!!

Had dinner here tonight.  Really good food and Juan M, our server, went way out of his way for us...  

Try the chicken parm...  and ask for Juan..

It'll be a good night out.

Pricey for what you get. Food was like what you could make at home, but a bit worse off.

Decor was a mix between retro diner style and something more contemporary, but nothing with any 'Chinese Kitchen' motif.

Service was bland and could be better.

The location was great though, as it was conveniently situated for us. I won't be coming back.

is metal now considered a form of protein? because I was lucky enough to chomp down on a piece of it while enjoying my protein frittata. 
the chunk of glistening silver certainly spiced up the otherwise bland meal, but my teeth weren't happy about the surprise. 

They were unable to accommodate my request for greens or veggies in lieu of potatoes and toast. I guess gluttony and Sin City go hand-in-hand. 
My fianc√© said his 2 egg breakfast with bacon and potatoes was fine, but it's hard to mess up eggs...you know, unless you toss some metal bits in there or something.

The manager was quick to replace my meal and offer to comp the meal, but you lose your appetite pretty quickly after biting into r2d2. 

After all you know what they say: Ruin my breakfast once, shame on you. Bite into metal twice, expect to receive my dentist bill.

I was bummed that I didn't end up loving this place after hearing great things about it, but I'm guessing that the other reviewers weren't the lucky recipients of tool box bits.

Eat at your own risk.
Really good food ! A bit pricey , but the portions are good. I recommend the Caramelized banana pancakes.
Hector Busser amazing worker!! On top of everything, very clean restaurant. I am very pleased to dine in tonight. Thank you management!

I don't know what it is about this place but my husband and I love it. (We like SLS alot too) Great food, coffee, Bloody Mary, service...all good. Price is ok for Las Vegas also. Great spot for inside a small (er) casino. We'll be back in 2018!

Only went here to try their Chinese food because it was the only thing open really late. Pretty impressed with the food though! Went with my boyfriend and his parents while in town. We got the pork fried rice, pan fried noodles, and salt and pepper pork. The salt and pepper pork was the definite winner! So good. The other two dishes were also really good. Can't say much about the breakfast or other American food. We also got the seven layered carrot cake another night and it was amazing! 

Overall a good hotel food place

Terrible experience!! We came on a Sunday afternoon around 1pm. It wasn't very busy, but being the only decent priced breakfast place, it was our only option since we were staying at SLS. A girl came and took our drink orders, that was fine. Then this guy server took over. It just went downhill. 3 of us got out orders in decent time but the other 3 didn't get our food for another 15 mins. We ordered 2 pots of coffee with 4 cups. They brought 3 and we had to ask 3 times to bring the 4th. Then, after all the food had arrived and we were eating, I realized my soup did not come. I asked the server when he finally walked by and he acted like he forgot, but it's coming. Another person at our table had soup and she got it early so obviously he forgot. Then, we got an entree delivered that we did not order. Ok...what was this server doing?? My friend ordered a wrap where you can pick a choice of sides: Fries, sweet potato fries, Etc. pretty standard. She choose sweet potato. Our server however thought she wanted a whole separate side of fries and ordered her a side of sweet potato and her wrap came with regular fries. Why would she want that??? Finally, after hunting him down for the bill, there were 3 things wrong!!! Omg! Banana pancakes, we did not order. 2 flatbreads (which we did order, but 1 did not ever arrive!), side of sweet potato fries ($5.95!) and an 20% added gratuity. Ohhh... so THATS why the service sucked!! I spoke with the manager about the many errors and she didn't really care because he brought back the bill and only took the sweet potato fries off and not the other 2 things that we didn't get. I would definitely go somewhere else next time. There were a lot of people working and the place was less than half full. Not sure why they kept dropping the ball but our server was terrible. He never apologized because we barely even saw him. Fail.

Not terrible. Not exceptional. Fills the void for breakfast but if I had more time I'd head elsewhere. Typical hotel pricing. You pay 2/3rds less at a typical hometown diner and probably fill your stomach better. I was surprised when the basic 2-egg platter comes with one slice of toast when being charged over 14 bucks. Food OK-value not so much

I wish I could give this restaurant more stars.  I sat down at the table and was waiting for my friend to arrive.  It was awhile until someone finally placed waters on the table.  The Server never came over to ask if I wanted to order an appetizer before my friend arrives.  He finally showed up when my friend arrived to take our drink order.  I ordered the Protein Frittata with no mushrooms.  It came with mushrooms cooked into it.  I had to pick around them as I didn't want to wait for them to re-make it.  The guac appetizer is quite good.  Service could certainly be improved here.

We enjoyed our meal at Northside and our waiter Joseph was great and very attentive and friendly. The ambience was like a modern diner in a nice hotel and casino. We had no wait to get seated on a Friday night. They offer a mix of classic entrees like burgers and pasta and fish. It also has a full Chinese menu. The soy sauce chow main had a texture that was so fun to eat. The one thing that disappointed us was that the sweet potato fries were not hot when they came out.
Amazing Mexican breakfast! Joseph, was super attentive and awesome! We love the SLS! Definitely recommend this hotel and all it's amazing amenities!

Given it's self-proclaimed reputation as the "foodie" hotel on the (northernmost reaches of the) Strip, the food options at SLS weren't that spectacular.  Aside from several chains, there were few really compelling options.  Thus, my friends and I ended up at Northside Caf√©, which served somewhat affordable (~$10-$20) American fare in a casual environment.  

The restaurant had an extensive breakfast menu that continued to be served through lunch, and had an array of lunch items ranging from tacos and wraps to burgers and sandwiches.  The staff was friendly, but didn't offer substantive answers regarding questions about their food.  Since I have food allergies, I would have liked the staff to actually take the initiative to ask the kitchen about ingredients if they weren't entirely sure about the contents of one of my selections.  Nevertheless, I was generally satisfied with what I ordered:

Barbacoa Tacos:
Overall, I would highly recommend the barbacoa tacos.  After I had ordered, the waitress mentioned that this was one of their most popular items, and it was clear why.  The meat was delicious, tender, and juicy.  If you've had barbacoa at Chipotle, then I would say that this was much more flavorful.  On top of the barbacoa, were decent portions of salsa, guacamole, and cilantro.  The side dish featured charro beans, which had a mixture of cheese, meat, and beans.  I didn't sample this dish since I'm allergic to dairy products, but my friend who sampled it gave it the thumbs up.  The one drawback to this dish was the fact that you only received two tacos for $12-13.  While the tacos were filling, I would have felt more comfortable paying that price if I had received at least one more taco.

If you're staying at SLS and want something somewhat more affordable than some of the higher end fare, Northside Cafe definitely fits the bill.  But, keep in mind that the food is pretty typical of what you could find elsewhere.

in the SLS hotel...

i needed food..stat...
they were open early....many other places in the hotel didn't open until 11 am.

i ordered off the lunch menu (cobb salad)...
service was friendly..
my water stayed full
i had to ask for coffee refills (the coffee was just ok)

my salad was quite good and HUGE ...ate some then and saved some for the LONG drive home from Vegas..

it's right across from the pool so you can get your food to go and head to the pool to eat
The service is slow. We waited for more than half hour for one noodle and congee. The food was even not hot...

We arrived for dinner and it had a variety of food options. Mexican, Chinese, Italian, and american from recollection. So a little bit of everything for anyone. 
The bad, it is outrageously priced.
Portion sizes are large however. I had a Rigatoni I could not finish and was delicious. 
My wife ordered a fish that she ate and said nothing about. 
My son, and this is where the rating went down, ordered Nachos. That is simple enough. But, he did not want Jalapenos on it and specified it. He was disappointed when it came out clearly with Jalapenos on it. He decided to try his hand at telling the waiter. He very politely said he was disappointed it had Jalapenos on it. The waiter brushed it off by saying it was due to the pico de gallo. UH NO! We looked first and tried that. It was all over the large plate, inside and out. You messed up, just apologize no excuses. They did correct it by sending a new plate quickly with no pico di gallo. Now it was just the ample beef, sour cream and nachos. 
What you could have done, apologized and offered to take it off the bill or complimentary dessert. NOPE. Just the excuse was offered. We can tell the difference between something mixed into a condiment and fresh Jalapeno thrown onto the plate and in the nachos. 

So, high price and doing poorly on something very easy to put together results in a lower rank. 
It could have been a 3 or 4.
Consistently good diner food. Good service (s/o Joseph)...nothing wrong i just csnt give a diner 5*. A staple when i stay at sls for business

The food although tasty took over 45min to arrive. Other guests seated around me got their orders first as I watched mine sitting in the window. The all around service here and the SLS in general is severly lacking the sophistication that they promote.

I was a little concerned with the service we would receive based on other reviews but I am happy to report our waitress, Doria, was great. I was craving surf and turf and after seeing the photos of that dish in Yelp.....I knew I needed to try it. I am so happy I did. Everything was on point. The sauce for the shrimp was spicy, creamy and heavenly. The steak was tender and delicious. The french fries were just right! We were staying at the SLS hotel so we charged it to the room and earned SPG points. It's a win/win!

The coffee shop at the SLS. The food is standard coffee shop fare, despite the hip ambiance: eggs, pancakes, burgers, salads, sandwiches. 

I've visited several times and found the service to be extra pokey and often forgetful...but if you wait long enough, it'll all come together. Expect to pay about $13 for an entree.

The food was phenomenal, the service was the opposite.
We went on a Friday afternoon before the crowds, and our server made the experience twice as long as it should have been. There were tables beside us that came and went in the time we were there. The group sizes were the same, the only difference was the server.
The drinks are over-priced for the size, but the food was delicious and came in generous portions.
It's not a bad choice if you're willing to risk the service being poor.
Came here for breakfast! Food was awesome and pineapple margarita was super good too! I recommend coming here for breakfast! :)

I'd recommend elsewhere for breakfast.  The meal was fine.  Blueberry gluten free pancakes were tasty, but for gluten free they were just so so.  The bacon and eggs were good, not spectacular but good.  Service was very good.  Ishmael our server was fantastic.  Just definitely not worth the price.  $16 for 2 pieces of bacon and 2 eggs on a mid-small plate that is just above average diner fare... $13 for 3 pancakes no sides?  They both better be worth it for that price, and instead all they did was make me miss 100 small town diners that do it twice as good at half the price.  That's why it's 2 stars.

ok, I wanted to dine in Ku Noodle but they were not open for lunch...also my partner likes plain food...well go to Northside Cafe and that's what you get including not so enthusiastic waiters.Maybe he had a bad day but don't let your customers know it.

Still 5 stars in my opinion, even a year and a half later! My server Joseph was great, the food was still awesome and huge portions, and the local specials and drink can't be beat. They still have the secret locals special, which is a huge relief, because paying full price Strip prices hurts my soul. I'd also like to compliment the bartender, who used gloves while he was making my mojito (getting the mint leaves out of the bag). No one ever does that, unless they know someone is watching them! This is a place that has shown consistency and that's great in a city that has so much change!

My friend and I stayed at the SLS hotel for a few days and Northside was our go to spot for late night and early morning grub. The Nutella French toast is a must try for breakfast if you like sweet like I do! The Philly cheesesteak was mmmm mmmm good for dinner! If you are feeling the Asian menu I highly recommend the orange chicken. All and all the prices were great and everything we tried tasted good. The only thing that caused me to knock off a star was the service. We visited at least 5 times and the service was inconsistent and not great. The servers were not rude, but we just found them to be very busy on a couple of occasions and MIA on other occasions.

Can you say delicious! OK so we're are staying at the SLS Hotel and the travel company we used offers a free continental breakfast but we passed that up to come here...and it was so worth it! I ordered the bacon omelette add onions, it came with your choice of toast and breakfast potatoes. My friend ordered the protien scramble, it came with toast too. We shared the Hazelnut French toast and GAWD it was FANTASTIC!! It was the perfect amount of chocolate w/o being too sweet.. So good I would definitely order the same meal again. I'm a true foodie so trust you won't be disappointed

Just checked in to the SLS this afternoon and decided to try this place.
My wife & I weren't that hungry so we just ordered the Yang's fried rice & XO udon noodles.
They were both very good, very satisfying. The service was fast, polite & efficient.
We'll be back to try more items on their very diverse menu.

Jim was a great server. his recommendations were spot on. the french toast was really good but it's pretty sweet so make sure you have a sweet tooth. the burrito was also amazing. it was pretty filling so make sure you're hungry, have the potatoes in the side. coffee was $4, not really worth it but refillable.

Walked in with my family, waited for a server for 10 minutes, asked for help, another server rudely dismissed us, so we walked out and went to Umami Burger. The service here sucks and I've heard the food is just okay. Time to shut this place down and bring in a management company and employees that know what they're doing. There were 3 hostesses at the front. What a waste.
Nice place to take a break when you're in Las Vegas. Not pretentious at all and has a friendly staff. Good food options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

So we went to SLS for the first time (which was, in and of itself, a pretty cool place) and we went to Northside Cafe for breakfast and it was super good! The food came out super fast, the waitress was awesome (she started by putting on my boyfriend's sunglasses and cracking a joke) and the Bloody Marys are adorned with a whole stalk of celery and a huge slice of thick cut bacon... Which is never a bad thing. :)

I played it safe and got the two egg breakfast with perfectly cooked over easy eggs, pork sausage, and breakfast potatoes. However my friend got the chilequiles and it was huge spicy and awesome! 

The best part is it was all pretty affordable and due simply to the fast and friendly service, ill definitely go back!
This place was amazing. The chocolate hazelnut French toast was best I have ever had...hubby had Chinese chicken basil which was also great!! Server, Oliver was attentive and a superstar!!!!!

my coworkers and I had been looking for a place to eat and one of them suggested this place.  very cool vibe here and the staff was wonderful.  

During the opening of our visit we had a prompt business call we all had to be on...this would last through out the entire meal. Joseph who had served us was more than awesome and kept us going with refills wonderful food.  we will be back!   thanks Joseph!
Ordered the Walnut shrimp was delicious bit lacked the honey mayo sauce.  Service for take out was friendly & fast.

Stopped in here for a late lunch...and got blown away! Luciana was a fantastic Server and the Kung Pao Chicken and Sweet & Sour Soup where 5 times better than another popular chain that rhymes with "Bangs". My food was so delicious, you can see how much got left behind on my plate. And their cocktails were really yummy too!

Came for breakfast, the most important meal of the especially if you got a day of shopping a head of you. I ordered the breakfast tacos and my waiter Joseph T let me know it was a great choice. He wasn't lying. These tacos were a great take on the classic breakfast burrito but better. The side of beans that came with were Amazing. My cup of black tea was perfect and twice Joseph T poured my tea for me from the pot left on my table.  Kevin really enjoyed is lox scrabble. The salmon covered the eggs beautifully. They didn't skimp you on the salmon at all. It came with a bagel which made it the perfect combination.

I am a vegas local and I have been here many times from the grand opening when it was under a different name and menu to right now as I am writing this.  I think this place is great and figured I should let people know about it.  

Everything I have had here has been great, my favorites are the nachos, quesadilla and ribeye steak.  

Oh and how could I forget the house margarita!  It's awesome!  You would be hard pressed to find one as good for the price here in Vegas. (~7$)

Service is great, everything you want in service; fast friendly but not overbearing and I don't recall a time I was here when I didn't have one of the managers come up at some point and ask us how it was / help clear the table.  

You can tell they are trying to do well.

Had the wrong temperature on my steak and was told by the servers that the very little glimmer of pink on the meat makes it medium. I told them that's clearly a medium well to well done. Very disappointed with their response so I just told them to forget it and we'll just eat it. The steak & eggs was adequate, definitely not worth $23 + tax&tip. Long wait for the morning "rush" and was kinda forgotten by the server that sat us and took our drink orders.

Really like this place and want to it all 5 stars but can't because of bad service we got a few times going there...but I have to say it's not all and maybe that's cuz they are open 24hrs. The first time I tried the eggs Benedict I loved it and not soo much the next few times I did...philly cheese steak is really good and the Nutella French toast is amazing! Overall really love coming here it's not loud super comfy and open all the time!

Visited Las Vegas at the end of March and we went to the place on our trip. Service was great and food tasted good but every time I ate anything from there I got very sick. This taking into account I did not eat anywhere else. I don't know if it's the way they handle there food or something I would recommend it if you have a strong stomach if you have weak stomach or any food allergies you may not any to venture here.

We enjoyed our meal at Northside and our waiter Joseph was great and very attentive and friendly. The ambience was like a modern diner in a nice hotel and casino. We had no wait to get seated on a Friday night. They offer a mix of classic entrees like burgers and pasta and fish. It also has a full Chinese menu. The soy sauce chow main had a texture that was so fun to eat. The one thing that disappointed us was that the sweet potato fries were not hot when they came out.

Came here on a Sunday morning and started waiting in line, until we figured out we could skip the line to sit at the counter. They have a really good menu with a lot of options. We ordered the Chilaquiles Verdes and the Whole Hog Omelette. Both delicious choices. We also ordered coffee and were brought out little individual French presses. What a pleasant surprise! It was a cup full of creamy goodness. 

What made our experience here even better was the friendly server at the counter. Very personable and genuinely nice. 

If you are staying at the SLS, you don't want to miss breakfast here.
Came here for late night eats, food was great but service was a little slow but it was busy. Restaurant was very clean and server was awesome.
Steamed buns were hard as rocks, tried to post a video but didn't work! Order wisely!

This is a 24/7 diner-style joint inside of SLS, so if you are hungry at any odd hours, chances are you will end up here. The plus side is they have gigantic portions -- great for when you're hung over, but if you don't want to waste any food, you should probably share an entr√©e with a friend.

On the other hand, the food is quite greasy and generic. The Mexican-inspired entr√©es lack zing, while the American brunch items feel like something I could get at any average Joe's diner. The prices do reflect the portion size, but they are still a bit high comparing to what you can get outside of the hotel. Guess you are always paying a little extra for the location ;)

Service is a downside. I know it's really busy here during brunch hours, but we hardly ever saw our servers and the turnover rate might have been slow as a result (slow to get our bill etc). I can't blame a specific server because it happened multiple times on multiple days.

We came here on a Sunday and there was a little bit of a line but it moved fast. We just so happened to dine here on National Margarita Day so we took advantage of free margaritas with our meal (they were delicious). Our server was pretty awesome- very attentive and outgoing. The food was quite good and we were all satisfied. Although we did not have the bloody marys, I am dying to try it next time because everyone's looked so good! This is one of the few times where I had almost all of the meals of my trip at the hotel I was staying at. Good selection SLS!

I had no choice but to eat here last weekend.  This was the only place open for breakfast at the SLS on Saturday morning.  I went at 11am and there was a line of people waiting to get seated.  Since I was by myself, the bar seating was available and I walked right in.  
Ambience:  Very chill cafe style restaurant.  Not terribly big.  But I loved the fact that they had seating at the bar.  
Service:  Really good.  I was served by one of the bartenders right away.  Drink ordered was placed and food ordered taken soon after.  It was easy for to get refills on my drink.  Check came out right away.  No complaints with the service.
Food:  First off, their coffee is a frenched pressed brew.  It was impressive and delicious.  There menu had a little of everything (including mexican and traditional breakfast).  I had their meat lover omelette (or something like that) and bagel and cream cheese.  Omelette and potatoes were pretty good.  All of the condiments are on the table including multiple hot sauces.  Bagel was nicely toasted and the cream cheese nicely whipped.  
Value:  My meal came out to $20.  The guy forgot to charge me for coffee so that was a nice break.

It would have sucked if I had a larger party and needed to wait in line.  OTherwise decent place for breakfast.

I had such a great experience with the staff and the food that I ate here twice in one day!  My colleague and I ordered our meal to go but Peter, who helped us, was so sweet and kind that we ended up hanging out a little longer than expected.  He truly went above and beyond and was extremely kind - even giving me a to go cup for my iced tea.  

Thanks Peter!

Also...please try the tomato soup - it is DIVINE! Seriously...this is jazzed up and absolutely delicious.

Been here 3 times on this trip...not many choices for food at this hotel. The pros: good pancakes, friendly staff, sandwich had lots of meat with good quality ingredients.the cons: very slow, expensive, few choices, no substitutions allowed for anything even when you have food allergies. But it is the only breakfast choice in hotel except the coffee shop that has basically coffee and pastries.

Filthy, not a single booth clean- guests to my left had to ask for utensils to eat with a hitch means to me they have sat there with hot food for a while. This place is very dark inside- I get that it is 24/7 but... really it is cave like.

Two stars only because the food was good. They charge a 20% gratuity on all checks. Maybe it was just our server ( gerardo ) was terrible. We were the only people there and it took almost an hour to get our food. Then all of the servers stood by the computer and ignored us the entire time. Food good, service bad.

Just finished my first meal here and it was less than impressing for a restaurant apart of the SLS chain. However, the service was great. We ordered the nachos and the Philly cheesesteak -- the nachos were delicious! Full of barbacoa, guacamole, and all the fixings. The Philly cheesesteak was another story: dry, untoasted dinner roll with dry steak and few mushrooms. It's definitely not worth it as it doesn't live up to expectations. Not to mention, the restaurant is right across from the pool entrance and my boyfriend had a perfect view of someone stumbling out and vomiting in the casino but hey, this is Vegas. Regardless, it was an okay experience just steer clear of the cheesesteak.

First time at Northside and everything was EXCELLENT! The food was great and Joseph our server was awesome! He was polite, very attentive and a little funny...lol.....We will definitely be back before this vacation is over and hopefully Joseph will be our server every time:-)

surprisingly authentic kang pao chicken!
but SLS wifi is very poor inside the restaurant.

Had the surf n turf. Big, plump, juicy shrimp in yummy sauce. Perfectly cooked filet, perfectly seasoned and good garlic mash. Mom had pastrami sandwich with fruit. Fantastic bread. Delicious pastrami. Grilled perfectly.

Dinner was great, Christian Santos our server at the restaurant was fantastic. He accommodated us with each request we asked and helped us throughout the night with out issues but food was great as well and would definitely come back again.

I have mixed reviews about Northside Cafe. Actually, I don't really know what it is. There's nothing negative about the place, but I felt a little uneasy dining at this establishment. Regardless, I found myself returning every afternoon to feast at the SLS Diner. I remember ordering the protein scramble and I loved it because it was made with egg whites. Any restaurant that offers an egg white option deserves mad respect in my books. I guess the only small complaint I have is that it's tad on the pricier side, which I really don't mind all that much. My African-Filipino-American roommate ordered the sweet potato fries and he literally fell in love with it. He's the type of person to never consume unhealthy dining options; however, every time a side order of sweet potato fries ends up on the dining table. Even though I'm not a fan of sweets, I decided to try it myself. Let me tell you this, I guarantee it won't be a disappointment.

Having been granted late checkout, I had breakfast here. My only order was the congee (available after 11am). Both the congee and service were excellent. The $8 congee comes with a small youtiao (Chinese crispy donut)


EDIT: Came for dinner too which was not as nice of an experience. Service still top notch. Tomato soup was pretty good not great. Rigatoni was bad. Tasted prego-like and was also extremely salty. Even though the portion was good, I had to stop halfway because the salt was so overpowering. The only compliment is that there is plenty of meat in the sauce. The cheesecake was also below par, chalky, and honestly Jack in the box cheesecake is almost as good. At least it was nicely presented. I hesitate to drop my review from an initial 5 stars to 3, but God Damn that rigatoni.

My burger was bland and the fries were stale.  My lady asked for hot sauce for her greasy food and was never given any... Was not impressed... I've had better food and service at fast food restaurants.
I was there last week and I enjoyed the great food and the service. Joseph, was our waiter and he made sure we were taken good care of. Thank you.

New restaurant that took over for The Griddle Cafe. Had a great breakfast and the French Press coffee is dreamy.... I am still thinking about it. The plates are large and for Code members...we had a two free entree coupon! Amazing! Love this SLS.

Nice cafe located in SLS
Breakfast is nicely done with crispy bacon - just as requested 
Dim sum was tasty with nice sized portions which weren't overwhelming after a long day of travel
Staff was consistently pleasant and attentive 
Pleasant surprise tucked away in a comfortable venue!

Quite surprise the food was actually pretty good and on point with the Asian flavors. I am of Asian descent and ordered three items: Walnut Shrimp, Pork and Shrimp Shiu Mai, and Hot and Sour soup. Considering its a restaurant inside a hotel, I was assuming two things, overprice and mediocre food. That wasn't the case. Price was fair and food was great. Only downside is maybe the service. The hostess at the front constantly disappears and leaves the front unattended. I waited a little bit before being told to order at the bar since I wanted takeout. The bartender took my order and I did waited a little bit for the food. During my wait, I saw a few other customers had to seat themselves since the hostess wasn't available. Other times, the hostess is just chatting. The servers were great from the short time there.

Denny's is comparable, I'm not sure why it has anything above three stars. The food is mostly basic and at times is bland. The chicken tenders were hard and mostly unappealing; same goes for dumplings. The fried rice was lacking something, it was okay but missing a good taste. The service fell short for a good hotel like SLS, can't say if I'll come back but I'd avoid it.

While staying at the SLS, we ate at the Northside Cafe everyday! Some of the items are a bit pricey for breakfast, but the serving sizes are huge! Our servers were always friendly, and to make it even better this place is open 24 hours! We first checked in our hotel at 1 am and thank god this place was open! Nothing like late night munchies
Sad to see The Griddle go, but this place is equally as good. Service was wonderful, Juan M helped us and was personable and had great recommendations. Definitely will be back soon!

This place should get a minus5. Ordered a simple 2 egg breakfast plate and sausage wasn't done, potatoes cold and eggs weren't how I ordered them, got my toast after I was done eating what I was gonna eat. Server didn't have enough to do so stood over us and talked the entire time. Waste of my money. Nvr again

I ate here twice - once for dinner (take-out) and once for breakfast. The food deserves 3 stars  - and the service for a late night dinner take-out also deserves 3 stars. But the breakfast that my girlfriend and I had here while we were staying at the hotel had dismal serve - totally dismal.

I had to scrounge around for my own jelly for my toast while my server was up front chatting and laughing with another server. And I found the manager to help us to get more coffee. We got it - but the service did not improve. So - 2 stars is what it gets.
The food was great the only downside was that the bathroom felt like it was halfway through the hotel but everything else was perfect

I came here on a late night food-hunt with my family. We were going to go to Umami Burger but they were closed, so we saw this eatery as a convenient option since we were hungry, and they were open until late.

I like that they had their menu outside. There were a lot of options, and the cafe looked clean and well-kept. Our server was nice and informative. 

We ordered the Kung Pao Chicken which was starred as one of their favorites. It was tasty and not too spicy. Perfect, since my nephews were with us. We also ordered the fried rice and had requested the chicken on the side. This was comparable to other Chinese-style fried rice dishes I've had before. We also ordered the Orange Chicken, also good but not too much of a orange flavor sauce. The Honey Walnut Shrimp was very tasty and the shrimp was big. It was on the pricey side of $16.95, but worth it. Actually, all of their prices were a little on the higher-end, in my opinion.  The Eggplant Tofu was just okay. We agreed that it lacked flavor, almost like it needed more of a garlic or ginger taste, or both, even maybe a little more salt, which is unusual since Chinese food is usually really salty. The Pan Fried Noodles was good; and we were happy to find out it was much like our Cake Noodles in Hawaii, our home. It was crunchy but soft too with the gravy. It had Gai Lan and mushrooms on it. I would come here again if I was craving Chinese food in Las Vegas.

Perfect spot for a late night meal if you are on the strip of Las Vegas and do not want to go to Denny's or Ihop.

The environment was simple but good for two or a large party.  Our server was very friendly especially seeing that it was 11:30 pm. 

They offer a variety of breakfast, cafe burgers and fries and a lot of Chinese food.

We ordered orange chicken, Kung pao chicken, fried rice, cake noodles, eggplant tofu, and walnut shrimp.

The star of the night was the cake noodles! So much flavor and a perfect combo of sauce and crunchy pan fried noodles.  The egg plant tofu lacked garlic and ginger but the tofu was cooked perfectly. 

The prices are a little high for what you get. Ur you will be content and the food is delicious.  However, a lot of places on the strip are a lot higher.

I'm about to go in y'all. 

So I took my family members who were visiting from out of town to what I thought would be The Griddle House. To my surprise GH was no longer there. They have replaced it with Northside Cafe and an all new menu. We were hungry, I hoped SLS wouldn't disappoint, and so we decided to give it a try. 

Service was extremely slow: The place is absolutely empty but we receive service like it's jam packed with clients. 

Extremely subpar service from waiter: 
-I ask the waiter what he prefers from the menu. He shares, "I don't know just pick." 
-Later, we ask for straws and he tells us that they "ran out of straws". My first thought is, 'Where they do dat at?' Anyway, we go out of our way to find a busboy who gives us straws on the spot. When the waiter comes back and sees that we have straws, he looks stifled and upset. From that point on he only returned to the table to give us the bill. 

Here's my assessment:
The Griddle House brought high hopes for dining at SLS. Unfortunately, NSC is not holding its own properly. Northside Cafe will need to step up its game either through new management, servers and menu to stay in the market.

Four of us stopped in for breakfast and none of us left hungry!! I had the bacon egg omelette made with egg whites. Who doesn't love thick cut bacon? My boyfriend had the fluffiest, moist buttermilk pancakes with the most generous dollop of butter. The waitress kept our coffee cups filled throughout our meal and seemed well rehearsed on the menu. Good service and yummy food! Definitely a spot to check out.

"Locals Beware" this place doesn't consider you as "local" even if you slap them with a Nevada ID. I was told by the Northside cafe manager that the las vegas local that they meant was the surrounding apartments and pretty much within SLS vicinity. 
 
 I'm not big on writing reviews but this place was just too much!  I had breakfast there this morning and the hostess specifically gave us the "local secret menu" instead of the regular menu. We were seated at the bar and the service was ok and the food was ok too for the price that was on that local menu. When I asked for the bill I noticed that I was charged with the full price from the regular menu. When I asked the server why I was charged full price all he said was "oh you're supposed to have a little sticker on your code card and there's nothing I can do about it" and this guy is holding my nevada ID with las vegas address on it! How local do you have to be???  This place is ridiculous I am never going back there! So locals beware don't even bother  asking for the specials they have for locals.

They had me at French press. Seriously - why don't more restaurant serve French press coffee? So strong and smooth and delicious!

The decor is a bit greyscale for me, but it works - imagine a desaturated fifties dinner with an industrial modern twist. The waiter was great - quick, friendly, and accurate and the place was clean.

We're both on a health kick, so we needed to modify our orders a tad.  I had the protein frittata with added mushroom and no toast and he ordered the steak and eggs with added spinach and no potato and no bread.

The order came out perfect - eggs over medium, steak medium rare. Everything was perfect. The food itself was good 

Overall very good experience. A tad pricey, but it's convenient.

the reason why i am giving this place only 2 stars is because of the first impression i got.... My friend and I stood behind 2 couples that were waiting to be seate, no problem when it was our turn to be sat she told me to get behind the other people in line that came in after me (another 2 top) then there was another 2 top behind them and she came back and sat them also..... by now i was feeling hurt and when i mentioned that she sat 2 other parties infront of me she said "I know, we were cleaning a booth off for you." upon entering the dining area i noticed the parties that she skipped me for were in booths. she plain out lied. how are you supposed to maintain a regular customer flow if your hostess ( which is your first impression for the restaurant) acts like that.... who knows how many people may have been turned off and left or will never come back

As a Vegas local I decided to come check this place out because of their local specials. This place is located inside the super cool SLS hotel. I had not been to the SLS since the month that it opened.. And it looks like this place is taking steps in the right direction. I had the Northside burger which the server suggested.. And MY was it amazing! What's the sauce that they put on this thing? Love it! I definitely recommend coming to this spot! Great locals spot as well as for people on vacation.

During our stay at SLS, ate here for few times. Food was average and service was all at below average every time. Takes a while for service to happen, does not matter busy or not. Everyone works here does not care. One instance we sat down and no one came for more than 5 min. I tried to flag some one but no one sees me. It seems we were invisible, don't dine here if you have a choice.

This place is terrible.  It is new, so hopefully it will change things up.  SLS doesn't have many food choices during the day, and we were staying there for a week.  So we ended up eating breakfast there our first morning, and then once more for a small dinner.  It is overpriced, and the food is terrible.  My husband ordered steel-cut oatmeal, and I ordered pancakes.  His oatmeal was something like $12, which seems like a joke.  And my pancakes were dense and flavorless.  
Another time, we just got soup and salad.  We had the cobb salad, which was lacking in flavor and ingredients.  And I got the roasted tomato soup, which I am certain came from a can or container.  I also had the "warm cookie" and ice cream dessert, which came on a scone instead.  The ice cream, even, was terrible.  Most disappointing experience of our Vegas stay.  Every other restaurant we tried had a standard far above Northside's; this place needs to straighten up.

I completely agree with some of the reviews below me about the bad service. Sure, the staff are friendly enough, but the wait time is just ridiculous. Maybe I came at a bad time at 1230 in the morning and everyone was just tired, but that really isn't an excuse for over an hour of waiting for 6 plates of food.

This place would've gotten 4/5 stars if it wasn't for the wait time. At least when the food finally came out, it wasn't all that bad. 

If you're really hungry and looking for a late night snack, this isn't the place to go. You'll be extremely starving and grumpy by the time the food comes out.
The 3 course special is only for 'dinner'... but no actual time is stated on the flyer... and they don't serve/ make the items united it's dinner time...

Found this place wandering around SLS and ordered the French Press coffee with my girlfriend. She ordered the spinach and bacon omlete while I order hurveo rancheros breakfast which the waiter advised me on since I told him I was medium hungry.  The portion was perfect for what I wanted just as he said so good recommendation. Very polite as well.  Also I found out this place is open 24/7 which is awesome.  I'd recommend this place.

Same sub par food that you get on the room service menu. Over priced and small portions. The service is incredibly slow when we went on a Saturday morning. I would suggest you just stay in your room and order room service. Or better yet, skip the Sysco food entirely and find a place you like more!

I had the loaded omelet and it was very tasty. Make sure you ask for extra extra sour cream on your omelet, it just make it that much better. The redskins potatoes on the side were also really good. Great spot in the SLS. I will be back when I'm in Vegas again

Though the food is pretty good this place is by far the worst run restaurant  in Las Vegas. The hostess is as clueless as a baby gazelle who lost her mother and is aimlessly wandering through the tall grass. The wait staff, more apathetic then a 30-year old unemployed stoner casually spending his days on his parents basement couch playing Mario cart on his antiquated N64. 

Clearly this place is staffed by a millennial generation of would be dancers or musicians who would clearly rather dream of making it big then focus on the job at hand of bringing me my food. 

In short - or not - this place needs to step it up.

This place is amazing, especially for locals.  I got delicious buttermilk pancakes for only $5.99 (locals menu).  For locals, this place has Denny's-level prices but the food is top-notch Vegas class all the way.  It feels very much like a local diner, and I will be going here for breakfast all the time now.  Breakfast is 24-7, so it doesn't matter what time I go.

Luciano was an excellent bartender, he checked on me to make sure everything was good and if I needed extra coffee.  He also chatted with me for a bit about how to look for good deals throughout Las Vegas and what kind of deals and great events can be found out the SLS.  If you eat there when he's there make sure to ask him the same.
The best cafe ever! Caters to customers' wants and needs. I ordered something off the menu and they made it for me. Best service by Arnulfo and Kassey!

Wow! Got a flyer in the mail for this new cafe at SLS good for tonight only. Grabbed some friends to check it out tonight and what? They aren't even open lol. They are replacing the griddle. Good luck with that

The food was pretty good. My wife and I flew all day and wanted some food. We walked to the SLS and found Northside Cafe and decided to give it a try. There was a booth that was not cleaned and we stopped someone and asked if we could sit there. His response "If that guy there cleans it." Not a great first impression. We sat at a table and 5 minutes later the booth was cleaned and we moved over to it. We both ordered the Three Course Dinner (salad, fettuccine with chicken, and a sundae). We waited about 25 minutes and the waiter brought the salad and the entree without chicken. Wish they would have come separate and correctly. We asked for chicken and soon got it. We then asked for our deserts and the real wait happened, 20 minutes later we got our delicious ice cream. Look the food is amazing... the service leaves a lot to be desired.

Joe is now the night shift manager and service has already noticeably improved.  When the hotel was changing over to Starwood I felt that things had definitely slipped. Feeling great about this place again!

I came in to breakfast this morning at north side cafe I had the chilaqiles verdes first off those are a 5 star in them self a definitive must  try not only is the food great but the service was even better my server Juan M took great care of me and my wife and said the chilaqiles are a must try and I must say he was definitely right he went more than above and beyond made my experience a great one to remember I definitely recommend north side cafe to anyone and everyone in town. Make sure you ask to be seated in Juan's section I'm sure he'll take care of you like he did with me and my wife.

Ask for Joe, from Jersey. 
Super friendly, really funny, great service. 

Surprisingly good food and a great deal on cocktails. 

Also, having the option to get a breakfast burrito and spring rolls has never been presented to me before. Odd but awesome combination. 

Great for a hungover brunch before the drive back to LA.

We hadn't been here in awhile and decided we would go again, because every time we go the food is great. My husband got Shrimp Fried Rice which he loves , and I got Caesar's Salad which was soooo good . Looking forward to going back again as soon as we can!!!

The food is good but service is TERRIBLE. Waiters have a bad attitude and make you feel like you're inconveniencing them by asking for simple things like water or utensils.  I came here 3x while staying at hotel and would rather walk anywhere vs giving them anymore of my money.

The ability to chow down 24/7 while staying at a casino is always a win in my book. 

As I was here for a biz trip this became my go-to spot for a late night meal and early morning breakfast. 

I liked the option of being able to take a seat at the counter area and eat in solitude while gathering my thoughts, or going over my notes for the day's business dealings.

Really nice staff - very attentive and friendly enough. Decent eats too. Egg white omelet was served up quick and tasty just as I ordered it for a late night dinner. Breakfast served all day and night is so choice. One morning I had the Continental Breakfast with vanilla yogurt parfait, fresh fruit, croissant and some coffee that hit the spot. Another night I had a salmon plate with roasted asparagus, roasted tomatoes & lemon-caper sauce. Was more than satisfied with everything. Plus, you can charge your orders to your room for convenience.  

The portions were hearty and considering it's a Vegas hotel the prices were not too expensive. 

Also, it's right off the casino floor for a quick exit to the slots and tables for some gambling fun.
Ruben was awesome!!! Took a while for the check but it's because it was busy! Very yummy

This place is okay. We went for dinner last night and we have eaten breakfast here before as well. The service is decent not the worst not the best. We tried their new Chinese menu. We were so excited to see they had dim sum. We tried almost all of them and were mostly disappointed. The Shrimp Har Gow and the sticky rice lotus wraps were good, the only ones we liked. We also had the pan fried dumplings and the shrimp pork sui mai and they were not good not a lot of flavor and the pork they used was not good it kind of grossed me out by the thick pieces and texture. The soy sauce chow mein was good, a large plate and when you add a bit more soy sauce it was even better. Overall I wouldn't come out of my way here.

This place is just meh. We stayed at the SLS for a weekend and they gave us a $50 credit to blow on food. The benefits of this spot is that they are literally open 24 hours a day, with the changing of menus as well so it's not constantly the same thing.

The servers are super sweet and accommodating. The food is basic American food, but they do have a random Chinese menu which I heard was really good, but had not tried it. Prices are what you'd expect for Vegas diners. Expect to pay around $11-15 per person. The meals are larger than what I expected however so at least your money goes far!

Sub par food, excellent service.
Wendy was great she took care of me and my gf she an excellent server highly recommend this place

Whatever you do...DO NOT EAT HERE!  Quite honestly, the food is just really bad. We ordered an Asian dish and chocolate peanut butter cheesecake. The food was greasy and tasted as pre-packaged as they come. The only reason we ordered cheesecake is because it looked great in pictures, but it tasted like rubber. It's was expensive and I am so sad I wasted any calories on it.

I am sorry I came here. I had the three course meal for $19.95 and was really disappointed. The caesar salad was my starter and it was okay. Really generic but edible. For my main, I had the fetticini and it was the most bland crap I have ever tasted. I had a bite of my friend's prime rib and it was gross - tough and foul tasting. I did not have the desset because by this point I was feeling quesy. When I asked how much a glass of wine cost since it is not listed on the menu, I was informed that it is $11. What? That is cray. Drinks are free literally when you cross the threshold back into the casino. Seriously, unless everything else on the menu is way better, I would not spend my cash here.

Inreresting cafe with all cusines and very goof customer service. But the food overall was average. 

Got the nachos which was a good size portion and the meat was tender. 
Got Farmers salad with chicken - if you want something healthy, that's definitely the choice to go! Minimal salad dressing and the chicken breast was just grilled with barely any seasoning. 
- custard steam bun: who steams without wax paper underneath to avoid having the bread stick to their dish? They do. Other than that, they got the custard part right but too much breading
- chicken fried rice: not bad at all
Food was excellent.  Had ham and cheese omelet with side of bacon.  Service was average but food made up for it.

It's 9:24pm on a Saturday night, the restaurant is dead. The recommended Bloody Mary is tomato juice and a celery stick is completely devoid of flavor (evidently the bacon was the only highlight to this cocktail, sorry vegetarians!). The staff is aloof and the bartender spent minutes chatting with my server, rearranging the condiments on the wall, and finally decided to make my drink. My mahi fish taco was overdone. I think next time I'll go for fast food to match the caliber of the north side cafe. The waiter did remove my drink, eventually.

Mediocre at best. The Griddle was a thousand times better! 

Belgian waffle was a regular waffle.
Chicken sausage was cold. 
Eggs weren't cooked as ordered either. Wheat toast sucked. 
Also had the protein frittata, probably made with carton egg whites because the whole plate was watery. 

Wouldn't recommend.

Service was alright. Conveniently open 24 hours. Food is greasy and unhealthy. The waiter admitted that the healthiest thing on the menu is a grilled cheese sandwich. So yourself a favor and go elsewhere.
Great!!! And delicious good quality food...employees are very helpful..have to visit this place at least 3 to 4 times being in vegas

This was my first time trying this cafe and I was really looking forward to some delicious food after a crazy night in Vegas and was left super disappointed. When watching your weight because summer is going to peek it's ugly head very soon we had a early dinner but after all that fun etc. my girls and I decided no late night binging so we slept hungry and woke up hungrier. 
So we went downstairs because they were raving about this place considering they are always staying at the SLS and eating here, I really trusted their opinion, but even they were so disappointed in the quality of the food! I ordered the buffalo wrap, there was barely any chicken in there the dressing was not even properly dressed just bland bland bland! I tried the Benedict it was bleh nothing really nice to comment about it, the potatoes had zero flavor and were honestly just greasy. BUT the only nice thing I have to say about this restaurant which next time I will say I'll pass on is the Pressed Coffee! It is really fantastic! I would only stop in here to grab a coffee. Food 1-10 was a 2, coffee a 10, and service considering our server was constantly MIA was a 3. 

I do not recommend this restaurant.
