Likely one of the most saddened persons in Las Vegas when The Griddle Cafe at SLS suddenly shuttered, but impressed by Northside Cafe during a substantial breakfast just days after the switch, it was on the invite of SBE's Director of Dining that myself and five friends sat down to experience the restaurant's newly launched dinner and late night menus this past Saturday - a total of 32 plates showing a great degree of diversity with the majority far better than one would expect from 24/7 dining, though one specific section proved barely passable at best.

Admitting up front that the experience was fully comped, a few requests made of the kitchen while the vast majority of the items were served carte blanche, it was at a large booth in the far corner of the room that our party was sat and with IHeartRadio playing lightly overhead the meal was presented with exemplary service, first bites of shrimp atop popcorn perhaps a bit *too* clever for their own good while the stack of banana pancakes served a strong reminder of the high quality marking my aforementioned breakfast, the pure maple syrup presented steaming hot and drizzled liberally to our heart's content.

Opting next to send out dinner entrees, the later rounds focused on recently launched dim sum and Chinese plates, Northside Cafe certainly is not skimping on ingredient quality as both the rib eye and filet were served a juicy medium rare, the trio of snappy shrimp deftly doused in garlic while asparagus and potatoes were both as good as upscale steakhouse fare.

Blase as ever about salmon, the fish itself nicely cooked though a bit lost amidst all the brightly citrus sauce, a duo of pastas was presented simultaneously with far more balance, the fettuccine cooked perfectly al dente with heavy cream laced inn garlic while the cheesy pockets of ravioli were quickly devoured by the left half of the table, the simplicity of the crushed tomatoes and herbs praised by an Italian at the table reminiscing of his grandmother's red sauce.

Transitioning abruptly to Chinese, the next nine plates offered on a newly launched list of dim sum, suffice it to say that substantial tweaks are needed before this part of the menu can be appropriately recommended, the fried items by far the best of the group while pork was sticky and far too sweet, the steamed options universally overcooked as if by an inexperienced hand,

Admittedly shocked by the drop in quality, and soon to become even more confused by the fact that actual Chinese entrees were confidently prepared as if by an entirely different kitchen compared to those sent out before, it was to a whole steamed bass that eyes were next widened, the flesh rich and moist with a delicate bit of lemon and lovely top-notes of scallions and lemongrass.

At this point already overserved, some items boxed for home while others unfortunately went to waste, it was still to nine more full-size plates that the slowly dwindling table was treated, the salt and pepper  dazzling beneath delicate batter while fried rice, chow fun, and everything made with noodles was on par with the best of Spring Mountain Road, without too substantial a hike in price.

Dining partners already waiving the white flag, or at least folding napkins and debating the pros and cons of renting a room within the hotel rather than carrying the food coma home, it was with five desserts that the evening would end and although the cookie was far less 'gooey' than one may have expected there was no lack of quality anywhere else, the fruited options each outstripping modest expectations while the peanut butter cup studded cheesecake was silky, smooth, and not oversweetened, the bread pudding taking the opposite path in offering the steamy custard block topped in ice cream with a shallow pool of golden brown sauce.

****Offering better food than almost any 24/7 spot in Las Vegas, with prices far more forgiving for comparable items than at places further South on the Strip, Northside Cafe continues to impress on a level far greater than passers-by may notice, the dim-sum menu a lone exception while breakfast, dinner, Chinese plates, and desserts offer plenty of well-priced hits.
Great experience! Good customer service, loved the food Oliver was amazing. Thank you Northside!

So my daughter and I own a daycare and decided to get away last minute. We stayed at the sls hotel and decided to dine at this restaurant. This restaurant is so amazing!!! The first day me and my daughter had the philly cheese sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The next day I ordered the omelet and it was over cooked. The place was so busy, I asked to speak with the manager Kenyan and he immediately took care of everything. Kenyan was so nice, our server was nice and this place have the best food. I'll be back!!!

stayed at SLS and got back to the hotel around 3 and I needed water ---just iced cold water. but instead of paying $5 for a bottle ben and i decided to grab a "snack".  ben got the pastrami with fries and i got a bowl of fruit. 
service was sooooo slow and food was helllla greasy but it was convenient and decent priced.

Very poor customer service. Rude waitress indicating we aren't the only table their serving to relax lol hello aren't you suppose to be able to handle many tables at once. In general SLS has a bad service

I have to say. For a restaurant with A LOT of options, it really does a pretty good job with quality.

I'm spoiled by the delicious and authentic food in Hollywood so I was a little skeptical of this place.

I've had breakfast here every day, usually ordering the side of egg whites with a side of wheat toast (I ask for no butter) and a coffee (only $11). I don't eat much in the morning so this suited me best.

I tried the bean and rice bowl (no cheese, no meat) and it was delicious. The kung pao chicken isn't bad. It's not authentic, but you get the decent flavor you're asking for.

I also tried the wonton soup. This is why I deducted one star. The wontons were just meatballs wrapped in wonton paper and they were completely bland with absolutely no seasoning or flavor. This grossed me out so I left them alone. The soup was okay and so were the noodles. I just added the chili paste to give it life.

Today I tried their oatmeal for breakfast and it's okay. I don't normally like oatmeal but I'm trying to eat better so that's on me, not them.

I will say the service varies. My first time eating here was mediocre. The rest of the times were very pleasant.

I recommend it for their options if you're in the SLS hotel and hungry. Their prices are a bit high (per normal in Vegas), but they're reasonable compared to other places in this hotel.

I would definitely come back.

Service was very good but that's where the goodness stopped. 

It was late so we opted to choose a few selections off of the Chinese small plates menu, although they do serve non-Chinese entrees as well. I thought since it was a Chinese cafe, the Chinese food would possibly be better. Nope. 

We started with the Hot & Sour soup. It was decent. A little thicker than I'm used to. It was much heavier than a broth consistency. Otherwise, it was pretty traditional. It actually was a tiny bit hot which I really appreciate. The flavor was okay. 

Next, the pork steamed buns, which took 20+ minutes to prepare per the server, were undercooked and doughy. This is one of my favorite dishes and I do know how it is when cooked correctly. They barely had any pork in them at all either. It was more of a very thin smear of pork paste when I opened it to see if it actually had any pork in it after not having any in my first 2-3 bites. The flavor was also missing. 

We also tried the pan fried dumplings. It was a combo of pork and shrimp. This did not work. At all. Weirdest fishy flavor ever. 

Next we ordered the veggie spring rolls because we were 0-2. They were okay. Traditional but again, no flavor. 

I would certainly skip this place unless it's after hours and it is the only restaurant in the SLS/W that is open 24/7.  But I would suggest staying away from the Chinese menu. I saw a pasta dish come out that looked good. 

In all fairness though, this cafe does the room service for the W and breakfast the following morning was good. I had the breakfast burrito and I would order it again. So I give 3 stars for that instead of the 2 stars originally planned.

Best late night spot on the strip ! First, you dont have to pay for parking to get here. 2nd , they have a locals menu which is a fraction of the regular menu. 3rd, best burger I've ever had in town w/ the delicious fries to complement.  4th, the chicken tenders are full of flavor, big and crunchy.  5th very quick and great service.  Try it, they wont disappoint
Great food and service.  For faster service sit at the countertop.  Had bacon and eggs however the waffle with strawberries looked Delish.

Food is good had the guacamole and chips and beef street tacos and have no complaints.  The tacos were really good and would definitely get them.again my girl had the bbq pork fried rice and said it was really good as well. Going to make this a spot we come to whenever in the strip and need a quick meal service was good and foodnl came out quickly.
Great food! Our server, Tony, he was really nice and accommodating. The Croisant bread pudding was BOMB! Sooooo good.

First time eating here.  Blueberry pancakes were so good they don't need syrup.  Everything was fresh and hot including the coffee.  This is my favorite breakfast spot to eat in Vegas.  Can't wait to try their lunch.

The food is really tasty and the service is top notch. We had a friendly charismatic server named "KC" that accommodated our late night drunken escapades. I requested celery instead of chips for my guacamole and to my surprise he was able to fulfill it with a smile. The Steak and eggs rocked and the chilaquilles were delicious....Don't miss out on an opportunity for good food and great service. Ask for Kassey to serve you....

We stopped in here for lunch, almost by accident. It ended up being a happy accident. Our original plan was to try KU Noodle, but they weren't open for lunch, so we looked  at the Northside Cafe Menu and decided to go with it.

Our Server, Wesley was there to greet us almost as soon as we sat down and was friendly and attentive throughout our meal. We started with The Shrimp Cocktail. A solid version of a Vegas classic. Six large, plump, sweet shrimp curled over a glass full of spicy cocktail sauce.

After  our earlier Vegas Taco Fiasco at Pink Taco, I had to try Northside's Baja Fish Taco's.  Spiced, Seared Mahi-Mahi, Pickled Slaw, Pico de Gallo, Cilantro and Sour Cream restored my faith in Vegas Taco possibilities. Flavorful and moist, I loved every bite! Diane had the Pork Carnitas Torta with Cotija Cheese, Charro Beans,
Jalape√±o Crema, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion and Avocado. She loved it so much I only got one little taste of the meat. What I had was rich and spicy.

Since this was a celebratory trip for us, we had several drinks. Diane's Spiked Lemonade was Sweet, Summery and packed quite a punch! After two she was feeling a little buzzed. I started with an excellent Peach Bellini and followed that up with my favorite drink of the trip. Unfortunately, I don't remember the name, but it was a play on a Mudslide.

Northside Cafe is rarity in Vegas. A high quality, enjoyable 24 hour Casino Diner. I can't wait to go back!

This was the first restaurant we saw when we walked into the New SLS casino. My wife and were very hungry so we choose the Northside. My wife said her food was ok. She is always nice and doesn't have a bad word to say about anyone. Me on the other hand, not so nice. I ordered eggs Benedict. The food was first given to another table and then it was given to us.  By that time the food was cold. When I first cut into the Eggs Benedict the eggs were overcooked. After our waiter served our food we've never saw him again until it was time to bring the check. He never even asked us how the food was. Not a good start for a new restaurant in the new casino.

Beware of undercooked eggs! But the manager was great in handling the situation that followed said raw eggs and was a very gracious host.

Also, their gluten free options are not clearly labeled and pretty confusing. But if you check with the kitchen, they will let you know what is naturally gf and what can be made as such. It just seems silly that they could label which pancakes could be made gluten free, but couldn't label anything else.
This was a great caf√© that we came in for brunch it had a good menu and we were in and out quickly anyone who wants a quick bite should come on by

The service for this place is horrible. The caf√© is not busy, and yet it is taking them more than 30 minutes to get our food out. One of the dishes ordered was a chicken noodle soup... How much work does it take to provide a chicken noodle soup? The food is average and the food is pricy. Never coming here again. Stay away fellow yelpers.

I had to write another review. The tomato soup was super delicious. Everything was just fine. Service was excellent. I believe Miguel was my waiter. Keep up the good work and I will keep telling people to go to Northside. I just wish you would open up a cafe in Henderson, NV.

We came for a late lunch on our stay on Tuesday afternoon. The service was below par and the food and atmosphere were OK. The restaurant was about 50% full when we were sat and our server was busy leaving us with about a 5 minute greet. She did give us a drive by about 3 minutes into the wait.

I had the blueberry pancakes ($11.95) which were delicious and my wife had the burger ($12.95) which was standard. The timing and communication of the kitchen wasn't that good as the food runner brought out my pancakes at least 5 minutes before my wife's burger arrived.

The menu is large and I would try other items maybe when the locals' discount is offered. Northside is your only option for breakfast and late night at SLS. I would revisit if I were in the hotel and hungry during these times. But it wouldn't be my first option at other times.

Their salsa tastes like marinara sauce.
Nobody wanted to serve us.  One server approached and asked if [guy's name] had taken our drink order yet.  No, he hasn't. So he took our order.
When we finished, another server approached and asked if we needed something and we said we needed the check.  He said, "Oh, [guy's name] hasn't been back yet?" and I said I hadn't seen him in a while.
You know that kind of half-assed service where none of the servers take ownership of your table and they act like they're doing you a favor since your real server has forgotten you?  This place.
Oh, and when they bring Chinese food/dim sum to the table they should bring it with all the Chinese condiments. They didn't.  
Poor service and the food was OK.

I had the pleasure of dining in The Northside Cafe on my first night in Vegas (Stayed at SLS for the first time as well with my boyfriend). I can honestly say amongst everything we had in our 3 day trip to Vegas, that this cafe was the BEST!(No, I am NOT kidding). We got the chicken tenders basket, which were the best tenders I have EVER had (sorry Culver's!) and my boyfriend got the nacho's and said they were "bomb-diggity" (basically, they were awesome).

We ate at many other "well known" establishments throughout our trip and were horribly disappointed, and spent WAY more money, I wish we had skipped a "must eat" restaurant (or two) and just eaten here again, and tried something new!

Servers are awesome and attentive, we will be staying at SLS on our next trip, and will absolutely be eating here (at least once or twice!). Highly recommend!

LOCAL MENU----ask them about it. Cuts the prices at least half of all the favorites on the menu. What once was $18.95 lowered to $10.95. INSANE!! All you need is an SLS Code Card and a Nevada ID. Nachos, northside burger and lemon drops were ordered which totaled to about $40, but would have been less if we weren't alcoholics. All in all worth the price for the local menu and will certainly try it again, if not for the taste, at least for the price.

Chilaquiles is the word here.... served verde style with an authentic chorizo that is hard to explain the flavor... little tangy a little cumino'ish.  Chips seemed homemade and retained a crispness all the way to the end... Mexican cheese and diced jalape√±o all played well together...
Worth a trip!
A nice clean typical in hotel restaurant but just what we needed after our night at SLS. Would return if I found myself that far down the strip again.

Very disappointing. We waiting a hour or more for food. We were a table of 6. Waitress was very inattentive. Once we received the food WE SENT IT ALL BACK!!!! It looked disgusting and tasted even worse!!!! Chicken fried rice wasn't fired just white rice w/ very minimal pieces of chicken. Pan fried noodles had some type of jelly looking stuff in them. Just gross !

This is a place to go when nothing else is open  servings are small so don't expect much I got the Adobe quesadilla they use the small taco tortillas for almost $11 this sucks this is my second time here first time was better this is not Bad it food is good if you can remember you had some gone fast...

Excellent yogurt parfait, hold the granola. 

Huge breakfast burrito serving
Regrettably we were in a rush. It was 7am, the place was empty and our server came through. Phew!

We were seated in a booth and he offered to bring us a check immediately after we ordered. Perfection. We needed to boggie fast- not your normal Vegas trip. 

My parfait was great. I thoroughly enjoyed it. My husband's burrito was massive and sufficient. It's a good diner. But that's what it is- a diner. So I'm basing my review with that category in mind. 4 stars for solid service and a quick meal, per our request. 

I ordered my parfait without granola - and it arrived as requested. It was delicious with large, ripe berries. Zero complaints with this visit and I would certainly return.

If you don't feel like driving to get something to eat, you better get in your car and get something to eat instead of settling for this place. Seriously.

The wait times here are asinine because they're probably understaffed, they're open 24 hours so when the clubs are closed, people flock here to get their grub on. In addition to that, they aren't exactly the nicest people probably because of the aforementioned reasons. It's just a bad recipe for a vicious cycle.

I ordered some sort of a skillet, I think. I said, "I think," because I was half asleep and pretty turnt when the food arrived, but what I know for a fact is that my girlfriend ordered a pesto sandwich with shrimp, but got chicken instead. She said something, but the waitress just sort of brushed it off and gave us an empty apology and went on with her life.

The food was mediocre and the worst part was that it was expensive mediocre food.

What would you expect of the hotel restaurant? Especially, walking in at 2:30 in the morning with a party of drunk companions? We were greeted by Stephanie, neatly dressed, awesome smile, wide awake, alert and humorous. She was patient with our tipsy friends and hinted what would be the best food on the small but varied menu. Her recommendations were awesome! I couldn't believe the piles of food that came out: giant mounds of barbecue laden nachos, perfectly cooked eggs with equally crisp and hot potatoes, and mondo burgers layered with delicious saut√©ed onions and peppers. Who would think that a cook would take such care and have such creative flair at 0300 in the morning? Great job all around. Thanks for helping to end the party in such a positive way and make our night perfect!

I stayed at the SLS for 13 days for work. When you do in-room dining, this is where you order your food from.

I ordered the Northside burger with NO bacon, the girl on the phone even repeated this back to me. The food arrives and the first thing I notice when I open the door, the hallway smells like medical supplies, it was pretty disgusting, but house-keeping is near by so I assumed that's what it was. I soon realize the smell is coming from the BAG they just delivered me! It was SICK! Completely unappetizing. If I didn't finish working 12 hours on my feet I would have stopped right there, but I'm starving so I quickly get the contents out of the bag and get it as far away from me as possible. I take a bite, and guess what, there is bacon. It was extremely disappointing for them to mess up my order like this, so I call back to inform them. The girl on the phone says they can either bring up a new one, or take it off my bill. At this point, I rather just go somewhere else and throw this in the trash, so I tell them to take it off my bill, she says okay she will get the manager so they can remove the room charge. Two days later when I go to checkout, surprise they DID NOT remove the charge as I was told!!!!!!! The front desk was useless to help me and I had to fill out a form to "dispute the charge." Why should I have to "dispute" anything when it's what I was promised?

Completely unforgivable lack of communication and professionalism in their operation, it is embarrassing.

DO NOT ORDER IN-ROOM DINING WHILE STAYING AT THE SLS HOTEL!
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

This was completely unexpected from a LV cafe. The menu was straightforward, service was great (thanks Ismail!), and the food was wonderful. I had no line to wait in, at like 9 am on a Saturday, and was offered  a nice table. I had the pork carnitas hash, a side of bacon a glass of orange juice and delicious coffee made at the table in a French press.

For me, some saut√©ed onions and peppers would bring a nice dimension to the hash, but it was delicious as is.

Well done!

After trying to eat at another restaurant at the SLS(where the experience was disappointing), my daughter and I ate here. Within seconds of sitting down, we were greeted and menus were placed. The server got our drink order and answered questions about the menu. The food and service were amazing. As a local, we will definitely be back.
Typical breakfast an cafe food plus a bunch of Asian dishes. The food is good but nothing special. Rather large selection of items.

Enjoyed a decent breakfast here on a Monday morning after the big fight weekend in Vegas. We were statying at SLS and I was given a $50 food & beverage credit so we decided to use it at Northside. 

We waited about 5 mins to be seated as they literally have a velvet rope for the line to be seated. The hostess was nice and so was our server. She checked in on us often. The only misstep would be she forgot to bring us the strawberry jam and I had to remind her... I opted for the ham & eggs. It was a big slice of bone-in ham and I went with scrambled eggs. It comes with breakfast potatoes which would be better if they crisped them up a little bit. The ham was great and filling. Good smoky flavor and thick cut to satisfy the hungriest carnivore. The eggs were just ok. Needed salt & ketchup as usual. You also get a choice of toast and I went with sourdough. White bread is not an option. I got a side of bacon on the side and that was good.

Northside Cafe is a decent option for breakfast/lunch inside the SLS. It's a scaled down diner or family restaurant. It's too bad they didnt stay The Griddle because those pancakes were legendary... Service was good. Food was ok.

Just bad. 
Service: I had to go get the waiter who were all (about 4 of them) huddled up laughing in this open door room to the left of the bar looking like they were all discussing a recent episode of their favorite sitcom. Bald guy with the beard especially never came back to our table with an answer after I asked about my Yelp check in. Just bad...

Food: I had coagulated pan fried noodles and 3 spongy dumplings. Bad

Drinks: some passion fruit drink. It was delicious, but tasted like juice

Don't go...

I had the spicy shrimp tacos and a some of the saut√©ed kale. The shrimp tacos were pretty good, the pico was slightly overkill for the shrimp. Shrimp was cooked perfectly juicy but would've preferred them crispy just to add more texture to the pico and pickled radishes & carrots that it came with. The kale was amazing; just the right amount of saltiness and flavor. 
I was not too impressed by the service--the waiter didn't really have any particular suggestions for me when I was I decisive, so I'm not too sure how knowledgeable he is about the menu.
Gave them 4 stars bc I just love their "upscale diner" concept and I am definitely thinking about coming back again just to explore their menu.
Nachos were great! Large portion, good flavor, and definitely worth it. Also Joseph was an awesome server! Handled my allergy like a champ. I'll be back!

Clean place, love it when I can see into the kitchen.  Caesar salad and beef tacos.  Very tasty food and really friendly staff. Good value for hotel restaurant.

Cheers!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner.  It was our first time coming here and I'm so glad we did!  Our server Christian was excellent! He greeted us with a "good morning" even though it was 6:30 at night.  We all had an "only in Vegas" moment!  Overall service was great.  Lots of hard working people there. I recently became a member of SLS rewards program which offers great deals especially for locals.  

Now on to the food.  We had a 2 for 1 deal and I ordered the tomato soup and grilled cheese.  It was delicious and cheesy!  The soup was rich and tasty.  My bf ordered the Philly cheese steak.  It came with sweet potato fries that were also yummy! We were both too full to finish.  This was a great choice for a date night dinner.  Thanks Northside!

Finally decided to eat here after 10 days in this hotel on Saturday morning before checkout.

The food was pretty good although the room itself was very loud and our waitress was fairly unattentive.

As you may know by reading my reviews I always go back to the value of the meal and experience and this one was really a miss in both!

Even though the food was good the pricing was a little high and overall between poor service and a loud room I wouldn't go back.

Vegas offers very few opportunities for social interaction and this spot isn't one of them.

Thanks for reading my review sorry I didn't right on this one but there's really not much more to say.
The food is great like normal but service still stinks. Our server came to the table took our order and never returned to check on us, until after we spoke to the manager because we wanted our bill.

Decent breakfast for standard LV Strip pricing. Service can be spotty but had a great server this morning - Joseph - fast, personable, positive attitude... super solid server. Should be hired at a 5 star Michelin restaurant. This review is for him, not restaurant.

I'm so sad to say that we had a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE LAST NIGHT. We have eaten many times here and it was great! It's now a year later and we were hungry after a  concert about 1am so yes it was late, maybe that's why it wasn't so good BUT it doesn't give the staff a reason to be RUDE completely ignore us, 4 tables were sat after us and were served before us.

I guess there is a late menu now which has like 3 items on it! All we wanted was a grill cheese! How hard is that! Then out of the 3 items on the menus they offer late they didn't have hal

Maybe this place is still good early just don't go after midnight if your hungry!
Terrible terrible service.  Workers ignored us in a nearly completely empty restaurant.  Some staff looked at us only to ignore us.  Never eat here

My go to favorite spot for hungover breakfast and late nite munchies at SLS. Waiter Christian gave phenomenal service catering to our many specific requests of on the side this and that and extra sauce and to go water cups. As picky eaters as we were he gave stellar service and the food was delish as usual. Only qualm I have is that the menu changed and they got rid of the top selling egg scramble with spicy sauce and tuna sandwich and other favorites!! So mad at ownership for that but hope they will read this and bring it back.

Not bad of a restaurant more like 2.5-3stars , pretty decent food for a good price. Doesn't cost you an arm and a leg to get full haha.

Very spacious lots of tables and booths, and it's self seating.

We originally came for the $12 prime rib only to find out it's a deal that only happens on Fridays but we decided to stay and check it out anyways. 

They have a weird half and half style where they have a full menu just of Chinese food and a menu just with cafe food ie. burgers and pastas. 

Hot & sour soup 3.5/5 - Was actually very surprised it was good, thought it was going to be super Americanized but it's not

We got the 3 course meal for $20 where we chose -- 

Caesar salad 4/5 - Can't really go wrong with salad but the Parmesan slices were just a little too big of chunks and their dressing is very subtle but not in a bad way

Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken 2/5 - Pretty bland and oily, I prefer my pasta on the softer side as well. The sides of garlic bread were bomb though crispy on the outside but soft in the middle I could've eaten a whole basket ! 

New York cheesecake 2.5/5 - Your basic cheesecake with strawberry syrup on top with a few fresh strawberries, probably wouldn't order again but it wasn't the worst.

Exhausted from walking around all day. Didn't really know what to eat so we decided to stop by and eat here. Thank god there was no wait. Hostesses were really nice sat us down. server was "Juan Mayorga" he approached our table took drink orders, Was really nice, talkative and asked about our day and what shows were watching ect... Then we ordered Buffalo Chicken Wings, Nachos and Spicy Shrimp Street Tacos. Food was "okay" but the server was "excellent". I would go back if I want a quick bite but I would want Juan to serve us!

Where do I begin?? This place could and should be so much better!

First of all, the staff here doesn't seem genuinely welcoming or caring. Feels like they just want to get you in and out in a hurry.

As far as food goes...
Had the nachos one night, and they were pretty good, flavorful and the portion size was decent. My server, a hispanic man, acted like he didnt give two sh*ts about me. Ice water they served tasted funny.

Came in for breakfast as well...had the corned beef hash. Big chunks of undercooked potatoes and chunks of corned beef. Had to cut up the potatoes and flavor it all up with salt, pepper and Tapatio. My server James was nice, but I felt rushed with him, too.

Staff: Be sure to constantly check the condiments at the tables. I was missing pepper and Tobasco. Very basic!

**TIP: Call ahead and make a reservation if you insist on eating here

At the SLS casino, brekky is a bit limited.  With everyone hungover, or tired from a night out, this spot is in HIGH demand.  Knowing that, this place is a large restaurant and can accommodate big parties.

One comment about the hostesses...they act as if you need them.  They also have an attitude (they think they are better than you because they are sitting you?) I'm not sure. 

But to the food.  The waffle with all the fixings was great!  Such a large serving with fresh fruit and very tasty with your choice of syrup.  This plate cost the Vegas price of $14.95.

Terrible service. They were not busy, only an 1/8 of the restaurant had customers and still took 20 minutes to get coffee. Took another 10 before he came back to take out order and then when the order arrived they failed to tell us there were onions and green onions in the potatoes. Very disappointed for the slow service for 3 drinks, 3 plates of breakfast food for $70. Will not be returning.

So glad this wonderful lunch spot is in my hotel! We were seated by the kind hostess. The decor inside is seems new and looks cool. Very clean !

We ordered 4 items and it kind of took a long time to come outside but it was neatly organized on the plates. The food was delicious i would totally recommend this spot to others. 

The bill was $64 and i got a free orange juice lol! Very affordable. Thumbs up!

A ok!!!

Huevos rancheros was fantastic.  I huge red chili on top,  packed with flavor. The churro beans are new to me-- very good-- they're pinto with pork. 

Mimosas are only $7 (good for vegas!) and strong!  Well worth the money. 

The rest of the table ordered french toast,  2 eggs with chicken apple sausage and bacon.  All delicious. 

So, the wait was crazy. Came at 10 am on Saturday and waited about an hour from being seated to eating food.  But the food was so good,  it was almost worth waiting that long. 

Manager Eric was amazing.  We inquired about the wait and he made us feel like we were being taken care of. Our waiter,  Jamie, was great too. Did his job.  Seemed very busy with tons of tables and was responsive when we called for him. AND he went out of his way to go to the change machine for us when we needed small bills. 

I would come back for the solid meal (and since they're open all day AND serve breakfast all day). I'll just be mindful of the potential wait time.

The food was pretty good. Nothing great but definitely not bad. Very basic menu with a lot of variety, which I like when I don't know what I want or when with a group. 

I dined here twice on my trip in Vegas. 

The first was right around midnight, my BF and I ordered to-go meals to take to the room. The girl was nice and after taking our order, offered for us to sit in a corner booth to wait for our food since it would take 10 minutes or so. We took our seat and waited. and waited. and waited. a good 25-30 minutes later, we realized we hadn't gotten our food, and not one person came up to us to let us know our food was ready or not. So I got up to ask the girl what was going on, she had our food sitting on the back counter. She asked my name and gave me the bag. Once in the room, the food was pretty lukewarm. Not a huge deal, but I just wish she would have kept a better read of the situation. We were maybe 5 steps from where she was, right around the corner. Aw well. Food was fine.

The second time was the morning we were leaving, grabbing breakfast before hitting the road. The server was nice, took our order since we were ready quickly. Food and drinks came out semi quick and were all delivered by different people. When our food was dropped off, I asked for more ketchup since ours was empty. He said, "okay" in a somewhat confused voice and never returned. A server never really came back until we flagged someone down that we were ready for the check, after sitting there with empty plates for a few minutes. Now, I have worked as a server in the past, so I get it when you're busy, but there is still a way to keep up with your tables or have someone else do it. The real problem is that the restaurant was not super busy. maybe 3/4 full and I saw at least 10-12 employees buzzing around so didn't seem under staffed. 

Eat here if you don't care about customer service or if you're not in a rush. The food is decent and they have a lot to chose from. At least when you DO get to interact with the employees, most of them are quite nice.

Do not eat here! Got the worst case of food poisoning ever. The chow fun with gravy tasted a bit weird, asked the waitress to bring me a different one and it was pretty much the same plate reheated. I have never felt so sick in my life.

We have been eating here almost since they opened, We are usually get the Sirloin it is awesome! The steaks are always very good but that one is our favorite.
From all the times we have eaten there we had one time with a problem, My husband ordered the Alfredo dish and the pasta was not done and it did not have a good taste at all, I even tried it cause he thought it was him just not liking it , he told our waiter and the waiter said no problem ordered what he wanted in place of it with no problem what so ever. The manager on duty even came over to make sure everything was better with the dinner he received after that. They were both very apologetic. 
We have always had good service, one of our favorite waiters are no longer there but we have had a couple after that we really like.
The place can get pretty busy at times especially at dinner time, but the wait is not usually that long. 
We really like that they are open 24 hrs, some nights when your playing the machines time passes by so fast it is hard to find a place open. 
We have tried a few of their desserts and they are very good too!
Worth checking out when you want some good food!
Oliver is the best server!  He made excellent recommendations, made us laugh, suggested a sub shop in Jersey, and brought us coffee to go.  He made our trip

this is one of my favorite places to come and eat when I am in Las Vegas staying at the SLS Hotel my server Juan O is  very attentive, this place is a great place for a multitude of menu items and you can watch it being prepared fresh in front of you in the in the kitchen. Make sure that you try the breakfast quesadilla it is scrumptious

First time here. We stoped for breakfast... Everything looked so good!
We shared the continental breakfast and breakfast tacos. Both were delicious. Portions were large so we might not need to get lunch. Our service was great. Prompt and polite. 
So many good places to eat in Vegas! 
This place is well worth considering.
Ate here for lunch , our server Christian was excellent, on the ball and was more than competent in his job which is rare these days. Our food was good not amazing, worth the money, will return.

We had the Nachos and chicken wings... WOW!!! Definitely surprised with how great both items were. For desert we had the banana split, best banana split I have ever had. Super soft smooth creamy ice cream and the flavors exquisite! Coming back again! Also our server was great!

Food was just alright. I'd compare it to Denny's but pricier. With that being said, I should have just gone to Denny's. Had to send my first dish back, the waitress assured me that the cook wouldn't spit in my food though so that was a plus, right?
Went twice: once for lunch and once for dinner. Food was excellent  and pricepoint quite low for Vegas. The three star ranking is due to the total lack of service both times

The food was fantastic, the service was great, the atmosphere was nice, BUT the portions weren't worth the price. $15 for two slices of French toast, even in Vegas, is a bit ridiculous (even if the French toast was delicious).

Honestly the most disgusting food I've ever attempted to eat. Completely overpriced garbage! Unless your trashed and just need calories don't eat here. I tried the Chinese food pan noddles disgusting rotted beef rubber noddles smelled like leftovers from a fridge that was a month old. Wings were worse than a fast food joint nachos were gross. Honestly replacing this restaurant with a Taco Bell would be better. The food will make you puke! I picked this hotel because it has 24 hr food. I wish I had known the "24hr food" was only from this gross place. Ohhh and if you expect in room dining be prepared for a 1-2hr wait for the shitty food from this kitchen.

Service was okaaaay, it started fine but felt like the server forgot about us after the first drink refill lol. 

Food was delicious! Great menu selections, interior is nice and contemporary, kind of reminds me of chipotle in styling. I got the street tacos, delicious, tiny and lacked the traditional char you get from real street tacos but still yummy. You could eat each taco in three bites or less. 

My friends got the breakfast burrito which looked very large and impressive, everyone cleared their plates - must have been yummy :)

Breakfast was good I had the strawberry waffles and breakfast potatoes.  Everything tastes very fresh and full of flavor. The place is pretty dark and the server wasn't over the top but we had to wait a few minutes for our refill only after placing the cup on the end of the table.

Breakfast: It was a busy Saturday morning. My husband and I were seated right away. I ordered ham & eggs with potatoes and my husband ordered huevo rancheros. We were both happy with our foods. The ham was really thick and juicy! 4/5 

Dinner: LOLA was our server. She was really fast and efficient. She took care of us. Thanks LOLA! 

My husband ordered the northside burger with sweet potato fries & a pickle. The burger was bomb! The meat was juicy. The bacon was thick. The sweet potato fries were crispy and delicious! Don't forget to ask for ranch. I ordered chicken noodle soup. It was good. Felt like I was home away from home. 5/5

My friends and I were so happy that this restaurant was in our hotel.  The avocado toast is simply delicious.  We also tried their late night menu.  I couldn't get enough of beef chow fun dry noodle.  Definitely a great place for homestyle food.

The Griddle Cafe with unreal sized items had lines formed a million miles long to join in the eating frenzy.  I was literally crushed when I learned that The Griddle Cafe at SLS Hotel closed, and another diner-restaurant turned up in its place.  Then, combined with the fact that buffet has closed at SLS over the last year, too, well, I reluctantly tried the Northside Cafe.

The menu is nice.  Open 24/7, they have lots of options and separate menus for each sitting.

I went for breakfast, and returned gladly for breakfast again the next.  A nice experience with a small french press for coffee ($4.95), the scrumptious and elaborate Greek Yogurt Parfait ($9.95), and the Breakfast Burrito ($13.95) were all very worthy.

Mixed great breakfast food with lovely service and you have yourself a winner.

I still cannot get over their steak and eggs breakfast plate..by far the best I've had! This cafe in SLS hotel is open 24/7 but the food are delicious!  Prices are decent as well and the servers are friendly! I recommend this place for brunch or late meal after a night out

Pretty good food but the service is awful. The first time we went here we sat at the bar and had awful service. The bartender ignored us almost the entire time. The second time the manager had to come over and help us/force the waitress to help us. Foods good though. And French press coffee!

The customer service here is ok. It could of been better. The food was delicious! I ordered the Bloody Mary drink here and it was very different as in it had a sweet sugared bacon strip in it as a garnish. It was surprisingly really good! The drink in general was really good.

Also I ordered the huevos ranchero plate. It had two fried tortillas with chorizo, beans, cheese, and two sunny side eggs on top! It was awesome and I'm glad I ordered it. It was really big and it will definitely fill you up. The best part is that this restaurant is open 24 hours!

Great restaurant wasn't sure what to order but the pretty server Wendy was very helpful with the recommendations I had the huevos rancheros and mimosas are only 7 dollars great deal for Vegas and the food was delicious great staff and atmosphere

The best entrees and it's great that they have locals pricing. What I like the most about this restaurant compared to many they do not give slim portions as many restaurants on Fremont and the Strip do. Every dollar you spend is justified. Second I like is variety. There are good Chinese dishes like my favorite Kung Pao Chicken. I officially say that this restaurant has the best prices, excellent menu selection and you get good size proportions that will definitely fill you up.
Great breakfast food, and terrific wait staff!  I would definitely hit this place up again if I were in the area.  The server was funny and hustled, the eggs were great, and the place was fun.

We checked into SLS and were searching for dinner options when we landed on this place.  The decor gives me NY pizza joint vibes.  I'd say the interior is casual and comfy.  So we decided on giving the Chinese dishes a try even though we were skeptical.  Man were we surprised!  The Yang Chow fried rice had chunky fresh ingredients and the flavor was on point.   My husband raved about the salted pork with century egg congee.  The seafood and tofu claypot was so delicious.  And I'm usually not into claypots!  The tofu was lightly fried and when you bite into it, the inside just melts in your mouth.  Every ingredient in the claypot was cooked just right - tender and tasty.

The next morning we decided to give their breakfast a try.  I was so disappointed by the wait time.  We sat there for probably 40min after placing our order.  The manager apologetically explained how the printer wasn't printing our order back in the kitchen.  Honestly, I didn't understand the hold up but I was appeased by his apology and hospitality.  The blueberry pancake, when it finally showed up, tasted heavenly!  They totally made it up to us.  My husband's French toast was done perfectly as well.  They mixed up our egg orders (he wanted 2 and I only wanted 1) but that was alright.  

Overall, I'd recommend this place to weary travelers!  It can get a little crazy when the place gets crowded but the food is worth everything.

Change in plans with work so went downstairs from my room to get some lunch. Had the turkey club. Came out on a roll which was slightly stale but that was fine because there was plenty of food otherwise. Steak fries were good. Avocado on sandwich was fresh.  Sat at counter and service was attentive.  24 with tax and tip for a diet and a sandwich. Pretty standard I think for Vegas. I did see the fried rice come out. It looked like it was not the best thing on the menu.

Just checked into the SLS and needed a quick bite to eat. Wasn't a terrible experience but definitely could have done without eating here.

The hostesses and waiters are polite and very helpful and attentive but the food is eh... Iffy. 
And it also took forever to come out, in a non-crowded place.

I had the popcorn shrimp w/ cocktail sauce and it was okay. It came with pieces of popcorn sprinkled about the plate. Cool theme I suppose. Anyway... It was seasoned well and the sauce was tasty, only came with a few shrimp though. 

The chicken tacos were a big disappointment. Chicken was cooked well but not seasoned at all, bland. Tortillas were dry, pico de gallo was okay but as a whole it wasn't pleasant. 

I think the best bet going here will be to order breakfast food(served all day)...
